review_body: I came to this hotel with y tour group and it looks and feels amazing. Very grand with plenty of staff, who bore every time you pass. Set in a great location on Daiba close to the stations and most of the sites.A choice off breakfast locations in the morning with an American, Japanese our sushi option. Rooms are very comfortable with tea making options.

Large upscale hotel in Odaiba. Average service. The rooms are pretty large for Tokyo. They provide everything you need; robe, toiletries, rags, towels, water. Although a little pricey this place is worth it.

Everything is top notch, the room, bathroom, the staff, breakfast options, the access to nearby places such as train station, malls, odaiba sea side park, and many more. Also there's free shuttle bus that runs through the city, where u can just hop in right in front of the hotel lobby, talks about convinient. I am definitely coming back here when I visit Odaiba again.

This hotel has every advantage on the great location, just a few steps off the Daiba station, easy access to Yurikamome line which direct to Tokyo Big Sight- the major exhibition place I need to go to every day. Breakfast at Japanese restaurant on the 3rd floor is great, so do the buffet on the 1st floor. Great room space and cozy bed. There are big 2 shopping malls nearby within walking distance called Aqua City and Diver City.

This was the second time I stayed at Daiba which is about 30 minutes train ride from Shinjuku. The hotel is next to 3 shopping malls, with lots of shops and eateries. The area is very quiet and scenic. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here. The check in and out were very fast. The room is spacious for Japanese standard, it's clean and the bed is comfortable. The hotel staffs are all very polite and helpful. The MRT is right next to the hotel and there was a 24 hours convenient store to the right of the main entrance of the hotel.

I don't know who built this, but they are clearly off the mark. Good looking entrance. Lots of good looking marble. That's where the luxury experience starts. And where it stops. Terrible service at check in. Old looking corridors. Old looking rooms: already looks dated despite the place being not that old. Room type given not in line with booking. Room after changing not spotless clean. Quality of built poor: I was on a very high floor yet heard traffic all night. Quality of bed OK. All standard luxury amenities - pool, steam, gym etc - come at a supplement despite the already high price of the room. The only reason I don't give 1 to this place is that the bar on the top floor has a very nice view. I won't be back...

This place is nice. Very good location also. But it was absurd that they charged you for the use of gym. Is it normal in Japan? I booked this hotel for my daughters for them to be comfortable. They even asked her the deposit since the credit card payment was with my name, not hers even though the room charged was already paid. When I was booking, I was actually considering to book Hilton. Why I ended up booking this hotel? Big regret.
user_location: Central Mexico and Gulf Coast, Mexico
user_name:
chuchucoco
Central Mexico and Gulf Coast, Mexico

review_body: We shared our time in Tokyo between the hurly burly of Shinjuku and the relative quiet of this big modern hotel in Daiba at the other end of the city. The style of the hotel is Las Vegas: big rooms, wide hallways, grand foyers, lots of marble and glitz. Check in was professional. We were initially given a lower floor room, but when we requested an upper floor it was quickly accommodated. Very nice - as was the beautiful view of Mt Fuji and the harbour from our room on the 21st floor.The room was big, with great beds, and wonderful amenities. It even had round bamboo sticks in the closet with which to massage the soles of your feet after a day of walking through Tokyo.My only quibble with this hotel was breakfast. While the food was fine with a mixture of western and Japanese foods including fresh fruit, the dining room was too small to accommodate all the morning guests wanting breakfast at about the same time. It was interesting to note that the foyers and public rooms were huge, yet the breakfast room necessitated guest to get a number and wait until you were called when a table became available. This issue also resulted in the breakfast buffet being crowded as people bumped into each other given the limited and poorly designed space. But that is a minor quibble we dealt with by getting to the dining room earlier. Daiba is a fascinating look into the future from the light rail we took to get there to the shops and exhibit halls. including the giant Ferris wheel (which was well worth it).

This is a "grand" hotel in scale - enormous compared to most Japanese accommodation. The foyer is huge. The rooms are spacious. Everything is marble and shining. But the service (at reception, the bar and breakfast restaurants) during my three night stay was at best chaotic and at worst sullen - a total contrast to every other hotel experience I've had in Japan. The bar has a STUNNING view, but it's very expensive, the bartenders seemed to resent our presence, and last drinks are 11pm. The beds were comfy, the breakfast buffet really good, and it was totally fine as a conference hotel, but I wouldn't be rushing back...

This is my first time to live in Daiba! Not bad, this is a nice hotel! It is near Daiba station. 3 min walk to the shopping Mall! The room is big and comfortable! You can take limousine bus to/from airport directly!

I stayed at Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba for 3 nights in early October 2019. Mine was a Club Breeze Superior Double Room with the view of the famous Rainbow Bridge and also with Executive Lounge access, meaning that checkin was done in the private lounge with exceptional personal attention. Totally impressive. I could even sneak to the lounge during breaks of my conference held in the hotel for a cafe latte and a snack—what a lovely alternative to avoid the queue for conference refreshments.My spacious room (42m2) was on the 26th floor with a spectacular view of the Bay and the Rainbow Bridge. As with my experience with most of not all Japanese hotels, the room was well maintained and kept extremely clean. There was everything one would need: amenities including Mikimoto (yes, by the luxious Japanese Akoya pearl brand) skincare products, high-quality Imabari towels, bathrobes, slippers, bottled water, an espresso machine and, most usefully, a free mobile phone with free internet access during one’s whole stay.Breakfast was included in my room rate, chosen from buffet and traditional Japanese. I ended up enjoying breakfast with a magnificent view at the 30/F restaurant in the first two mornings and a traditional Japanese one in the third. Both choices were fabulous: great food and impeccable service.Daiba is close (a 20-min shuttle bus ride) to the Haneda International Airport, which is a lot more convenient that the Narita International Airport. I will certainly be back to Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba when I visit the area again.

A very grandiose looking hotel all around with nothing lacks thereof except their mattress, it’s too soft and made my backache everybody after getting up from bed. They have 3 different breakfast bar to choose from for breakfast, which is great.

After Osaka Universal studio , decide to try disneySea, so we book this hotel. it take about 30mins from hotel to Disneyland/sea. as from hotel to airport, as it stop at few hotel also, it take about 90mins. overall, is a good hotel that can let you travel around the city by various train to experience each shopping mall, sign seeing and interesting discovery about japan! I like the part when i misplace my phone wire in the room, the staffs put in extra effort to locate it, although it cannot be find at the end, but good experience to know this hotel provide excellent customer service! well done!

Our family of 5 stayed 5 nights in 2 connecting rooms. The rooms were huge and very clean. Beds were firm and hotel was very generous with toiletries. Although our room was on the 11th floor, we had a good view of fireworks & the rainbow bridge. Theres a small cafe (serving a reasonably priced breakfast) & a bakery just outside the hotel. The hotel is well connected to the Daiba station on the Yurikammone line & to Aqua City & Diver City (good for lunch/dinner). We visited the onsen which was an easy 20-min walk back to the hotel. We took the 1 day tour with JTB tours to Mt Fuji cos it seemed to be the only tour which did a pick up directly from the hotel. Also took the Good Neighbour shuttle bus to Disneyland.The only downside is that the hotel is a little far from Shinjuku/Shibuya (about 45 to 60 min by train). Otherwise it was ideal for the family - clean & spacious with lots of food & shopping options.

This hotel is on the middle of nowhere. It is literally a 45 minute train ride to Find a or Shibuya so be prepared to travel of you want to see anything out Tokyo. Great breakfast but at $45 it should be so eat up.Only a short walk to the Maraikan Museum which is OK but not the best in the world.Rooms very comfortable and well serviced and all with the hitech toilets that seem to be everywhere. Even the seat is warm!The 30th floor bar has the most amazing views but don't go there for a night of drinking. It will cost a fortune. One beer was 1500 yen, that is about U$13.Three places for breakfast..all the same cost but different food. The Japanese set menu breakfast is really a meal so perhaps not such bad value of you like miso soup and fish in the morning. Food generally was very good... Of all styles. Comfortable and quality at a price

If you arrive one hour in avance (for example at 2pm) they will no even let you talk to the check in staff. You MUST wait until 3pm whatever happens. They don’t care if you spent the night in the plane or if your room may be ready half an hour early. Do not expect any kindness. Military rule.Rooms and service are probably good, but they master the art to make you feel unwelcome.

Stayed 4 nights in a triple room for 3 adults and there was plenty of space to move. The hotel is a minute walk from the monorail station which can get you to all rail routes. A number of large malls are 2-3 minutes walk with plenty of options to eat at. They have a free DisneySea and Disneyland shuttle service. The bar on the 30th floor has a GREAT view and good drinks! We will definitely stay here again!!!

This hotel is in the perfect location. Odaiba has so much to offer in the way of things to do and eat without the crowds of downtown Tokyo but easy access Tokyo. The room was immaculate and pretty spacious. The hotel staff was very courteous to my family's needs.

This hotel was the best location for us on a recent trip to Tokyo. The room sizes are much larger than most hotels in Tokyo. Conveniently located near rail, bus and taxi services, it was perfect for us. There are a few shopping malls with restaurants, fast food places within short walking distances. The quietness of the location was perfect. The staff at this hotel were simply wonderful. The rail network is an absolutely joy. We spent 4 nights and managed to see a fair amount of Tokyo.We stayed again at this hotel at the end of the trip for the return trip back home. The rooms are well appointed ( not modern ) and catered well for our stay. I did not find this hotel fairly well priced. It is a bit expensive. Not sure if the Rugby World cup pushed hotel prices up.Nevertheless, we will not hesitate to return to this Hotel. Highly recommended.

Hotel certainly had a “grand” design. Seemed designed for weddings and large functions rather than groups or individuals.Couldn’t handle the large numbers at Breakfast.Our group were told our rooms wouldn’t be free until 4pm. But I don’t believe that none of our group rooms would be free until 4pm!Had food/beverage options in the lounge in the evening. But the quality was very poor and for what it was the price was excessive. Very poor offering. When I complained that the chips were cold and soggy they couldn’t accept that they should replace them!Staff lacked customer relationship skills.

Stayed n the Grand Nikko twice this past summer and the hotel is very good! location is excellent and easy to travel by train to anywhere from here.only down dside was the fee to use the pol when it was 40c and they wanted $30.00 us dollars per day! crazy..

Great size room, amazing sushi breakfast and the pool area is lovely. Would recommend you go to the rooftop bar as the view is spectacular .location is beside the train station, very easy to navigate around Tokyo

Stayed for 4 nights during RWC. This is a nice international hotel. It's about 20 minutes to Shimbashi station where you can hub out to other parts of Tokyo. Trains from the local station are plentiful.The advantage to being out of town is you get a much bigger room for your Yen than you will get in Ginza or Shinjuku. The disadvantage is that you are not in Ginza or Shinjuku!! That said there are lots of shops, restaurants and a couple of malls within short-walking distance.Some tips. If you don't want your room made up, phone Housekeeping to get a ¥1000 hotel voucher. This voucher could be useful as the gym is not free and drinks in the hotel are expensive. There's a nice cafe immediately next to the hotel which does good coffee and a nice scrambled egg roll for breakfast, served by friendly staff.Becareful of the McDonalds down the road. Despite claiming to being 24 hours, on one night it only served drinks between 2200 and 0700 and the next night it ran out of burgers and fries;- bizarre... Another reason to eat Japanese ;-)I would stay in this hotel again.

For our 4 days over the weekend semi finals watching NZ vs Eng and SA vs Wales we are staying in Daibo just outside Yokohama. First impressions were fantastic, it’s an upscale hotel far removed from the hostels and bed stay venues we normally pick to keep the budget in line. Since this was planned a year ago we budgeted for the whole experience and so far have not been disappointed with going the premium route.We have a twin bed room with en suite and it’s spacious with good views. The chattels are standard hotel fare, hot water and tea/coffee with a mini fridge. The hotel restaurant service is fine dining with awesome city views but downstairs has a selection of coffee shops and convenience stores for better value.Most impressive is the entire block is a floating island that feels almost like being on a cruise, the constant shifting a soothing feel.

A really good hotel for families in Tokyo. Good sized rooms and bathroom (bath and separate shower). For us we had adjoining rooms for our children which was excellent. Transport links to the city are good from Daiba with lots of stuff to do within walking distance. Great also for shopping with all the malls nearby. The bar on the 30th floor is a must with a spectacular view of the Tokyo tower and beyond particularly at night. Staff could not have been more helpful. It is a large hotel but the friendliness of the staff don’t make it feel soulless. Tips: rather than eating in the hotel restaurants there are good cafes and bars nearby at half the price and also a 24 hour convenience store that sells sandwiches, beer and wine.

a great location for a lot of sightseeing in the region. rooms are comfortable and a shop just outside the hotel can provide you with the the necessary stuff so you do not need to pay for an expensive breakfast. - or you use one of the coffee shops just outside. shoppings and their restaurants are in short distance. museums are just in walking distance as well. to mention teamlab, technology museum, maritime and others. the teletransport brings you everywhere in the region.

This was our 3rd hotel in Japan and we thought we’d finish on a high. We were disappointed. With this one exception we found Japanese people warm, friendly and helpful.Check in was laborious and we waited for 20 minutes despite a queue of only 4 people. Check out was much much worse. There were 3 people in the queue. There were 2 people behind the desk and 3 others watching but not helping. All we wanted was to pay for a club sandwich. Overall the staff were inefficient and not very friendly. It felt like being in a machine. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.Rooms were fine. Sushi breakfast on 30th was an exception. Staff eventually warmed a bit. Great food. Garden dining was large and probably the worst quality food we had in Japan.

A very large resort style of Hotel with all the bells and whistles but (apart from the Concierge whom we found to be very pleasant and helpful) staff were disinterested and disengaged. The on site bar (only one!) and restaurant on the 30th floor were ridiculously over priced, and the breakfast restaurants were mediocre. It’s not a place I would chose to stay again!

Tokyo. Clean, comfortable hotel, we had a bog standard room with decent shower and bathroom. 2 minutes walk to Yurikamome line which takes you to Shimbasi station. Breakfast too pricy, but there are options less than a minutes walk away. The hotel provides a complimentary 4G android device which was great for travelling around tokyo on the trains.

I chose this hotel because it offers a shuttle service to Haneda airport, which is not far away. It is large and has a rather overdone interior, with huge reception rooms and lots of marble. Unusually for a Japanese hotel, the staff were a bit scruffy and not as helpful as is usually the case in Japan. My room key was a bit of card with a magnetic strip, which opened the door but would not activate the room electrics. I had to go back to Reception and get another one. The room was large, with silent air handling. There are several restaurants on site, but they are very expensive indeed. Alcohol prices are ridiculously high, even for Tokyo. Not worth the proximity to Haneda.

The hotel is huge,lots of room. The beauty is you don’t feel the crowed. The staff is very professional and helpful. The rooms are ok but the view from the hotel is just outstanding especially at night. You defenetly want to try the bar lounge of the hotel situated on the 32 floor if my memory serve me well.

Stayed here for a three nights as part of the RWC19 tour. The room was lovely and the beds extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a great size with a very nice shower. The breakfast choices in Garden Dining were good and there was easy access onto the Yurikamome line. Would definitely stay again.

Stay away from the 30th floor unless u want the shock of an €80.00 bill for one poached egg and some musli however their breakfast bought with the room is an all out buffet serving everying from fruit, egg, sushi and pasta.No gluten free bread available but plenty of food to keep a coeliac running for the day

Gym opens at 7am. Still to find out which country’s 7am they mean because it’s definitely not Japan’s. 7.26 and the gym is still closed. Too good a hotel to drop the ball like this. Not acceptable in such a pricey hotel.

We were there for five nights and more than satisfied with the hotel. The hotel located in Odaiba which is not far from Tokyo and easily accessible by the nearby monorail. The cost of a cab into Shibuya was about $30 but I think it varies with traffic. To Shinjuku it was about $57. There is an airport limousine stop for both Haneda and Narita airports. Very convenient. The hotel also is a stop for the free shuttle bus to and from the various nearby shopping malls. We visited the Diver City and Aqua City malls which were huge! There were also museum stops along the shuttle route but we focused on shopping. You can easily walk from the hotel to the shopping complex. Also there is a convenience store and bakery just outside of the hotel on the way to the monorail station. We also took the shuttle bus to Shinagawa for 200yen. The hotel itself is huge with a great staff. Some of the staff speak English which was helpful since our Japanese was limited. Rooms were quite large, comfortable, clean and equipped with mini fridge, hot pot, instant coffee and tea. The breakfast buffet was varied and adequate with American and Japanese offerings. The cost was included in our room price so I don’t know what the regular charge is for the breakfast buffet. I recommend going to the bar on the 30th floor for a night cap. The night view of the Rainbow Bridge was stunning. Overall we were quite pleased with the room size, cleanliness, convenience to shopping and service. It’s not as convenient as staying in Tokyo and the trade off was the larger room and a resort feel to being in a huge hotel.

The moment we stepped in, we were greeted with the smell of elegance, opulence and romanticism. Staff were all very polite, prompt and attentive to your needs with restrained enthusiasm. The hotel had plenty of dining options, but we did not try as there were many other options available at the huge Aquacity mall just 400m away. The hotel also had a shopping wing which was well stocked with a 24h minimart, pastry shop, art gallery, clothing, Odaiba speciality shop etc.. The electric rail stops directly at the hotel. There is also a govt run free shuttle service between the hotel and landmarks in Odaiba.We were lucky to stay on the 22nd floor, commanding a beautiful view of the bay area. The room and bathroom were large ( by Japanese standards). Definitely would recommend for any families looking to travel in style and comfort whilst ensuring all needs are met without travelling far.

We moved to this hotel after mistakenly booking a hotel with pretty tiny rooms. The Grand Nikko is the opposite - generous sized rooms with nice views, spotless and with very helpful staff. The hotel is superbly located for amenities around it and for transport into Tokyo also. My only complaint is that €35 for breakfast and having to pay €20 to use the pool is a bit expensive (prices as found by one of my kids so apologies if mistaken but there definitely was a big charge for breakfast) even for Japan. So we had breakfast around the corner and didn’t use the pool. The view from the rooftop restaurant is superb by the way.

Large hotel, convenient if you want to stay around the Odaiba area. Good services, especially around transportation. The free Odaiba shuttle bus stops here as well as Odaiba Rainbow bus (if you want to go to Shinegawa station) and Airport Limousine Bus. Also steps away from Daiba station where you can take the Yurikamome light rail. We used this hotel as a hub as we traveled back and forth to other cities. Reason is that you can check your big luggage in and the hotel will hold it for you until your next check in. This allowed us to travel lightly to other cities in Japan.Downside: The hotel rooms/floors are dated. It is as management decided to make minimal upgrades and milk as much as they can out of the hotel until they either sell it or decide to finally spend money to update the rooms/floors. The lower floors do have a musty smell and some rooms do have "smokey" scents back from the days when smoking was allowed in the hotel. We've been in 5 different rooms in this hotel, so the "smokey" scents are not unique to a single room. Some have heavier scents, others do not. Furniture in the room is outdated. To give you an idea of "minimal upgrades" they did... to get USB ports, they put in plug in adapters instead of changing out the wooden bedside consoles from the 70's.There is no coin laundry.. only expensive full service laundry. Pools and Gyms are extra and expensive. I believe the outside pool was around $30 USD per adult per day. For non guests, something like $100 USD per adult per day. Tip: push the "Do not Disturb" button in your room. For every day, you don't get room cleaning, you get a $10 coupon for use in hotel dining, gift shops.. basically what you can charge to your room. We used our coupons we accumulated to pay off some of the Airport Limousine Bus transportation.

We spent 10 days here whilst attending a nearby conference, so we were rather surprised when we were issued with a rather small room considering the length of our stay. Although the staff are super friendly and polite few of them really command the English language and so communication can be rather difficult at times.So here is a list of advantages and disadvantages so you can choose for yourself how this might effect a stay here:Advantages: Bus services from the airport and major railway station to the door, free daily newspaper and water bottles, fast lifts, 4 restaurants, clean and tidy, polite and helpful staff, fantastic views from the rooftop bar.Disadvantages: Smallish room, having to pay for the outside pool, expensive restaurants, non-changing breakfast buffet, hi price for room service (they charged us ¥600 for a glass of cold milk!), location on an artificial shopping island were there are only shopping malls and little else apart from the Miraikan and maritime museum.

Here is a hotel that promotes itself as a resort in Tokyo. Massive pools on the website homepage. Book it through Booking.com. All excited. Even though its on the other side of Tokyo Bay I thought it was worth it for the pool in Tokyo in summer travelling with kids.Get there and find out my children, 12 & 14 are not allowed to use the indoor pool as it is part of the fitness centre which is run by an external company and costs $15 to use.The outdoor pool had just opened for the season, the attendant told me it was pretty cold in - but the cost $A35 for 13 and over. $A35, are you kidding! Each time $88 for the 3 of us.This is a $500 a night hotel.Found the small print on the website which says there are extra costs but not the app.There is no way I would have booked this hotel if I knew as it is out of the main areas of Tokyo. I feel so ripped off.

Beautiful Architecture with Impressive Views. Excellent Service in All Three Restaurants. Delicious Food, Top Floor Lounge Experience was Unforgettable, Good Selection of Wines, High Alcoholic Drinks & Snacks!Would Love to Return Back.

Impressive reception area!! Very big building. The rooms where amazing. I stayed in the executive area and couldn't ask for more. The food is amazing too. I totally recommend having a meal in the 30th floor, there is an amazing view.

Firstly. Impressive reception area. Looks 5 star but rooms don’t match. The rooms are large but out - dated. Internet is the worst we have had in all our Japanese hotels .Be aware!!!This is a very busy hotel over 400 guests...so be prepared to wait and queue for breakfast and reception services. You are NOT in the city of Tokyo so the subway pass doesn’t work. On the monorail. We spent an extra £50 over 5 days on the monorail , which you get from Shimbashi. The ride into Tokyo central takes a Good 15 mins Tokyo good 40 minutes , if you understand the underground.Can I give a mention to the lady concierge who really did an excellent job organising a restaurant reservation for me and my son. She organised a cake for his birthday . The restaurant did this and provided a photo for us to remember. This was exceptional. We had a great view from the Sky Tree Tower.Thank you so much you made our stay memorable.Ok, now the bad points.:The staff have very limited English.They couldn’t even say. Please wait on the 30 floor bar while your room is prepared. ... we arrived 45 minutes before check in.However the brilliant lady in the concierge came to the rescue. She really is exceptional. I say this as some who worked in the travel industry internationally, Hawaii, Brazil, USA, Singapore Uk, Spain and Italy for 6 years for Thomson Holidays. I know what good customer service should be. I don’t know if it’s a cultural thing but the Japanese are not flexible like other nations. You really can’t do this. You will have the Olympics next year. Not all nationals have “ follow the rules “ do as I say attitude “. This comes across as rude to Europeans and Western nations. Again holding you hand up in my face is offensive in Western culture. I know somethings are cultural. But remember about 40% of your business is probably from the West. All in all the hotel is in a privileged spot with a fantastic view of Tokyo bay. We enjoyed our stay.I wouldn’t use this hotel again as it’s so far out.

Super hotel at Odaiba!Great service and very good quality.There is a limousine bus from Haneda Airport. It stops directly at this hotel.The rooms are spacious with a beautiful view on Odaiba.There are some restaurants, but a little bit expensive. But no worries, at 5 min by walk, there is a big shopping mall with numerous restaurants.Daiba station in at 1 minutes from hotel.This hotel offers a free shuttle to go to Disneyland Tokyo.

Grand Nikko Tokyo is a very big hotel...much bigger than the normal Tokyo hotels. The rooms are very spacious and we had 4 big single beds in the room. The bathrooms are quite big with tub and shower. the rooms are really nice and comfortable and the staff speaks English. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The hotel is little far from the city centre but is connected via bus which goes from right outside the hotel as well as train. The station is connected to the hotel. Easy to travel to the hotel and the city centre. There are two big malls next to the hotel. Hotel is situated on the bay and views are awesome. there is a statue of liberty nearby and rainbow bridge which are the sights to see in Tokyo.Would recommend this hotel in case travelling to Tokyo for pleasure.

I love this hotel because:- the staff are courteous and professional- very delicious breakfast- it is right next to train station (although the location is not perfect if the majority of places to visit are in down town Tokyo instead of Daiba)

We only stayed in the hotel for 1 night prior to flying to the UK the following day. We were warmly greeted at about 1.00pm to be told cheque is not available until 3.00. I am sure they had loads of rooms we could have used but with the Japanese we found on most “rules” there wad no bending. Anyway we did some sightseeing got back at 6.00 and are bags had been put in our room. I have to say the staff were really helpful.We ended up on the top floor for dinner. We had one of the cheapest bottles of wine on the list and were careful not to order anything too expensive, the bill was an eye watering 52,000 about £300. I had a bite of my wife’s fillet steak, it was the most tender bit of meat i have ever tasted. The food was very good but you could easily pay double what we paid.Leaving the next morning at 6.30am for Haneda Airport it took 20 minutes in a taxi and cost just over 5,000yen.We used the subway in Tokyo a lot and it is very good get a map in English it is very good value with a day ticket cost about £5.00. Be careful my wife and I nearly lost each other in a busy station she has had no money no battery on her phone we were on separate sides of the turnstiles looking for each other. Panic lasted for about 5 minutes then we sae each other!!

Our hotel stay was probably the best experience we had while visting Japan. Even before our stay both the reservations and conceirge desks were providing helpful information in response to my queries via email. That is a PLUS in my opinion.Their instructions to catch the airport limosine bus from Narita airport was simple and so convenient and well worth the reasonable cost as you were dropped off right at the hotel. No lugging big bags on the train.We chose the club option for our room and were very pleased with all that was included. Our check-in was very comfortable lounge to sit while all the paperwork was presented. Only strange piece came to request for payment before our stay was completed so this was very unusual for us.Our room was on the 25th floor with the Rainbow bridge view as I had requested. The view was spectacular especially at night. The room was very comfortable and larger than I expected based on other comments I had read about Japanese hotel rooms. The two twin beds were comfortable and firm which is our preferance. With club plan, we were given a one time bar set up with a couple of each water, pop, beer and two little individual wines. Each day two more water bottles were provided along with an English local newspaper. There was also coffee and tea provided. The large bathroom was elegant included a tub and separate shower with lots of hot water with great pressure. Lots of bathroom amenities of shampoos, etc.We chose to take our included breakfast on the 30th floor as the view was amazing along with the calm and quiet atmosphere. The main choices were a bit limited however the simple buffet selections also included were more than ample to round out the meal. The other options were sushi breakfast or buffet on 1st floor however as we did not use we cannot comment on those.We also took advantage of the included option of the club lounge each day after sight seeing where a selection of alcoholic beverages were provided along with soft drinks, coffee, tea plus depending on the time of day there were simple food options to nibble on. The selection was limited and not always refilled quickly especially when the lounge was busy. Our only wish was this lounge was on the 27th floor lounge which is only for coffee and tea but the view would be a true highlight to relax in.The location at first may appear to be too outside of main Tokyo however the train (330 yen pp) is right beside the hotel within 5 minute walk which takes you right to the Ginza metro line which seems to be the basic main line for all the main tourist attractions. We used this train and then the 72 hours tourist subway ticket for all our intra-city travels. We also used the water port for a harbour ride we took back to hotel as part of our sightseeing adventures.Nearby is a huge shopping centre with food courts, restaurants, convenience stores. Lovely waterfront walkways including a small replica Statue of Liberty. We also used the hotel courier service that shipped our big luggage onto our next city hotel at a nominal cost. What a blessing that was not to have to lug two big bags onto the bullet train. There is also a shuttle bus that stops right at hotel (210 yen pp) that takes you to the Shinagawa station where you can catch the bulletin train instead of the Tokyo station. We also were able to buy our bulletin train tickets which were sent to our hotel before our arrival.Bottom line, we would stay here again and recommend this hotel along with the club option package.

loved the location and room was so comfy. Great choice of cosmetics in the room, loved the skincare set. Breakfast was amazing, choice of Japanese and Western- had amazing noodles, congee and tempura veg. Breakfast isnt a problem for vegetarians but in the hotel in general it is difficult to find veggie food as everything seems to contain fish or pork. (Also some of the desserts contain pork extract- be careful Muslim friends!) Im veggie so I was struggling- only restaurant serving veggie options for dinner is the Garden, the choice is very limited but the chef is helpful and will do his best to find something for you. Great hotel though and cant wait to return!

The staffs are extremely polite, the location is spot on perfect with a nice window view of the underwater road & river. There is also a small statue of liberty nearby, walking distance to the railway and shopping mall. Tokyo is a very expensive place to stay in, and for a room this size it was really worth the price. Breakfast was amazing and the overall hotel ambience is of a luxury 4 star hotel.

This hotel had nice room and location, but 1 thing I can't understand and upset about this hotel and brand.Me, my wife and 18 month baby stay in your hotel for 2 nights.On my check out date around 9 am, we run out of the water but we need it for milk powder for my kid. I contact your housekeeping via operator.The housekeeping said: because I'm going to check out today, so not provide bottled water to me.I understood hotel try to control cost, but 2 bottled water can destroy your reputation. Does it worth ??? I never ask anything during my stay!I respect hotel’s rule, but If you have those kinds of rule, please tell your guests upon check in!! Maybe just because we are not the kind of VIP, cause we booked via OTA?我與我的太太跟18個月大的小孩住在 貴酒店2晚。 房間跟地點都很棒、唯一一件事情我無法理解與失望。 當我在退房當日上午9點時、我需要瓶裝水（原本房內的已經喝完了）、但我需要替我的孩子沖泡牛奶、於是我聯繫了飯店的房務部門。 對方卻回答我 由於我在今日退房 、所以不提供瓶裝水給我 需要另外購買。也許這是你們的規定、但希望下次如有這樣的規定 你們應該在辦理入住時就告知你們的客人、我就會在前一晚先提出我的需求。

This is a 4 plus star hotel in our view. The location on Tokyo Bay is outstanding, the facility clean, modern and beautifully appointed. Our room was perfect in every way...size, layout, amenities, comfort, cleanliness and very quiet. This hotel also has several great restaurants and has easy train access to downtown. Stayed in many hotels in Tokyo over the years and the Nikko is truly Grand!!

This hotel blew us away the moment we stepped into the foyer. The staff are friendly, their English excellent and they are always on hand to help. The rooms are spacious and as a family of 5 the conjoining rooms were a big plus as it is not alway easy to find. We spent 8 nights here and we found the location convenient as it was right by a metro station and they had a free shuttle to Disneyland. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo.

We enjoyed a delightful four night stay at this impressive hotel, as part of a large tour group, prior to a cruise.Our room was stylish, with magnificent views across the bay. There were numerous and contrasting dining options. All the staff provided a friendly and efficient service.It's only a few metres walk to the station of the Yurikamome, a driverless, automated transit service linking to Shimbashi, across the Rainbow Bridge.

Rainbow bridge espectacular views from our room, great amenities; pretty and functional instalations and infraestructure, options of occidental, japanise and asian buffet for breakfast. Confortable beds, great ubication for Daiba (not for Tokyo) with a metro station just few meters yo walk.Also expect somencoldness from employees (maybe they're tired of hundreds turists every day), yes it's a huge hotel with broad spaces.Breakfast buffet is good, but is not surprising that some dishes scarces because of many people taking breakfast.It's surprising that metro lines which connects Odaiba with Tokyo are tiny compared with other amazing train infrastructure of Tokyo. Distance from Tokyo and others attractions could be my one and only obstacle for come back to Nikko hotel

wonderful place, close to train station, European and Japanese meal, but you have to wait in line to get a table for breakfast. 5 minutes from shopping malls Aqua and Diver city. we were in an organised group so I can not give prices.

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and had an unpleasant stay which is rare for high end Japanese hotel. The hotel is beautiful and rooms are nice with amazing bay view the problem is the service. Here are few examples:- We had to wait 30 to 45 min in line to get a table for breakfast. And then finally when you get in there is a big mess and lots of food and drink trails are empty (see my picture) and sometimes you have to wait again until the staff fill them up. The second day after waiting again 40 minutes we just walked to Hilton across the street and had breakfast there. By the way the breakfast is 33,000 yen/person - If you want to use the pool or fitness you have to pay 1000 yen/person (each time) which we did. But since the pool is also open to people from outside it was always crowded and we were not able to swim even once despite paying the access fees. We asked since we didn't use the pool if we can be reimbursed they said "oh sorry" we don't reimburse come back later when pool is available.- We are not big fans of TV but I have to inform the TV lovers that this "high end" hotel has only 6 local Japanese TV channels and 4 foreign info TV and not the best one. - The staff is not pleasant but I don't blame them this is the job of the management and the hotel policy to be pleasant and professional If you really have to go to this hotel be aware that there is no Limo shuttle bus from Haneda Airport (which is very close) after 7 pm (you have to wait 11 pm) and no early morning shuttle from the hotel to the airport. Basically add another 90,000 yen to your budget for a round trip taxi in case you arrive after 7 pm and want to leave before 7 am.

The hotel is built on a man-made island with a 'recent' train line so transportation is easy and not problematic when i stayed. It's about 10 minutes from 2 shopping malls (AquaCity and DiverCity.) Both have own food courts and restaurants. Hotel also has a 24 hrs convenient store on lobby floor so easy to get by. It also has plenty of parking (2,000 JY per stay) so not problem w/ self-drive. We had 2 cars in our visit.

This is a wonderful hotel and we enjoyed a great 3 night stay here. The twin beds were very comfortable and were a pleasure to sleep on - far softer than many of the other beds we slept on in Japan. The toiletry products were lovely and there are plenty of them. You received two bottles of complimentary water and there is free wifi in the room, along with a safe. There are big shopping centres close by, along with the Statue of Liberty and a big ferris wheel. If you go up to the bar on the top floor you get a great view of the Rainbow Bridge and central Tokyo. The Daiba Station is a two minute walk from the hotel though you need a special ticket to use this line, as it is not part of the JR or metro system. There is a small convenience store by the hotel along with a few other shops. Breakfast was included and there was a wonderful choice of food. One our first day for breakfast there was over a half hour wait to get a seat (this was at 6.45 am). There were people already lined up at the other cafe as well. We missed out as there wasn't enough time to wait as we had to meet up for a trip we had booked. This was not an issue the next morning, but you did have to be quite early to avoid any waits. The staff were very helpful and polite.

The Grand Nikko is situated about 15 minutes from the centre of Tokyo by metro.The hotel is very luxurious and the bedrooms very spacious (unlike some in the centre of the city).There are several local walks in the vicinity as well as some large shopping malls all of which are worth a visit.The staff are very friendly and accommodating albeit that their english is very limited.Close to the hotel is a food court in the shopping centre which offers a wide variety of dishes at reasonable prices.Would have no hesitation at all in recommending this hotel should you wish to stay outside the city

This is a beautiful hotel with lovely big rooms, great views over the water of the city and the rainbow bridge and even views of Mt Fuji from the bar lounge. High tea in the lobby restaurant is an event in itself and the hotel is conveniently located near a shopping mall with a food court, shops and great restaurants.

Overall the hotel was great. The rooms were immaculate and the service was excellent. The staff were genuine and very polite and efficient. There are also great views of the rainbow bridge if you get a high up room on the correct facing side of the building. My only complaint is in regards to the food. The breakfast buffet was dismal and meals in hotel restaurants were overpriced for average at best food. I would recommend staying here but to make meal plans outside the hotel. There are plenty of malls a few minute walk away with much better options available in the food courts.

Wow! Great view. Great room. Great service. Great food. This hotel took care of our every need. Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so great. So many luxury items. Large room. Heated toilet. Great workout area. Wonderful breakfast buffet

This is a fabulous hotel. The train station is right in front the hotel so it is very convenient to get around. There are also two shopping centers next to the hotel with a lot of eating places to go to.

I was looking forward to staying at this 5 star hotel. Initially, the inside of the hotel is beautiful. The lounge on the top level has great views. The room and bathroom was spacious, but that’s where the positive ends. The staff is extremely rude and do not speak much English. The rudest of them all was the concierge and housekeeping staff. The beds are hard and small, and the pillows are as thin as paper and super uncomfortable! The train station is a block away and convenient. However, if you are in Tokyo for vacation, this hotel is very far away from everything! I would not recommend staying here if you want to use your time wisely and explore the more popular parts of the city. Overall, this place is NOT worth it!

If you are visiting diaba area, this hotel is extremely convenient. Located just beside the train station and walking distance to those “must-visit” places in Daiba. Venus fort, aquacity, DiverCity, Decks, etc.

Absolutely excellent hotel with spacious, well-designed rooms, helpful staff and all the facilities you could possibly be looking for. Two drawbacks both pertaining to the Garden restaurant though: 1) you may want to mentally prepare for queuing up for breakfast (there's actually an improvised 'waiting room' in front of the restaurant, so go figure, and 2) the buffet dinner is really, ridiculously expensive.

I stayed 2 nights at this beautiful hotel. It has a reasonably size room and it has a gorgeous bathroom. Its located within walking distances to great shopping malls. Probably the only part i didn't quite like was during breakfast time its restaurants for the international buffet gets really packed and you hv to pick a number and wait to be seated. If you go aft 9am the crowd is less. But the hotel open up 3 other of its restaurants for breakfast if I'm not mistaken the other 2 were purely japanese style breakfast buffet. Overall i enjoyed my stay at Nikko Grand and definitely would come back.

Nice location next to Hilton and Monorail station. Walking distance to Gundam Statue/Display. Odiba area does have free scheduled transport and fortunately this hotel is one of its stops. Friendly Front Office staff but hotel can get crowded at times. Rooms are nice and huge vs. TOKYO standard. Unfortunately, limited and cyclical English channels on their cableTVs. Enjoyed the place and Tokyo. Will definitely be back.

Very convenient near monorail station and easy transfer from airport (bus stops outside). Large comfortable rooms with tea/coffee makers, but expensively charged extras (pool), and breakfast and meals are very costly. Fortunately there is very close by a mall with a variety of cheap eating places.

I came for business, but would have preferred to stay some time for vacation here. Very nice clean modern hotel. I booked in time and got a very good price! It is very easy to reach, as the Metro station is just in front. In case you do not prefer Japanese breakfast, there is a convenient store just at the entrance and a Starbucks not far away (about 500m). Perfect hotel if you want to combine shopping with sightseeing.
user_name:
Marco C
Province of Latina, Italy

review_body: Strangers to Tokyo it was difficult to choose a location and hotel. We got it so right on this occasion.We booked a Club room which was more than worth the extra. We arrived really late at night tired and hungry, to find snacks, drinks, wine in our room for us to enjoyThe accomodation was spacious with a great viewOur rate included a lovely afternoon tea as well as cocktails in the evening.We loved the bay area but staying here means a train into the centre of Tokyo. The station is just across the road.We were sorry to leave this hotel, so highly recommend.

- 4-5 Star hotel - excellent accommodations. The price was excellent- Bed comfort was adequate - They have a free shuttle to Disney- Shuttle to the different airports but closest to Haneda- Easy access to Western Shopping- Easy access to Metro but some distance from Tokyo downtown

Nice room with nice atmosphere. Near the malls in the area and train station. Have 24 gorgeous store. A bus to drive to to Disneyland and Disneysea Tokyo for whom who which to visit. Try to help as much as they could if you needed any help. The only disadvantage is the English breakfast if you want to eat their the basement buffet open at 6.30 had an issue with waiting maybe more than half hour or you could eat at the lobby but it open at 8.45

We stayed here for three nights at the end of an Asia cruise. What a treat. Fantastic hotel. Extremely helpful and friendly staff, especially Kurita, one of the concierges who spent a great deal of time and energy trying to check me in for my flights home with Air China ( not so good). Luxurious surroundings. Highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

My husband, daughter (age 11) stayed here for our last night in Tokyo. We got in late but it was so easy to get to since it's almost connected to a metro station. The hotel is beautiful! We had a three bed room which was very comfortable. The furniture is a little outdated but overall it was very nice. The check in process was very easy the staff was very pleasant. it's a little farther out but we wanted something near the TeamLab Borderless museum so it worked out well for us. It was about 30 minutes to get to Tokyo Station.

We stayed in the hotel triple room!!! Very comfy and spacious interior. The hotel staff at the front desk spoke perfect English and were very poltie and accommodating of our needs! The hotel is located a few minites walk from odaiba with an array of dining options so I would recommend you venture out and take advantage of the scenic boardwalk! Thank you Grand Nikko for an unforgettable weekend!!!

Even though the location is off city, but it has great amenities to accommodate to the people around there. With the new train line, it only takes 35mins to reach the city. Room is big, service is excellent! I will definitely go back there if I visit Tokyo.

Stayed at this hotel few days ago the staff at the lounge 27th floor are rude never experienced rudeness at any Japanese hotel until I ate breakfast at that floor(inomata & the guy who assign seats ).They do not serve to please the customers, they do not even try to understand what you want or saying please train your staff at 27th floor how to be polite. will not book at this hotel again. But to be fair the staff at the reception are all nice.

The price. The quality. The price is equal with the quality you expected.Sure thing, next time when we'll visit Tokyo, spend a few days in chill spring time, this hotel will be considered the first to be chosen ( if there is any family room left, ' cause the family room usually full booked before ).

Location Hotel is located in Daiba area. From Haneda, the Keikyu or Airport limousine bus companies via coach goes directly to hotel front door & cheapest easiest way at ¥520. The local monorail station of Daiba is only a few minutes walk and can connect to rest of Tokyo. Within area of Daiba and walking distance is a large mall with many international brands. There are also various museums & entertainment options including Sega entertainment centre & a large Ferris wheel. Nice spot to walk about with fresh air from the bay. Room Superior Double on 22nd was a really nice decorative clean room with a nice view, large size for Japan. Comfortable double bed with plug sockets including cables fro charging phones on one side but sides have dimmable lamps. As well as the usual Japanese clock alarm system. Facing bed is a decent large size TV that offers 8 international channels from Australia, Korea, Singapore, BBC & even Japan networks in English. A small empty fridge to accommodate the complimentary two bottles of water. Large dressing table style desk but also suitable to work from is offered with plug sockets. Two comfortable arm chairs on side. They also offer a free personal WIFI handset for your stay that can be used throughout Tokyo with complimentary 30min use as a hot spot. Very handy with google maps built in. Large wardrobe with a decent size safe along with slippers & bamboo foot exercise things. Bathroom was very opulent with marble tops offering a large decent sized bath for Japan with shower built in, all worked well. With multiple full set of amenities offered except body lotion but does include bath salts.AC worked well and they also offer an air purifier unit. Overall a 5star standard room for Japan. Facilities Complimentary WIFI is offered. Catering did not try as breakfast not included but they do offer about 6 restaurants including Grill, Chinese & Japanese options as well as lounge cafe & bar on top floor. Leisure facilities is not free at a cost of 1080yen, but does include gyms, pools, saunas & Jacuzzis. Did not use but got the guide.The hotel has a convenience store inside, coffee place & a bakery. There are also various clothing & Japanese food stores. As well as large conference center. There is also a very helpful currency changing machine that works well for all major currencies that you just put your notes thru. StaffStaff are very efficient with quick check-in / out. The bell captain desk organize the bus tickets back to Haneda or Narita. They also advise on local attractions & overall are very pleasant.Overall a very comfortable hotel in a decent location for shopping & activities outside of the main Tokyo districts. Think they should though include leisure facilities in price rather than charging extra.

The room that we stayed in was very big (by Japanese standard). This 5-star hotel is huge and is connected to the Odaiba Train Station (only 2 minutes walk). We also checked the hotel on the other side of the station, Hilton Daiba, which is more than double the rate that we paid at Grand Nikko! There is shuttle bus from the hotel to the 2 international airports, Yokohama Station, Disneyland, and many other locations. There is also a free shuttle bus for tourists to get a good view of the Odaiba area.

Absolutely nothing to complain about.Location, Service, Price, Cleanliness, everything was perfect.Greetings as you enter in to a nice smelling well maintained hotel. There's a bus that goes to Disneyland, airport, and it's a little walk to odaiba's activities like team lab and shopping. Couldn't hear any noise from neighboring rooms. Room was very spacious for japan. They actually delivered the luggage to our room instead of handing it to us at the front like every hotel usually doesThe price is on the high side at around $350 per night on weekends so I'd recommend going on a weekday which comes down to $150 I love a deal! Same great service... fraction of the price

We stayed at the Grand Nikko Daiba after we had a great experience at the Grand Nikko in Saigon. This hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are large for Tokyo standards and the service was good and pleasant. Everything was clean and orderly, as you would expect from Japan. We booked regular rooms with breakfast. The breakfast at the Buffet restaurant was good, varied and filling. What they don't tell you is that you can use your breakfast vouchers for any restaurant or any meal. Our flight left at 6AM so we had to leave the hotel by 4AM, before the restaurants opened. We were able to use our breakfast voucher at the Grill on 30th the night before.The hotel is somewhat out of the way for regular Tokyo tourism as you need to take an extra train ride to get to Tokyo proper and that train line is a JR line so it is not part of the Tokyo subway pass for tourists.

The highlight for this hotel is the location. Daiba station is just next door. You can take the shuttle bus from the hotel to Haneda International Airport for about 20 minutes. 5 minutes walk to shopping centres and most of the attractions in Daiba are right in front of you. There is a 24 hour convenience store next to the hotel. If you happened to buy a lot of snacks or other stuff and could not fit into your luggage, do not worry! Just buy extra boxes from the hotel with reasonable price and they will help yo seal it for you. My kids and I love the rooms so much.

My wife and I stayed here for a week and we enjoyed it. This hotel is huge. Our room (even the bathroom) was big (see photo),the lobby (second floor) is spacious, the buffet/ dining area on the first floor can seat many, many guests, the business function rooms/halls at B1 level are big. Everything is done to impress. The staff are well-trained and always ready serve.Located on a man-made island, the hotel is a 40-minute train ride to either the Shinjuku or Shibuya areas where tourists usually visit. But Tokyo Disney is nearby, so it depends where you want to be near.This is definitely a good option when business or leisure brings you to this part of Toyko.

I definitely want to stay here again. The view from our room is amazing, free shuttle to odaiba area, and the monorail right in front of the hotel so it really easy to go anywhere. The staff is also helpfull.

The room came with an amazing view - it was spacious (for a hotel in Tokyo). As the staff came in to clean my room, they even put my teddy bear in a cute position, resting on the pillow, or tucked into bed. I really liked that gesture!I was also waiting for my friend to send me my snowboard, and the staff at the Concierge were very helpful. They helped to check with the forwarder when the delivery would be, and even helped to make sure that it would be here before I needed it.All in all, I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were spacious and clean, and it was one of the best hotels I'd stayed at in Tokyo.

Club level is worth the extra cost. (Lounge access with self serve bar and tasty canapes, plus breakfast vouchers) Rooms have complimentary cell phones with internet access. Shopping/activites nearby.

There is no internet at all in our room, and it was brought to their attention. They checked and said they have internet. I kept on trying to log on and off, and find ways to get in. But for the past whole 7 days, it failed. I did request them to come to my room to check it. They sent a girl who didn't know what to do, just simply stare at my iPad screen. Finally, she couldn't do anything so I brought my iPad down to the front desk to help me. Still, they just laughed with each other in Japanese, and brushed me, SORRI, NO. It was a joke, so I brought my iPad and laptop to Diver's City just to test out. It got connected and pages opened up quickly to let me file this review. It went so smoothly and there is nothing wrong with my equipment. I had been to Hokkaido ski resorts, Sapporo hotels and Chitose Airport hotel, before I flown to this hotel. I have had no problem with their wifi, but when I came here, nothing is opening up. There is no internet at this hotel, but they wouldn't admit it. All they explained is it is Time Lagging Issues with my hotmail, that is why I could not open it. All I want is to check my emails, and do my bills. This is a really bad hotel with no internet.

This hotel has stunning views at night, especially from the lounge on the 30th floor. The service was excellent and the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The room was spacious and beds were comfy. Located close to Daiba train station and within walking distance of shopping malls, statue of liberty, gunam statue, mori digital art museum. We really enjoyed our stay. We loved the hotel and would definitely stay again.

Brilliant hospitality. The rooms are very clean, tidy and amenities are outstanding. I was impressed to find pair of pyjamas in the room.The view from the room is breathtaking. The location can’t emphasize more ... everything is litteraly close by. Daiba mall, decks tokyo mall. Supermarket is just next door. Free shuttle scheduled for 45 min tour . Overall, it is an amazing hotel.

We booked for a non-smoking room. But when we arrived our room smells like smoke. I called front desk and told them about the situation. They told me they are sending someone. They sent someone from housekeeping i think. He didnt know how to speak english. When he entered our room hes face was like, it doesnt smell like smoke here. He brought a deodorizer to kill the smoke smell. It improved the room smell a bit. We didnt asked anymore to be moved and just accepted our room. Later on that night, i requested for a firm pillow for my head as the ones they provided are on the soft side. After 20 mins, my pillow didnt arrive. I called again housekeeping to follow up on my request. The guy who answered sounded irritated. 5 mins after my pillow arrived. Maybe if i didnt follow up, it will never arrive. Poor service for a 5 star hotel. We asked for additional bottled water. They can only give the minimim and nothing more. I requested for a late check out. They gave me an additional 30 mins. What a joke right? Late check out is at least 1pm. Sometimes even 2pm or 4pm. Depending on the hotel. But 5 star hotels can usualy accomodate such request unless they are fully booked. We asked if we could stay at the lounge until our companion arrives from the convention. They accommodated us but after 1.5 hr, a guy approached us and asked us to leave at 330pm because we are already overstaying and we have already checked out. Maybe it's a japanese thing or what but this hotel is very uptight. They have very poor service even to their guests at the executive floor. They can only give the bare minimum in service. Its like their staffs have a manual and they all follow the manual. If its not on the manual, they do not know what to do anymore. Just like robots. No hearts or emotions these people. So if you have the money, bring it elsewhere. Do not stay here. Service is very poor for a 5 star hotel. Im not coming back here. If i have to come back to this area, ill stay somewhere else.

We stayed there during our visit to Tokyo,the rooms are big and comfy the breakfast was great but the dinner at the grill restaurant on the top floor was superb and what a view from there!!! The shuttle bus for disneyland was convinient also the shuttle bus for haneda airport:-)Close to shopping malls and public transport it is a good choise if u want to be near to everything:-)

We arrived 1030pm. We were both hungry and thirsty but everyone of their resteraunts and bars was closed and closed at 9pm! Every 4 star hotel I've ever stayed in would have at least a piano bar or cocktail lounge open until at least 1am. The room was nice but no mini bar so despite not being able to get anything to eat there was no nibbles or refreshments either. Turned on the TV for my daughter and no cable channels with English like Nickelodeon or Discover. They only offered 2 sachets of coffee, powder milk and 2 sugars. The interior is so bland and horibble, the reception is tucked away from the main entrance.. DONT STAY IF HERE YOU WANT TO USE THE POOL! You have to pay! and kids arnt aloud! (what sort of 4 star hotel doesn't offer a complimentary swimming pool) Great location but terrible hotel!!

I visited Japan as part of EU business delegation and stayed at the hotel. I arrived without my luggage and the staff went out of their way to guide me so that I could buy a last minute suit! The stay was very comfortable and every single person in the hotel was extremely friendly and courteous. It definitely added to the Japan experience! The entrance is so grand and lavish and lifts youe spirits. Great options for breakfast and you're spoilt for choice. Hassle free check in and check out.

So we booked this hotel thinking there might be some sort of new year celebration at the rainbow bridge but it turned out to be just plain boring. Apparently new year celebration in Japan is a quiet event! The hotel is simply outdated. The rooms are old and for the kind of price it's not worth it. Service lacks the Japanese touch. Location is next to daiba station and many nearby malls so that's the only positive side to it.

Specifically asked and booked for a non smoking family room 6 months prior... confirmed a few weeks before travelling that it was non smoking... when we arrived, they placed us on a smoking floor... I asked to be changed and was told they don’t have family rooms on non smoking floors... she said we shouldn’t be able to smell it in the rooms as hardly anyone has smoked in that room.... really ?!?!?!? Also the web site said there is a shuttle from the air port - we tried to arrange it and was told by the hotel there isn’t one.. I guess what is advertised and what is booked - they don’t have to do any of it .... I’d book elsewhere if you are a family travelling with young kids ...

It's my first time going to Tokyo and it certainly won't be my last. I had a really good time there.If you haven't been to Tokyo before and are still considering where to stay and what to do etc.. of course, I wouldn't recommend your first option to be here unless you don't plan to visit too many places in one trip. Then Grand Nikko would be your ideal choice!Remember to do check on these things (if you haven't done them beforehand)1. Convert to Japanese yen. (All places except cash unless you use card to buy something expensive and don't forget to claim tax as some places sell things plus sales tax)2. Buy a Suica card. (Train card)If arriving Narita airport, you can buy the card from the machine nearest to the operator. Change to English language if you need to on the machine. You need it pretty much every day. You can request for refund before you leave the country so don't charge too much credit at once. 3. Optional- I chose to get to Grand Nikko by Airport Limousine (bus) just at their counter at arrival lounge. 4. Portable wifi- Free wifi if you take the bus and Grand Nikko also provide a mobile phone like device which you can take out with you and turn on hotspot.Amenities:You can pretty much get everything.1. Aqua city shopping mall 2. Diver city shopping mall (Gundam outside)3. Fairy wheel4. Spectacular views (Rainbow bridge etc..)5. Convenience storesTransportThis would get more expensive if you compare with Shinjuku etc but Tokyo is too big which means getting everywhere takes time.There's the Daiba station outside the hotel. Hop on it and get to Shinbashi pretty much every time before you want to goto and return from other places. As you reach Shinbashi, you need to tap out and go down to find where you need to get on. There are many apps you can use to find where to and how long to get to your destination which is where the fun begins. Grand Nikko Daiba offers different kinds of breakfast each day , ie, buffet style, Japanese breakfast, sushi etc. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and most importantly they can speak English! Unless you wish to practice speaking Japanese with them. Overall, I love my stay here! It's awesome!

We stayed here for three nights with our two daughters in January. The service was great - they upgraded us to a premium room and the room was spacious and luxurious with great amenities. Also, the concierge was very helpful when we discovered I had left my phone on the airport bus! We didn’t visit any of the restaurants but there is a convenience store located at the bottom of the hotel which was great for snacks and supplies. We used the free shuttle to Disneyland. This hotel is excellent value. It feels luxurious and spacious but was cheap compared to other Tokyo hotels. Location is great for families who plan to visit places like Disneyland and Kidzania (highly recommended and an easy metro ride). Some good restaurants in the shopping center located close by. I’d definitely stay here again.

Nice classic hotel, all very well taken care of, but one thing I cannot understand is why the carpets in the corridors and in the rooms were so filthy and smelly. Never were cleaned, full of stains and real dirt. They seem to know the problem because they even had a special spray for refreshening the fabrics inside every closet.

My friend and I stayed here for three nights, and we loved it!! It was so easy to get from Haneda airport to the hotel. There’s a bus that will drop you right at the front door of the hotel for ¥520 (as of 23Dec2018) each way. Be sure to make a reservation for your return shuttle to the airport when you get to the hotel. There’s also a bus from Narita, but it costs more. The bus schedules from both airports are on their website. The free shuttle to and from Disneyland and Disney Sea was one of the best things about this hotel! You have to reserve your spots on the bus in advance though so be sure you do that. I did mine right online through the hotel website. Rooms were spacious and the staff was great! Everyone we cane in contact with was so helpful and so nice. Location of the hotel is great too. Walking distance to shopping and some great restaurants (bills, eggs’n things, etc). A short walk outside the hotel will also give you some beautiful views of the Rainbow Bridge at night.

Poor service! In all the hotels I have booked.. the service here is truly disappointing for the premium that you have to pay. Housekeeping just throws away plastic bags without asking us as they were placed on the table thinking it is empty but we had other uses for it! Super soft beds that probably had broken springs and smelly toilet bowls. definitely not coming back!

Stayed here for one night, after we landed and before we head to Disneyland the next day. Odaiba is very near to Haneda (about 30mins on bus). The airport bus goes to the hotel so it makes it convieneient. The hotel is located near the metro station and walking distance to the Odaiba shopping belt with great views of rainbow bridge and restaurants. Eggs and Things is within 10min walking .

A hotel right in the heart of Odaiba, Tokyo. For a hotel in Tokyo, the rooms are very spacious. They give you a phone you can take around with you when you go out of the hotel (it has internet in it for you to search, use the map, and contact people). The staff is very friendly and courteous and the view from the room of the rainbow bridge is beautiful at night! What more can I say? The room and bathroom was very clean, I can adjust the temperature of the room freely at my comfort, the shower and bath water temperature and pressure can be adjusted to your liking easily, and the bed was so comfortable to sleep in as well. There are malls, restaurants, and convenience stores nearby the hotel, you can just walk to them. There are 2 stations nearby, and from one of the stations, it only takes about 15 minutes to reach Shibuya! Highly recommend this hotel.

I have been using this hotel for over 10 years, so I clearly find it very good overall. Excellent French concierge, good location, good price, sometimes great views from window.I said in previous review, and it still holds - THE CARPETS LOOK DIRTY AND NEED REFURBISHMENT"The reception staff often struggle with English and are often relatively unpleasant by Japanese standards. There is no longer a bar of soap - only the Japanese standards of horribly sticky liquid gunge :-( On the last visit, the luggage attendant was very unpleasant and grudd

We stayed at this hotel for seven nights. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. It is very convenient, as Daiba Station is right outside the hotel. Although you do need to take transport to get to the other areas in Tokyo, it's fine if you're not in a rush.The staff are very helpful, and there is a direct limousine bus to the airport. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to Disneyland and Disneysea. There is also a 24-hour mini mart on the ground floor, and lots of shopping centres and restaurants within easy walking distance.

Excellent location. Daiba station is right outside the hotel and is connected from within the hotel, hence the connectivity to central Tokyo is great. The hotel is very close to the bay, hence the views are great. The surrounding area is beautifully made up and has a lot of shopping and eating places.The hotel itself is grand, like the name. Good rooms, good staff, although communication is an issue as many of them are really poor in English,One negative is that they should not charge for the fitness center, other than that i had a very comfortable stay.Great connectivity from Narita airport as well.

I visited this hotel due to my business trip and it is a grand luxury hotel with exceptional services. I was quite surprised since the hotel rate was very low considering the hotel level. The hotel is very nice and quite. They have all the amenities and venues you can think of. Either it is for your business or trip with the family, I strongly recommend it!With only a minute walk, you can get on the monorail which can take right into the city of Tokyo or you stay and enjoy the bay area shoppings and foods without getting away from the Daibe island!

Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba is located in bayfront area of Tokyo, and easy to accsess from the International Haneda Airport. The hotel offers comfortable guest room including beautiful berakfast service. There are many attractive retail outlets and a famous spa nearby the Hotel. Enjoy your stay.

Grand Nikko and Hilton are right below the Daiba train station. It takes 16 minutes to reach Shimbashi station from where you can connect to most places in Tokyo. Shuttle bus services to Haneda and NaritaNearby Aqua City Mall has good shops and restaurants. Kid friendly and convenientRoom is clean and well maintained but getting a bit old. Prices vary between 120 - 450 USD / night depending on the demand. I wouldn't pay over 200 USD for these room though ( we paid 350 USD) so book smartly and you may get yourself a great dealI guess another downside is traveling time to the Tourist spots....takes 16 mins to Shimbashi + walking to JR + travel time so location could be a negative for those who like to stay centrally

We booked this hotel as we were attending a convention in Tokyo Big Sight. Booked the Club Room, and had lounge access for the whole day with access to coffee, tea and other beverages, as well as food from breakfast to dinner.Breakfast was also excellent, as was the service. The rooms of a good size with nice views. Location in Odaiba was a bit far from the main city, but in itself is very accessible to shopping, restaurants and transport. The price was very reasonable too!

The Grand Nikko is well situated at the waterfront, with a stop of the Tokyo - metro next to the hotel. The rooms are spacious en super clean. The hotel offers an efficient service ( Japanese style ) and some 5 or 6 restaurants. Expensive.

It was one of my favorite hotel I have I ever visited. The train station to Tokyo city center was only 2 seconds away from the hotel.. a shopping mall right next to it.. beautiful view of the rainbow bridge, very comfortable room, great amenities, they have shuttle bus to tourist attractions like Disneyland and to Haneda airport... which is only about 20 minutes ride. My most favorite time though... is the breakfast. They serve the best omelette I’ve ever tasted and their bread and croissant taste super delicious, especially after you put them on the toaster/ oven.

we over looked the bridge and the statue of liberty (japan style). nice large room, getting a bit aged, but clean and tidy. bed is comfortable and the views, well they are to die for. we left the curtains opened all night to soak in the wonderful view. bus to disneyland departs just outside the entrance and drop off is the same. close to shopping areas and 24 hour store available just outside the door, and cafes. walking distance to monorail breakfast was nice but overpriced, the most expensive, 34000 yen not worth it. 1st morning we could not get breakfast as their was a wait period and we had to catch the bus to disneyland.
user_name:
Lynne B
Christchurch, Canterbury, New Zealand

review_body: Like all hotels in Tokyo, it is expensive. Rooms are well sized and appointed (but not so new).Note in breakfasts: the two buffet breakfasts are fine, but I would highly recommend the Sushi breakfast on the 30th floor.

Nice view, thanks for the hotel hospitality. Will come again next time.The breakfast is great and delicious.Let make the fun with your family for pleasant holidays here. There is free shuttle bus to the Disney land and Disney sea. Also the lumonsin bus is easy to airport. All the traffics are all around and many shopping malls in this district, you can spend few days here for leasure

This is a very good hotel. Location is fantastic. Can see rainbow bridge , Statue of Liberty and next to Daiba station. It also has free shuttle bus to Disneyland resort . The room is spacious and big too. Breakfast spread was very good and many choices. Is near to aqua city and Diver city as well.

This is supposed to be a four star hotel, I would barely give it two. Firstly they simply don’t have many double beds so despite requesting one we ended up in twin beds. All through the night you can hear the sound of the trains passing outside. The restaurants are overpriced. If you don’t want to pay $150 per person for steak and you want a change from Japanese food then you have only one option the hotels’ buffet dinner cafe. The night we decided to try it as we were too tired to go out it was full - we had no food that night. In the morning you have to queue to get in to the same restaurant for breakfast - and when you get in you can see there are multiple additional tables that they simply have not bothered to set - so limiting the capacity. The health club is a joke - it only opens at 7am far too late in my view and worse still you have to pay to use it. Then there are the little annoying things: The mini bar in the room has nothing in it. The hair dryer is completely ineffective.The location is poor. Time is precious and given poor public transport connectivity your only option to get to downtown is taxi. In my opinion there is nothing Grand about this hotel - avoid.

Booked into this hotel for first leg of our honeymoon.Shuttle service available from Narita Airport and arrived at the airport. It took slightly longer than the original indicated time but the journey was smooth.Hotel is located away from the main centre of Tokyo which means its less crowded. Daiba Station is very close to the hotel which is very convenient.Rooms are nicely presented and the hotel gathering lobby is nice and grand. Unlike the typical vending machine rooms you see in many other hotels you don't have it this facility here. Instead there is a 24hr convenience store at lobby level just outside the main entrance.Overall a great hotel with great views of harbour and comfortable rooms.Would recommend this to any traveller be it couple or by one self.

I am so happy I made the decision to stay at this hotel. If you are used to staying in a US standard type room, this is the hotel to go with. The rooms are so much bigger than most of the hotels in Japan. The location to the train station and mall is so convenient. Definitely going back to stay at this hotel.

My family and I stayed at Grand Nikko a fortnight ago for four nights. We were on level 22 and had rooms facing the habour. The hotel was very clean and up to date. The highlight would have been our breakfasts which were included as part of the package that we bought. The hotel had four breakfast restuarants (two international and two japanese options) and we managed to try all of them. Best breakfast would have been the Japanese set option on Level 3.
