The level of comfort is average, as my room mate and I could not sleep that soundly at night. For me the pillows are too soft that they practically flat out after lying your head for a few mins. That's my only gripe about the room. Otherwise the bathroom is fine.The breakfast fare seems to remain the same day after day, as I stayed there for 3 nights. Perhaps the redeeming thing about it is that on a clear day, you can get to see Mt. Fuji and the Rainbow Bridge while you eat.A Tokyo Metro station is right in front of the hotel, while a number of stores are nearby and reachable by foot.

I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, the bathroom was very spacious too with a large bath and separate shower. The toiletries provided are all top notch (shiseido) and the hotel also provides traditional Japanese PJs and slippers while staying with them.Its right next to the Daiba station on the Yurikamome line and a great base from which to see Odaiba and the eastern parts of the city but travelling on this private line can be expensive when you're making several trips a day or purchasing tickets for a family and it also adds some additional time onto your journey. The hotel offers a complimentary bus transfer to/from Disneyland and its a short 20 minute ride - but you do need to prebook it via their websiteWe stayed here two nights and then moved to another hotel in Shinjuku to save travel times to see other parts of the cityWe ate breakfast at Star Road (the top floor western/japanese buffet breakfast) and there are fabulous views of the city and Mount Fuji on a clear day, there breakfast was pretty good too however they are NOT at all able to cater for gluten free diets.

Stayed in a room with a big king sized bed and gorgeous view of Rainbow bridge. The bathroom was so spacious and very efficient. Their breakfast buffet had variety of choices. We enjoyed the most was HAMAYU-the steak restaurant on the top floor. We loved it and actually went back to just Hamayu when we went back to Japan.

Fantastic hotel with easy access to the Daiba Station for access to the Subway to see the Tokyo sights. Also took the complementary bus to Disneyland which was fantastic. Just make sure you book in advance so to not miss out.

I had lived outside of Tokyo before I had kids, and this was their first visit. This was a fairly ideal spot to be based out of. If you plan on spending a lot of time in central Tokyo, you should be prepared for a bit of a haul, but it's not especially inconvenient. But, frankly, we had been through Tokyo a bit earlier, and the kids had a great time exploring O-Daiba and heading out to DisneySea. (You have to book the shuttle ahead of time--we ended up in a taxi instead.)If you are travelling with kids, this is a very comfortable hotel for a stay. Staff was great, and felt like any other large modern, conference-type hotel. Both in terms of surrounds and the hotel itself, it's not what you might expect from Japan--it could be anywhere--but that might be a bit of a plus if you are not a particular adventurous traveller.Definitely a good value for family travellers.

I stayed here four nights as a part of the Tokyo marathon package and enjoyed the luxurious hotel grounds as well as our twin bed room. Breakfast was served in either of three restaurants, I tried the Japanese and the top floor one, great food and great views. Wi-fi was free and worked well always. The hotell was well connected to the rest of Tokyo with light rail and buses. The Tokyo marathon Expo is just a mile away which was an advantage in my case. I didn't see any of the rude behavior other reviewers on this site have mentioned. Neither did I use the gym or the pool and therefore wasn't exposed to any "hidden" fees for that.

Great hotel, modern and comfortable.Friendly staff great location and easy accessibility to the rest of the city by train or bus. There is a mall and several food places across the street.Love the bed.

wonderful hotel ! great view, the room was clean, delicious bfast ! near to the department store like aqua city and venus fort, and specially to disney resort. we will be back again. thank you for the good service

The location of the hotel is good for some downtime away from the busy city centre. Rooms are also larger than normal. Staff were also very friendly and spoke good English. Rooms were cleaned well and fairly quickly. A 24-hour convenience store is located right outside the hotel.There are many buses that stop right in front of the hotel (2nd floor). Although there is a fee for them, but it provides great convenience to get to certain places (Tokyo Skytree, Shinagwa/Tamachi station, etc). The hotel provides the full bus schedule which makes it is easy to plan the day.It does cost more to book a room with the view of the bay/rainbow bridge. While we didn't pay extra for a room with a view, we got lucky and had our room overlooking the bay. There is no need to eat at the expensive restaurants within the hotel as there are plenty of malls in the Odaiba area. The hotel is located right between Diver City and Aqua City. Also, Daiba station is just a few minutes walk away making it easy to take public transportation to other areas.

We stayed here for two nights in December 2016 (family of four with two teenage girls). We had one room with 4 singe beds lined up in a row. Room was comfortable and nicely-furnished. The location of the hotel is great, right next to a train station (pubic transport in Tokyo is superb if pricey - given that that the different train lines are run by different companies and require different tickets), with views over the Rainbow Bridge and a slightly surreal imitation of the Statue of Liberty, and near a couple of large shopping malls. We ate at the hotel both nights - food was fine if a bit pricey, but be careful if you have any vegetarians in your party (we had two) - veggie food can be tricky to find in Tokyo and the restaurants in the hotel are no exception (even the tofu dishes are generally cooked in pork broth). We would definitely stay here again, all the same.

Had one night stop over in Tokyo so needed a nice Hotel close to the airport for a good nights sleep. The Hotel has some great views over Tokyo Bay and a nice high level bar and restaurant to enjoy the views. Rooms very reasonable considering how packed Tokyo can be and it's close enough to train lines for reasonable access to the rest of Tokyo but don't expect to be in the middle of the action so to speak. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

The hotel was nice and the room were very clean and a good size for Tokyo. The location was okay, but it is a little bit far off of the center of Tokyo. The staff was overall pretty rude and not helpful. At the reception the receptionist did not smile once until i paid the bill. When i needed some information, the staff was unable to help me out, since nobody could understand english. This is a problem for an international hotel. Also I find it ridiculous to have to pay 1080 yen (about 10 dollars) to use the indoor hotel pool as a hotel guest. I travel a lot and have never seen anything like this before. Will chose a different hotel the next time I come back to Tokyo

Having arrived early I took a trip up to Asakusa on the boat with is only a 2 minute walk from the hotel. There are plenty of places to eat within a couple of minutes walk. Breakfast I had each morning at a local coffee shop which was excellent. I was there for a week and each day the room was made up to an excellent standard. Had an evening meal event in the hotel at the end of the stay and food was excellent. Can not fault the hotel at all. Would stay again.

The Grand Nikko Daiba location is very good. There is a train station connected to it, a definite advantage, considering that transportation is very expensive in tokyo. The hotel has a good room, has excellent toiletries, unlike other hotels which you would rather bring your own shampoo or body wash. Hotel' staff are fluent in english so communication wont be a problem.

Our first time in Tokyo and this was a great place to stay. Our flights were in and out of Narita airport but we had no issues getting to and from the hotel using the Airport Limousine bus shuttle service (60 minutes travel time, up to 90 minutes during heavy traffic which we never encountered). We had 3 adults staying in a single room and the room was very spacious. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had a few meals in several of the hotel restaurants. They were all very good but on the pricey side. Within a few minutes walk is Aqua City mall with over 50 restaurants to choose from. Lots of things within walking distance from parks, shopping and sightseeing attractions on the island. The hotel is right beside the local transit (light rail train) so very easy to head into downtown Tokyo if needed.

Lobby : The entrance is quite grand but the sitting area is way at the back. The front desk people does not speak a lot of English and not friendly but the concierge was not only friendly but helpful too. I guess it just depends on the person. Nice gift shop with plenty of gourmet food and nice souvenirs to buy and bring home. Breakfast : The breakfast for the buffet style and the Japanese restaurant at the old Nikko (now Hilton) is better in terms of quality, taste and selection. Room : Decent, beds and linens are clean but the carpet is not.Toilettries : They do not have the mini-bottles anymore. The previous ones from the old Nikko (now Hilton) where herbal and smells really clean and refreshing. Now they use the cheap stuff. The scent was overwhelming. Accessability : The access to the train station and to Aqua City is better in this property than the previous Nikko. Please be forewarned, there is NO AIRPORT LIMOUSINE BUS going to this property from Narita Airport after 18:20. Please check first before booking this hotel. We had to pay for private car service and it cost me an arm and a leg. It was very expensive.

Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for business, enjoyed every bit of it. Very grand hotel with good services, also could not ask for a better location as it is right next to the Daiba station, and also 7 mins walk to the shopping areas like Aqua City and Diver City (with the big Gundam robot). Rooms were very clean and nice, would have really liked a room with a view of the Ranibow Bridge though! It was also easy for us to book for the airport shuttle, although it was not free but reasonably priced.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights after our Celebrity Cruise of 20 days from Vancouver to Tokyo. The location of the hotel right next door to the Daiba train station is a great asset, able to get around Tokyo without any problem.. close to all amenities . The hotel itself was excellent in all respects. Would highly recommend to those who are looking out for a truly great holiday ... a

Location: This hotel is far away from the busy districts, so you can enjoy family time. This hotel location is walking distance to reach city mall and aqua city which have plenty of restaurants. The malls are linked via an elevated walkway for added convenience. Trains station also footsteps. Narita airport buses also reached in this hotel. Rooms: It is considered big for japanese standards and it has a bath tub. Wifi connection in the room is good. We wish the hotel can install cartoon channel in English for convenience purpose.Service: Friendly and efficient staffs are always ready to help with friendly smile on their face. Just to remind you to book in advance if you intend to ride a free shutter bus to and flow Disneyland and Disneysea.We had a shocked experience during our stayed, as we experienced a minor earth quake. Japanese may feel normal but we felt shocked and wonder what to do.It is a wonderful experience to stay in, I would give a tump up !
user_name:
Heong L
Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia

review_body: The superior twin non-smoking room is considered a decent size compared to most smaller rooms in Tokyo hotels. The Daiba train station is right in front of the door step of the hotel. Getting in to Tokyo city merely take about 15 minutes, ie from Daiba station to Simbashi sation, Simbashi is a major connection to other lines of the subway system in Tokyo city so it's fairly convenient. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom comes with a full size tub which is rare in Tokyo hotels. The room is newly renovated, with a nice partial view of the Rainbow bridge. The hotel lobby is grand. There is a convenient stall in the hotel (operates 24 hours). The hotel provides free shutter bus to and flow Disneyland and Disneysea (half an hour bus ride, got to book online in advance). I would definitely return to this hotel for my next Tokyo trip and recommend this hotel to friends.

When I first visited Odaiba, x2 years ago Hilton Hotel in Odaiba was formerly Nikko and I was so happy to have found my second home this year for my return BDay visit and with my Neice for her first visit to Tokyo, Japan.We, all stayed at the Grand Nikko 2 rooms on the 20th floor &was upgraded for easier access to each other, much obliged and kudos to staff upon arrival.Both my nice and her Mum was at awe upon orientation to their room and to have found a picture perfect view from the window of the rainbow bridge, wow!Our room was a queen sized bed tho small but adequate for the both of us. Theirs was twin beddings and thus somewhat bigger and only 3 doors down, perfect!We, took the bus from Haneda airport 5.20 yen and please reserve retuning from bell desk with payment upon departure.I did not get the staffs name: however, they were all so helpful in giving me my special BDay gift as well as 2 cocktails for being a loyal customer of One Harmony!Please join for free for discounted Japanese breakfast on the 3 rd floor to boot!A special thank you to concierge, Takeouchi for your patience in answering most of my Neice's questions regarding transportation needs, i.e. Rail which can be menacing ordeal,lolTour information, which only provided for pick up at the Grand Nikko hotel for the bus and not returning to the hotel.Restaurant recommendation for Matsakusa beef which may be had at Aqua City 6 th floor restaurant, Garuva Not just in Hamada as noted, btw.We, truly had a blast with festive fireworks which may be seen from our window! Fantastic!We, found "Japanese hospitality " most welcoming and most accommodating and we really appreciate it!!We'll be back!

This is our 3rd time to stay at the hotel, former name was Grand pacifica le daiba hotel. They still offer free shuttle to disney resorts which is great for families going to disney. Perfect location since its also walking distance to diver city mall and aqua city. Across is the daiba station if you want to go somewhere else like shibuya or ginza. We watched a very nice display of fireworks outside the hotel around 7pm then had new year eve dinner at the hotel. Food was very good especially the roast beef and fried xiao long bao. They even surprised us with a souvenir photo of us dining as our wedding anniversary present. All the staff were pretty helpful and organized... would surely recommend this hotel. Tip: get their harmony membership card.its free.. before you book room directly so that you can use as discount for room and for dining. And hotel is just 25 minutes away from haneda airport

Really spacious room in Tokyo area. Very comfortable with great views and convenient as well. Big shopping malls're just within 5 to 10 minutes walk. There's free shuttle bus going to/from Disney Land/Sea. Save much in this aspect. Will consider to stay next time.

2 nights in a standard room.Location: Odaiba is far away from the busy districts like Shibuya and Shinjuku. It is also alot less crowded! The area has plenty of malls and restaurants. It is also very commercialized and catering to tourists who want to do some serious shopping. The hotel itself is conveniently located train stations. The malls are linked via an elevated walkway for added convenience.Rooms: Rather big for japanese standards, especially the bathroom.Service: Top notch!! Friendly and efficient staff who are always ready to help.Overall: Good choice if you want to visit Odaiba.

wonderful hotel at the heart of odaiba, one of the biggest restroom in japan , toiletries the are great shieseido for facial wash love it. comfy beddings . doorstep to gandam diversity mall. definitely will be back here

We visited Japan as part of an organised tour & this was the first hotel we stayed in. The hotel is lovely, with very attentive staff, high quality food and very comfortable rooms. The only downside for us was the location; whilst there is a lot to see in Daiba, it is quite a long way from central Tokyo, necessitating a train ride in order to reach the underground, and then on to the city centre. This does not detract from the hotel, but is worth bearing in mind when planning your itinerary. We will definitely visit Tokyo again, as it's an amazing place, but next time will stay much more central.

We have visited Tokyo a few times staying at different locations and hotel chains. This time we are in for 3 nights and was arranged for Grand Nikko on our private group arrangements. Grand Nikko has one of the bigger rooms and toilets. We traveled in a big group and had taken some double and triple rooms. The double room is spacious with enough room for two to move around comfortably in the toilet, had two double beds in each of the double rooms. The tripple room is even bigger with 2 double beds and a very comfortable add on bed which is 3½ feet and not those floded in half type of row away beds. The toilets for the triple is also comparatively larger with a standing shower and a separate bath tub. Staffs were courteous and polite, greeted you on sight everytime. There were 3 choices for Breakfast, one for just Japanese cusine and another buffet style mixing with continental and a continental breakfast restaurant. We had ours all 3 days at the buffet which was at 30th floor the highest floor in the building. It was beautiful with magnificent views of the rainbow bridge, statute of liberty and at good clear days you can see mount Fuji. The food spread was wide and fresh, definely one of the best breakfast selections I had through out my two weeks journey. Location :Daiba station is just next to hotel. There are shopping malls like Aqua city and Diver city. Just a short stroll you will reach the statute of liberty, enjoy the close up view of the Rainbow bridge, it is really beautiful at night. This place do not have the usual hussle and bussle of Tokyo main shopping area but for people who prefer to stay in a more peaceful part of Tokyo yet have the option for simple shopping fare, this will be a place to consider. It is just next to the Hilton in Daiba station.

We stayed here over Christmas with our 2 kids. We could only get a 3 bed room but we made it work. Our room had a nice view, clean and was a good size. It's located right beside the Daiba train station (not JR so you have to pay every time you go off Odaiba). There are some malls right by the hotel with shops and activities and food to do if you don't want to venture off the island. We didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel so can't comment on those. There is a gym but they charge you to use it....not something we are use to having to pay extra for in any of our travels. We didn't use it partly because of the additional cost.

We chose this hotel for 2 reasons. The first was because we wanted to do some shopping at Aqua City, while the second was that we wanted the convenience of taking the airport limousine bus from Narita Airport. Both Grand Nikko Hotel and Hilton Hotel are connected with Aqua City via a pathway. Since we were travelling with our young boy, we requested for a room near the elevator, which the hotel generously offered. The staffs were very kind and helpful and most could speak English.The room was of Japanese standard-size. The location of the hotel would be convenient for those planning to go to Disneyland or Disneysea. But getting to Tokyo is about a 15-minute train ride or a 20-minute taxi ride (~ 4,000 Yen). Overall, I would recommend this hotel due to its convenient location to Aqua City and nearby.

I was staying at Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba for 2 nights during my recent tour to Japan. Service rendered was excellent throughout my stay. Breakfast served on the 30th level was probably the best hotel breakfast I ever had and the view of Odaiba Bay was amazing. Food selection was great and delicious. I strongly recommend the fresh fruit juice blended on the spot. Room was clean, spacious and comfortable. It is right next to Daiba Station on Yurikamome Line which connects to major lines across Tokyo via Shimbashi. Within walking distance are various big malls with lots of shopping and dining options. The excellent service and accessibility made my short stay in Tokyo a great one!

This is a very nice 5 star hotel, great looking inside and very goodlocation for metro station right outside and the Aqua shoppig center also just outside as are several other attractions such as Tokyo Bay and the Statue of Liberty is right there as well.Our room overlooked the bay and a park right below, quite nice. Service is excellant.The lobby staff is very good but when you check in know some japanese as their english is a bit rusty to ours, I struggeled a bit. That said the hotel and staff are excellant. Would stay again without question.

Hotel Grand Nikko, Daiba is right st the gateway to Daiba Family Fun entertainment, food and shopping for everyone in the family.When you had all your normal Disney visits, Shinjuku, Harajuku, Shibuya, Asakusa sights this is an area worth a visit.Stayed at Grand Nikko Daiba as the trains to reach the other parts of Tokyo is so accessible. Go for the one day pass on the Yurikamome train (unlimited for 820 yen)Grand Nikko is a grandeur hotel typical of a 5 star establishment with a grand wedding stage in metal staircase deck (almost 20 m high) depicting "Titanic" It has great service, great F&B and super clean.There are Seagfredo Coffee, rustic cafes, bakeries and a 24 hour convenience shop that takes care of almost all your needs just a stone throw around the hotel compound.The entertainment complex is Daiba is a full day or two of family fun.Shopping at Aqua City and Diver City has all the major brands for mid market covering H&M, Uniglo, Adidas and lots of food from fast food, coffees joints and all kinds of shop including a Gundam Cafe.At the night the view is stupendous of a New York scene with the office Tower lining up the opposite side of Tokyo and the Rainbow Bridge lighted up in Rainbow colours.The bridge does look like Brooklyn Bridge.Good to take walks on both sides of the broadway facing Diver Mall and the Decks Tokyo beach side.Word of caution, winds can reach great heights but the feeling is GREATOther very great sights are - Fuji TV Station - Panasonic Centre (Technology showcase for latest home electronic and entertainment)- Mega Web (Technology showcase for car and accessories)- Museum of Science (Miraikan) showcasing latest in Robotics- Daikanratha - the largest Ferris wheel in the world in 1999 @ 115 metre but with all the London Eye and other global city eyes this is a bit outdated.- Museum of Maritime Science- A huge GUNDAM Robot at the front of Diver CityThis is surely another place to explore in Tokyo and accessibility is also great.For travel in Tokyo unless you are quite sure of your destinations it is best to skip all the passes and go for a prepaid card. There are 2 such cards and I opt for the Suica preloaded and you can use any of the transportation in Tokyo including some cafes and shops.This is quite important as you do not want to keep buying tickets as Tokyo is super fast pace with people rushing from all corners to all corners.Peak time travelling (going to work and after work) can be quite an experience so get the card and just scan in and scan out like the Tokyolites. Go to Shibuya crossing - human merging into 5 zebra crossing to cross the street.Mind you that itself is a tourist attraction with Loccitane shop going into cafe business to have the view of "Shibuya Crossing"The best and cheaper option is of course "Starbucks" view - "AWESOME"

I recently traveled to Japan with my mum earlier in the year and our first destination was Odaiba, Tokyo.We stayed in a Luxury Double room and it was well worth the rate. Comfortable beds, high-end complimentary products and the rooms were sound-proof.\The property is located across from the Odaiba train station which makes internal travel very convenient. Local shops were available at the base of the hotel and there was a corner convenient store which we often found ourselves going to for a midnight snack!The hotel staff were very welcoming and spoke English. Those that didn't found someone to assist. The concierge was particularly helpful when we asked for assistance with local attractions and transit.We also received complimentary transfers to and from Disneyland/DisneySea through the hotel.There was also a free shuttle bus around Odaiba which we were able to catch from the front of the hotel.This service does a loop of the area included popular shopping and entertainment destinations. Negative: The laundry service was very expensive. For 5 items we paid AUD$112.Be sure to research item prices before using this service as we got a nasty surprise when we were checking out.Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend to travelers within the Odaiba district.

We loved this hotel and Odaiba very much. The hotel so convinient just next to Daiba monorail station and yet a lot of children attractive activities. Grand Nikko Odaiba is a luxurious 5 stars with very nice serving staff. It provides free shuttle to Tokyo Disney land/sea fir go and return. The price when we booked was really good value for our four days of stay at Odaiba. The room and bathroom was spacious so we really recommended for family travellers.Keep it up your good services and cleanliness.Regards,Soleiman

Last time I was here I did not have time to explore around the area. This time I did and I was very happy for the additional time. I was able to walk through the atrium and out to the water. Luckily I was there at the right time as there was a fireworks show with the Tokyo Skyline in the background. The only negative thing I would have to say about the hotel is that the concierge was not helpful. I was asking about their complimentary shuttle to Disney however she kept telling me to take a taxi. I decided that I would go to my room and call the front desk to hopefully help me. She told me to call the bell desk. I did and the gentleman was very helpful and put my name on the list.

What a wonderful location and even more wonderful staff. The hotel room was large and bright. And the view from the top floors are amazing. There are shopping malls with modern stores within walking distance. There is also a train just steps away that can take you into the center of Tokyo. Highly recommend.

My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in December 2016. The entire property is spotless and there are staff everywhere to assist you with whatever you may need. Communicating in English was never a problem. There is a train station right next to the hotel so getting to and from the city or HND airport is very simple. The hotel is located in an area that has many, many restaurants and stores. A 24-hour convenience store is nearby that has the usual stuff as well as a pretty good selection of sushi, noodles, sake, beer, etc. I can't think of anything bad to say about the Grand Nikko, we would stay there again without hesitation.

Excellent location with views looking back towards the city. Monorail station right outside.Hotel clean, staff polite and very helpful.Room clean with comfortable bed and lovely bathroom.Breakfast excellent except it got very busy and once we had to wait to be seated for about 15 minutes.Would definitely stay there again should we visit Tokyo

First of all, booking through hotels.com saved us 1/3 of the money versus booking on Bookings.com or the Priceline sites. Many people think Daiba (Tokyo Bay) is out of the way from Tokyo and it is generally speaking as compared to Ginza or Shibuya. However, if you have children or want bigger rooms at better price and a place to walk in nature i.e. by the water in the bay or want value for your money, then the Grand Nikko is the hotel for you. The service is exceptional and if you are North American, remember that tipping is actually impolite in Japan, so enjoy the service and don't tip (there is something freeing about not having to tip everyone that takes your bags, answer questions, room service etc.). The metro ride (separate payment) in Shimbashi Station in Tokyo is something straight out of the movies--automatic train (no drives or conductors) and through futuristic buildings. Just amazing.The rooms are very big and luxurious. 2 medium size shopping malls are close by.If you are a tourist and taking the trains, you may find the 600yen day pass to be the greatest value, even better than IC cars, though IC cards allow you the freedom to travel about. Oh and the gym, while a $10 supplement is well worth the experience and allows you to take a free yoga class, swim in warm 20 yard swimming pool, jazuzzi, sauna's, baths etc. Well worth the experience to wind down or begin the day--just loved it. You can save money without the harbour view and breakfast

The hotel room was large enough for the 3 of us and there was still enough space to move around comfortably. The area space in the bathroom and toilet were more than generous and well designed.The train station was just within walking distance so it was convenient to get around, But what was the plus factor for all of us after the busy coomuter rush in downtown Tokyo was to return to the lovely surroundings, walkaways and waterfront. The Rainbow Bridge with illumination was a lovely treat to behold! .

4 star hotel minus 1 star for the lousy location. This is a large, modern hotel with good sized rooms, but located far from anything but a mall. The hotel itself is nice, but you have to take a 20 minute ride on the Yurikamome line (which is NOT covered by any metro pass) to get there. There's really nothing interesting out at Daiba. The gym and pool are really nice, though there is an extra 1080 Yen charge to use it (not that big a deal for me but it may be for others).Concierge was very helpful making reservations, etc. Overall a nice hotel but next time I'd find somewhere closer to....anything!

Very good bath tub with good shower gel, bath salt and shampoo. Good view of the rainbow bridge too. Friendly staff and luxurious look and feel to the entire setup. Right in the middleish of legoland and the life size Gundam attraction. Right next to the rail station too!

Just a change in the name, but same quality and service. 1. Top location, right in front of the Tokyo Bay and Rainbow bridge, accessible directly from the subway and with a good mall (Aqua City) at 5 minutes walking, with almost 50 places for dinner, Japanese and international. 2. Rooms much bigger than Japanese standard. 3. First class buffet breakfast, western. 4. Perfect bar at the ground floor for a beer or whisky before going to sleep. 5. With just a 10 minutes walking, you can enjoy the biggest Gundam I've ever seen in my old life. 6. 10 minutes by subway to the Big Sight. 7. If you have time to spend and the weather is fine, you can wlak all the day long on the pedestrian area along the bay.

We were in Tokyo for business at the convention center Big Sight. The Grand Nikko is only a couple tram stops away. Also the shuttle bus from Narita airport that stops at the Grand Nikko. The staff are very friendly and always want to be helpful. When we booked our room we did take the room on a higher floor with a view of the Rainbow bridge. It was well worth the extra money. We had beautiful sunny fall days and clear nights, so the view was spectacular. The room was a good size room. Sometimes you can get small rooms in Tokyo, but this was not the case. The bathroom had everything you needed plus more. The tram is a 2 minute walk from the hotel.The tram can take you into the Tokyo city. The restaurant at the Grand Nikko are expensive, so we did not eat there. There is a shopping mall, Aqua City, that has a lot of restaurants for a reasonable price. Eating at shopping mall restaurants in Japan are very common, local cuisine and delicious. We actually went back to a Sushi restaurant 3 times. We really like the location of the hotel. Right on the water with beautiful walkways and views. The next we are here on business we will definitely stay at the Grand Nikko.

Great location if approaching from Haneda airport. Limousine bus brings you straight to the hotel in ca. 30 mins. Great bars and restaurants. Highly courteous and professional staff willing to rectify any small problem or assist with any request. Right next to an underground station so access to downtown Tokyo is a given. Popular with families going to Disney too. Stayed there many times for business and would recommend the place most highly

Luxurious family room with 4 beds in a room. Great for family of 2 adults and 2 children. Nice tub for children to play water. Good shower area with wonderful water pressure. Children loved the chandelier in the room. Disappointed with the lack of cartoon channels for TV shows. Staff is very friendly but make sure ask several staff just to be sure of answers on bus tickets. Found different answers which was confusing. Very near train station and has bus service to airport but take note that advance reservation is very important as the bus can be packed. Very good hotel as its luxuriously comfortable. Could be excellent if the price is more reasonable and provide more guidance to travellers on the amenities.

Daiba is a new area for Tokyo so although a bit away from the center, it is easily accessible and a great spot to discover the science museum and the river side. The hotel is beautiful, bed very comfortable. A western type of room with comfort and much bigger than downtown hotels. Breakfast was a bit disappointing in terms of western choice but big buffet and great view at the top of the hotel. The shuttle/limo service to the airport is reasonable and support convenient too. A great spot for 1 or 2 nights and get a different look at Tokyo.

Have stayed here serveral times, and while under different management virtually nothing has changed. Nothing wrong about hotel, though breakfast is often so busy you'll wait 5-15 mins before you can get a table. Plenty of mall shopping and chain-type dining nearby, I wouldn't staying here on my own due to Daiba's less-than-convenient-location if my Company didn't use this's as a gathering hotel (presumably due to reasonable cost.)Slept comfortably in bed, shower was decent size with excellent pressure.

i stayed in grand nikko Daiba for 5 days and 4 nights .Clear view of the local monorail service from my 12th floor room and the harbour.. very traditional hotel with large rooms and ballrooms and conference centre downstairs A .large breakfast buffet with everything you could want to eat both Japanese and western and friendly English speaking staff.quite close to a local shopping precinct with lots of choices for local food and drink.Had an enjoyable sushi dinner with a friend for not much money.good room service,very efficient hotel,quiet rooms and helpful staff ,although they cant all speak or understand English.good connecting bus for the airport

Room had a fantastic view and was very spacious. Location is good - close enough to get to the CBD but not too close. Plenty of shopping malls and local restaurants - just venture outside the hotel into local areas for something a bit cheaper.

Location is good. Located around a few malls. Right in front of Daiba station and few stops away to Shimbashi where we can access to the subway. Can be very crowded with events on weekend. Nice view from the hotel overseeing the rainbow bridge. It would be even better if most of the staff in the hotel knows how to speak English. Realised that only the higher position staff knew how to speak English. And Level 30 restaurant's staff are of lesser smile compared to the restaurant at Level 3.Great stay overall.

Stayed at Grand Nikko Daiba the last day of our Tokyo trip. We chose this hotel and the location because its near to the airport. The hotel has just refurbished not too long ago. It used to be Grand Le Daiba hotel. The lobby is tastefully decorated. The room and bathroom is huge in Tokyo standard. The housekeeping team has done a great job. The room and bathroom is spotless clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you plan to stay at Odaiba.

This was my first hotel coming over from the U.S.A., so I wanted comforts as I adjusted to the time difference. The conceirge was generous and upgraded me to a water view. When I go back I will not risk the hope for an upgrade and I will book a room overlooking the water. It was everything I have ever dreamed of for a hotel room view.Every night I would sit in the window and watch people go out on the boats with the Rainbow Bridge as the background. It was so wonderful to wind down with that view. Every morning I would get up and walk the parks.One thing I would advise to people who like to eat, especially before 10am - either preorder breakfast or purchase snacks to keep up your energy. This area doesn't really get moving until 9-11am and a few times I got hangry. Otherwise this hotel was a dream and I highly recommend it, especially for couples.

The Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba is one of the most centrally located hotels in Tokyo, and is a good neighbor hotel of Disney Resort, hence the free shuttle to and from Disneyland and Disneysea Tokyo. It is also just 20 minutes by bus from Haneda International Airport.

Hotel is near rail system and great shopping area with many food choices.Hotel restaurant has breskfast buffet that is very good with many choices.ATM is just outside the Hotel front door in a 7/11 store.

Stayed at the hotel one night for family vacation. wanted to visiti Disney resort Tokyo.But I booked flight arriving afternoon, so we wanted to stay at thje place a bit closer to down town.Hotel is very close to yurikamome(monorail like train) station, which means you can use public transit quite easily. Meanwhile yorikamome charges more expensive farethan usual train or subway. If you planning to haingn around near Tokyo downtown this place not a best choice. Anyhow this place located at Odaiba area which has quite diverse shopping complex and various restaurants. So you can entertain yourself with convenience.Hotel is clean and provides quite reasonable price. But if you travel with your kids, you might required to stay at triple room and its fare is definitely expensive. Even though I stayed at triple room, you will thinking of about money for value.The most exciting part of this hotel is location of restaurant/cafeteria which located at high level. Hotel suggest three restaurant choices. Unless you must eat Japanes styled breakfast, go to the restaurant at high level. The view from the restaurant is really fascinating. Hotel is clean and quite spacious and reasonable.Triple room is not a recommended choice.Breakfast buffet location is fantastic(food is just normal), wake up early and sit on the window side.

This hotel is amazing and is in the heart of the city with jaw dropping views. It's steps away from the main shopping centres and train lines so rest assured you won't have to do much walking to get around. We stayed on the 14th floor and we had everything we needed. Seen as though it's Japan we couldn't have asked for a bigger area as I think that's as big as it got for a standard room. Service was great, smoking rooms and they were very well maintained.Room services and food was very expensive in this hotel. I love room service and would pay a bit extra all the time for this luxury, it is something i look forward to in hotels but prices were ridiculous that I didn't order anything but chips and drinks.We had dinner on the 30th floor one night I recommend you try thatRestaurant atleast once during your stay at night. You will understand what your paying for as its amazing and the staff there are professional and well trained. The wines and the food was out of this world. I had the crab pastaAnd it was to die for. Wish the meals were bigger in portions as they do charge you top $$. I usually like a nice steak but being from Australia I didn't see the point of paying $70 dollars for an Australian steak in Japan.Like I said it is an awesome hotel and what you pay for is luxury and location. Location being what I found the most attractive out of everything.9/10

First off, the rooms are good and spacious, something that is hardly found in hotels nearer to the city centre.Secondly, the hotel is located right next to a monorail that connects to Shinbashi Station on the the JR Yamanote Line (Loop or Circle Line), which takes you to most of the rest of Tokyo. I didn't mind the need to transfer trains because the ride on the monorail from Shinbashi almost always ensures available seats in the train back to the hotel after a hard day's walking.Thirdly, the hotel is connected via walkways on the second floor to shops and eateries, so on evenings we didn't feel like being too far from the hotel, we dined and shopped there. Those with children would be delighted with the number of places available for their children to play in.Moreover, the hotel is a Disney Good Neighbour Hotel, meaning that there are free shuttle buses that took us directly to Disneyland.We were very happy with the hotel and would definitely return when we return to Tokyo again.

This is a modern hotel in an excellent location within easy walking distance of 3 shopping malls where you will find numerous reasonably priced eating places. The bedroom and bathroom were very good and of a decent size - the beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning was efficient. There was a considerable amount of road noise though which carried on all through the night - ear plugs needed! The breakfast buffet was small and pretty average but adequate.

excellent hotel,, good service, excellent view , super clean ang a lot of space but for business out side of the island, it take more time and the transportation close before midnight. we had a goor experience

I stay in this hotel for 5 days. Room is okay. Location is not convenient to city center. Take time and costly to take subway to other location in the city. Leave 1 day for sightseeing .. but Not allow to keep luggage in the hotel after checkout!

Good quality,high standard hotel with loads of bars restaurants very close by.A pleasant walk in the promenade in front of the hotel. Room very clean helpful and pleasant staff who spoke English. Excellent breakfast Monorail has to be taken every time one wants to go to Tokyo.

This hotel is located on Odaiba, it means that you should take the monorail every time you want to go Tokyo but if you get it at good price then it is not a problem because it is 20 min by monorail to ShimbashiI recommend it only if you get it at really good price Room is big and clean and staff are nice

This hotel is booked for me to attend Film market, it's super close to where the event was, right at the bottom floor, easy and comfortable. Room and service were great. Food also. Subway is also in front of one of the hotel's exit.

Enjoyed a 3 night stay at this hotel before a cruise from Yokohama.This hotel was our first and lasting impression of Japan. It is beyond any criticism,It was immaculately clean,superb bedrooms with first class bathrooms.Breakfast was a mixture of Japanese and Western foods to suit every guest.Plentiful and extremely varied.There is a 24 hour shop within the confines of the hotel where food for picnic lunches etc can be purchased as well as very good Japanese whisky.General food prices in Japan is surprisingly cheap unless you want to buy a melon !!!!A train station is within yards of this hotel,it runs on a circular route.Just opposite the hotel are 2 shopping malls.If we visit Tokyo again this is the hotel we would want to stay in.

Stayed here for 2 days whilst attending a concert at Zepp Tokyo.Efficient check in, room was fine. Only found one western channel (CNN News) but didn't spend much time in the room anyway.Excellent hotel, great location and also very easy to get to and from Haneda Airport on the limousine service.

Enjoyed three days pre cruise. Very good hotel, staff were very helpful, very easy access to railway station and easy to use. Very nice room and delicious breakfast. Two large shopping malls within walking distance, both had food halls, so very convenient for dinner and not expensive.

Wonderful three day stay in Tokyo on our way to Okinawa, Taipei, Shanghai, & Hong Kong via Celebrity Millennium Cruise Line. Hotel Grand Nikko in downtown Tokyo was outstanding. A1 accommodation with excellent hotel staff, management, and all the amenities an American traveler could possibly expect. We highly recommend staying here. Close to everything a Tokyo tourist could envision. Next step - we are off to Mount Fuji in the morning. More later.

What a great hotel, with an even greater location. It is walking distance to two very large shopping malls, and even closer to the JR train system which is easy to understand and use. We bought tickets at the station and did our own thing in Tokyo, no problems at all.Large well appointed rooms, comfy beds and a good breakfast.

We come to this hotel regularly. Very good location on the Odaiba island, next to two large department stores with lots of restaurants, right on the Yurikamome monorail station, great views from higher floors. Service is also very good and even the cheaper rooms reasonable size by Japanese standars. However, the dirty carpets in the rooms are an eyesore not commensurate with this standard of hotel. Now that it has been take over by the Nikko brand (formerly it was Grand pacific), it is high time to replace the carpets!

We stayed at this property for 3 nights as our base camp to explore Tokyo. I reserved about 8 month ahead of our planned visit and received an unbelievably good rate. The hotel is situated away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo and guarantees a good nights sleep. It takes about 30 to 40 min to reach all major sites by public transportation. The monorail stop is adjacent to the property. The rooms and bathrooms have recently been renovated and are very clean. Super hot water and great water pressure. The rooms are spacious for Japanese standards and since we travel only with a 20" carry-on each, we had no issues with space. In case you travel with lots of luggage you might find it a little difficult to move around the room. We stayed on the 22nd floor with a great view of the rainbow bridge. The rooms are very well insulated, we never had any issues with noise from neighbors. We never tried the dining at the hotel due to the high price( $30 for breakfast), but found everything we needed at the 24 hr convenience store by the rear entrance of the hotel. There is no coffee bar for early risers, but we found a vending machine outside the lobby. It offers several different kinds of coffee including lattes for yen 250 and they are tasty! There are lots of inexpensive dining choices in the malls very close to the hotel( 5 min walk). The hotel employees are trying very hard to communicate with you in English, but their capabilities are limited. In any case, their English is better than my Japanese. We really enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to return.

The hotel is so big and so central to everything! Daiba is definitely a place in Tokyo if you plan to go shopping with the beautiful views, great scenery and who could not notice the rainbow bridge with the sea with sand you can visits underneath. All this at such a short distant and not to mention apparently it's the place to go to if you are a Pokemon fan ! Ok let's be more precise... you are basically 3 steps away from 3 of the biggest shopping centres that are TAX FREE. After you have finished walking around which could take a day you are literally take all your bags and shopping back to the hotel which is situated 2mins across the bridge where you can actually walk pass the Statue of Liberty (yes, Statue of Liberty scaled down) and if you are having problems to sleep why not drop by the beach as it was still busy at 1am and don't worry Japan is the safest place you can walk around. The hotel is very clean and very bright and the views is absolutely breath taking! I would definitely use this hotel again and will return as its one of my favourite so far.

Stayed here for the 2nd time already. The place was still called Grand Pacific Le Daiba.They have a free shuttle to Disney which is very convenient. There is also a convenience store nearby which serves hot food, pasta, sandwiches - an good option to have especially for late night cravings. The hotel is close to malls and attractions such as Legoland, Sega Joypolis and Diver City.The bathroom amenities were superb. Shiseido facial kits were also replenished everyday. As in everything in Japan, everything was flawlessly clean.

The hotel is lovely, location great for views snd short walks. Right nearby is Statue of Liberty replica as well as GW bridge replica. There is convenience store right on premises. Train station is right there, as well as 4 shopping centers. Beds are comfy as is the room. Restaurants on hand with buffet that is western and Japanese. All is very nice. Staff is outstanding - so pleasant and available. Breakfast view is super, can't stop photographing.

Wonderful hotel and staff. Local train on the doorstep, and minutes walk for shopping, dining, and entertainment. Views are some of the best in Tokyo! Convenient bus transfer to Narita airport is available. Will stay here again, we loved it here!

We stayed at the Grand Nikko for 2 nights after a cruise from Vancouver to Tokyo. The location is awesome... connected to a train station that took us so easily to virtually anywhere in Tokyo. The room was extremely comfortable. Large bathroom with separate tub and shower plus those fascinating electric/water based toilet seats! I am allergic to feathers so a housekeeper came to the room, stripped the bed and totally remade it with non-allergic materials. There was a festival on the grounds adjacent to the hotel. The soundproofing of the rooms was excellent, even muted a 9pm (exactly) fireworks display that cascaded right outside our 20th floor accommodation. The room rate included a buffet breakfast on the top of the hotel (don't forget to take your camera). We found the restaurants a little pricy but the TWO shopping centres that are almost connected to the hotel housed a multitude of restaurants from food fairs to some amazing eateries. A great property I would use again.

Stayed here five nights during a convention. The hotel is a true five star property. Great ;lobby and restaurants. The room is large and have nice views. The bathroom is very large and mine had a window with views. Fantastic amenities in the room including all the bathroom amenities and kits. Great beds. Service at front desk and concierge are top. The hotel is located about 15 minutes from Ginza by the monorail and thus very accessible to the entire city. Highly recommended.

I like staying in this hotel when I go to Tokyo especially when I take the kids with me. This hotel is situated in Odaiba. The rooms are huge and comfortable. The design is a bit old fashioned but location wise it is very convenient. Breakfast in this hotel is good. Shops and restaurants are nearby. The hotel also offers shuttle to disneyland. Suitable for families.

This hotel looks like those grand old five star hotels in Australia. In corridors and rooms, furnishing is luxurious, but old and tired. Rooms are really big, even by Australia standard. It is situated right next to the Odaiba light rail station, with the much more expensive Hilton on the other side of the station. We stayed on level 19, with beautiful view of Tokyo Bay.

This hotel was chosen for us by Gate One travel who organized entire trip to Japan.Service staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable, clean and with nice view. Hotel located in beautiful neighborhood which looks safe and pleasant for walking from early morning to late evening. You may find nearby multiple restaurants in Aqua City including some very exotic. I am not saying that you will like their food for sure. When you take breakfast on hotel's 30th floor which was prearranged for us by Gate One, you can see through windows great and maybe the best part of country's capital. Many people filmed city from there.
user_name:
Viktor G
New York City, New York

review_body: Four day visit with a tour group. Served well as a starting point for each day's sightseeing. Included breakfast buffet was substantial, with both Asian and Western choices. Room was comfortable and every member of the staff was very accommodating.

I have stayed here many times the last time was last week September 18th. I think the values was better when they were called grand Pacific La Daiba, but it is still a very luxury hotel with nice amenities and very close to shopping and the Yurikumomi monorail.

Our room was large, great shower,breakfast buffet was good,liked the JR connection to downtown.when checking in the porter staff was not ready for the bus,luggage not tagged,or receipts given.There in great shopping and restaurants right next to the hotel and the J R Station is right there.

When check-in, the receptionist let me show my credit card and told me this is just for a guarantee and I needn't pay now. But after copying my passport, she asked me if I can pay now. I guess intially she din't find I am a chinese because I was speaking in English but later she found I am a chinese so asked me pay now. This is not a good way to welcome people and show how unprofessional she is and how poor the hotel is.

Was there on business trip. Surprised at the room size .. Bigger than a usual Tokyo hotel room. Very near to train station but far from the central shopping belt like Shinjuku and Ginza. However there are big shopping complex with outlets like uniqlo which is within walking distance from hotel.

I am writing this while waiting in the lobby for our Airport Limousine bus back to Narita. We came to Japan to celebrate my husbands birthday and upon landing at Narita we were impressed by everyone's compassion and eagerness to help. The staff at Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba made us feel welcome and comfortable. We do not speak Japanese and never felt that it was a barrier, as everyone is so happy to accommodate and assist. I would recommend renting a wifi router from the airport and installing google translate on your smartphone..google translate has the ability to read text on menus! It is noteworthy that we drove from the hotel to Mt Hakone and maintained impeccable 4g service on the mountain pass.We are sad to leave this beautiful country and awesome hotel, but eager to return- especially to Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba!

All moms need a holiday to sleep, see different perspective, take a breather to relax and recover. Enough to have energy to miss their family. Thankfully this was just the trip we got. The rates from trip was excellent. The rooms was enough for my sister and I. We got the most awesome view, staff speak great English because the area is the most touristy spot in Tokyo. Great location! Near the haneda airport. Only paid 520¥ for the bus straight to the hotel. Near the train, 3 big malls tax free shopping, great for family with kids, food galore, scenic but really Touristy. Not authentic Japan, but if you can't be bothered, for a quick trip, this area reminds me of Hong Kong Gateway area. If you want to book tours, you can do it in the concierge, or the mall. I'll definitely go back with my kids.

The hotel is quite big and situated on the artificial island Odaiba. Since it is not directly in the city center the rooms are very spacious for Tokio standards. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. You have an amazing view on Odaiba and the city.The Grand Nikko is close to the Tokio Big sight (huge, stylish exhibition hall), the copy of the statue of liberty, several big malls, cinemas and of course the huge Gundam statue. The location is also one of the drawbacks of this hotel. If you buy a metro card for Tokio you are not allowed to use the Yurikamome line which connects Oaiba to the mainland. Another minus for this hotel are the pool and the gym. I checked trip advisor for hotels that offer both. Unfortunately we found out after our checkin that both is not free of charge. If you want to use the gym and the pool there is a membership fee (1.080 Yen).Also service could be improved. I booked a room with one queen size bed. When we arrived we had a room with two beds. Staff was neither able to help nor to communicate.I think next time I would stay in a hotel more central in Asakusa or Shinjuku.

Stayed 2 nights at start of Japan tour. Very comfortable and well equipped rooms and helpful staff. Breakfast was included in restaurant on top floor with amazing views of Tokyo Bay and Rainbow Bridge.Very well located with several large shopping malls, including earring places, within 5 minutes walk. These are necessary because the hotel restaurants were very expensive.Away from main Tokyo chaos in quiet Bay area with Metro station to connect to all main Tokyo lines and attractions immediately outside hotel entrance. Overall excellent start to holiday and would stay again.

We stayed there 3month ago that was very nice hotel with good location near the monorail station and there were very good shopping center . my husband and I stayed there for second time because this hotel is very clean especially the bathroom .really it had different items for guests comfort . there were great amount of shampoo and conditioner in big containers .The important thing for me was the ATM machine in lobby for Exchange money .The most positive point about this hotel was the behavior of the staff which was very polite and friendly .

Pro's: Good location, close to four shopping malls where locals shop, good hotel service, scenic (in terms of bridge and city views). Cons: Swimming pool charges has to go, lobby buffet (Dinner) not worth it, Tips: Do not tip in Japan. It is included and may be considered offensive, Convenience store outside hotel is open 24 hours and good value. Food at the malls are decent and also offer "Western" food and some fast foods. Bring your passport when shopping, you are eligible for Duty free which is a savings of up to 8%. The lighted boats under the bridge are actually ferries that take you to various locations. I gave the rooms two stars because they can actually accommodate up to 4 people for double rooms but we were required to book two rooms.

We have booked this hotel because it has a pool; summers in Tokyo are hot, we had up to 38 ° C! We have never seen that as a guest of a hotel we would have to pay $ 26.00 per person to enter the pool area, even kids above 11 years! This unconvenient situation was even topped by the fact, that we did not have access to the pool when we wanted to go! We were told the pool was also open to the public and as they pay $ 100.00 per person (!!) on holidays and weekends in high season, the hotel gives them preference. We wanted to go twice and both times the pool was full and they would let in no one else! Preference has to be given to the hotel guests and not to exterior guests!! We were extremly unsatisfied by this and also by the response of the staff!

After booking two night via Hotels.com I notice some reviews said they were surprised that they were charged a fee to use the pool. Mind you there is absolutely no reference to a fee on hotels.com and none I could find on TripAdvisor. So I called and indeed they charge extra to use the facilities there. So I was charged a "resort fee" when I booked but yet I didn't have access to the pool so what exactly is the fee for? Needless to say I cancelled my stay immediately.
user_name:
nikimari1
New York City, New York

review_body: Travelers: Family of 3Room Selected: Superior Twin Room 1939During our recent stay at the Grand Nikko Daiba, we found the hotel to be very pleasant and the staff was friendly and very outgoing. Check-in was handled smoothly without a wait and our room was ready earlier than expected at 2pm. Our selected superior twin room was well appointed and very clean. All of the areas in the hotel seem to be very up-to-date in their appointments and furnishings and our room was no exception. We had plenty of space available for my child's portable crib. The room included a small refrigerator, which was convenient for storing beverages and small snacks. The bathroom was trimmed in marble and was a good size, similar to a Western hotel. Wi-fi was included in our room rate. For those considering a visit to Tokyo Disney, the Nikko Grand is a Disney Resort Partner hotel offering special transportation options to the park.The hotel has several restaurants. While we did dine at the hotel, the breakfast buffet on the lobby level looked very nice. There is a very nice little convenience store, which is open 24 hours a day, located just outside the main entrance. The hotel is connected by a walkway to the Daiba Station on the Yurikamome Line, making access very convenient. The walkway also connects the hotel to Aqua City and Diver City malls. If you choose not to pay the money for the hotel breakfast, there is an espresso shop located just outside the main entrance and there are some fast food options on the street level near the Aqua City Mall. Overall, this was a very nice hotel conveniently located to some of the best attractions that Odaiba has to offer.

We booked a room to accommodate my wife and I plus our two boys. The room was great; lovely views across the bay and down to the area by the Aqua shopping mall. Beds were comfy and the boys particularly liked the fact that a Pokestop was accessible from the room!Within a five or ten minute walk you could be down at the big Gundam robot store, or the Aqua shopping mall, or down at the bay shoreline where the trees were full of cicada. The hotel is practically on top of a train station for easy access out of Odaiba.We took a buffet lunch when we arrived, they seem to have themed weeks - this time it was Brazilian believe. Despite that, much of the buffet was food typical of Japanese hotel buffets.We spent a little time by the pool to cool down - which after paying for sunbeds ended up costing about £100 for a couple of hours. The gym, which is also an extra charge, doesn't open until 7:30 in the morning - so when I awoke at 5am there wasn't that much to do.There were plenty of little convenience stores and food outlets nearby; we ate in the sushi restaurant which was good - the sushi chef passed us the sushi one piece at a time, waited for us to eat it then prepared the next piece. Lovely meal.All in all we enjoyed our time at the Grand Nikko and we would recommend it to others spending a few days in Odaiba.

One of the hotels that does impress you first time. Coming to the hotel with the above ground rail is easy and convenient. Breakfast is served at two locations. We opted for the top floor with a city view. It gets crowded but view is nice.One of the better hotels during our stay in Japan.

We only stayed here for a couple of nights over the weekend but it was a great location for sightseeing around Odaiba. Train station was right out the front door, a minute or two walk. We did find the restaurants to be extremely expensive. Luckily, there is quite a bit around you so go explore. The hotel is almost directly connected to Diver City and Aqua City by pedestrian walkways, so exploring is easy. The rooms were very comfortable, large by Tokyo standards, but the mattresses were a bit on the firm (ok, they were hard...) side for us. We found this to be the case both western-style hotels we stayed at in Tokyo, so no "heavenly beds" for us...We were so tired after walking all day, so it only started to wear on us at the end of our trip.Overall, friendly and helpful staff, large and clean facilities, great accessibility, and reasonable (It's not cheap!) pricing for where you are...it's a great combination and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Our first trip to Tokyo and we are glad we stayed at The Grand Nikko as it was a little bit away from the crowds of downtown. The hotel was undergoing a change of name while we were there which did not affect our stay at all. The staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. The hotel had a large variety of restaurants, bars and convenience stores but there is also a couple of large malls close by. My one small problem was that the outdoor hotel was being renovated at the time of our stay and we were expected to pay to use the indoor pool. With the outdoor pool being out of use it would have been nice to have had this fee waived. Other than that no complaints

The hotel is very close the Daiba rail station literally a 5 minute walk and close to a number of shopping malls that are accessed via the walkways. The FUJI TV Centre is close by and good views of the bay to the bridge and the 'Statue of Liberty'.The hotel is very comfortable with an excellent shower and large bath. We had a buffet breakfast which was excellent and you could eat as much as you wished.All the staff were very friendly and polite and generally spoke good English.We stayed here 3 nights prior to going on a cruise and I would highly recommend this location for travelling to other areas around Tokyo.Odaiba itself is extremely clean and there was not a patch of chewing gum to be seen.

The hotel looks out of Tokyo Bay and has panoramic views over the City of Tokyo. The rooms are large and comfortable and offer the most amazing views. From our room on the 19th floor we looked out over the Rainbow Bridge, The Statue of Liberty and in the distance the Tokyo Tower.The service was as you would expect fast efficient and the staff were ever helpful and polite. We only had our Breakfast but they were excellent offering buffet with a wide choice of Japanese and worldwide food

This is a great hotel to stay at if you want to rest in luxury and be near the center of Tokyo. Rooms (and baths) are big by Japanese stds. Finishes are high quality and the service is great. All the staff we met spoke English. Buffet breakfast is outstanding and offered on various floors: 30th floor has best view but is most crowded, 2nd floor view is ok but much quieter. Lots of kid entertainment in Daiba that is walking distance from hotel including Round 1 at Diver Mall which provides 90min all you can play basketball, batting cages, pingpong, video arcade, billards, rollerblade, etc for around $17 adult, $13 kids (you can stay longer for more cost). Diver Mall and Decks Mall have many restaurants and shops. Daiba station is located right outside hotel. We would definitely stay here again for a family trip. Only a few negatives: 1) while near the center of Tokyo, you need to take the Yurimone monorail from Daiba station to connect to the main Tokyo rail system. The cost is about $3 per adult which is higher than the usual rail fees and adds up if you do it very day. 2) there are pools in the hotel but there is a cost to use around $10.

The location is a BIG PLUS! Located right in front of Daiba station. Malls all over the surroundings. Plus the view of the Rainbow Bridge overlooking the hotel is just breathtaking each time. The hotel is a luxury itself. Food is great. Plenty of elevators so one wont wait too long. Staffs are as expected, polite, helpful and friendly. Definitely a hotel where I will come back for. Thanks!!

stayed alone just one night for the convnience of meeting friends in Tokyo.It was OK, as only 15 minutes of Yurikamome monorail from Shimbashi. Maybe because of that distance less expensive thanthe hotels around Shimbashi, Shiodome of Ginza, I thought. But still it is a ittle bit AWAY from the city centre if tha is what you want.DeLux room was nice and comfortable, and clean. Nice walk (or runnng) path along the seeside (although there is construction for enhancing the shore, right now). A convenience storre just next to the hotel entrance (e.g. if you do not wnt to spend over 30 dollers for breakfast, you can pick up some bites there and have in the room.As a whole, it was OK. I am considering if it is worth bringing my family there. It is great for the view of docks and ports. Things to do nearby are in rather artificial big buildings - after all ODAIBA is an artificially made island. If you like those things, it would be great.

Beautiful hotel with a metro stop out the front of the hotel. It is not on the JR line therefore the JR tourist ticket is not valid and you need to pay to get to a JR connector station. You can walk off the island via the rainbow bridge, or the hop on hop off bus stop is near by. If you do the bus tour the ticket is good for 24hrs so can save a metro fare to get off the island the next day. There is also a local Odaiba shuttle service to get off the island and it is a bit cheaper than the metro but a bit of a walk to the hotel.We arrived about midday and we were told check-in was at 3pm and they would hold our bags -fair enough. But we were disappointed that another staff member offered to look into an early checkin for the couple behind us.Overall the room was lovely with a view of the rainbow bridge. We were not happy that you must pay to use the gym and swimming pool. We book luxury hotels so that we can enjoy such facilities. I probably would not stay here again.

I am traveling extensively for business worldwide. Due to a show nearby brought me to this hotel. The location, the facilities, gym, spa, shops, restaurants are undeniable fantastic. The room is big, nice view and super clean. Wifi is free and ok speed. BUT: you expect nice, helpful English speaking employees, it was not possible to ask anything as NO ONE speaks English! No one cares anyway. Asked for late check out, of course it was denied. Paid for club floor, so i can get a snack during the day,but there was none, and is closed until late morning and from early evening anyway.The restaurant is poor not setup for a five star hotel. I would never invite a business partner here. Getting a cappuccino is just a dream, food is very badly displayed and no variate at all.Employees are not nice and the lack of language knowledge is a burden. Hard to get your dry cleaning done (and back!!!) or book an airport shuttle. I would not chose this hotel again, rather would go a steady quality Hilton or Spg.

First time at this hotel, 4th time on Odaiba Island. Lots to do here on Odaiba, lots of shopping to eating and game centers. Even the Water Museum is here. This hotel is very nice and the staff really accommodating and friendly. My room is top notch and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. My room through Expedia.com was $120 including tax a night. There is a 20 min city bus that pulls right up to the lobby and takes you straight to Shinagawa Eki for only ¥210 a faster and more continent way than the monorail to Shinbashi Eki. My room rate did not offer me a breakfast buffet. But if the price is right, the breakfast is on the 30th floor of this hotel. The view must be magnificent!

We stayed 4 nights in early July. We had a family room with 4 single beds. Although the beds were singles they seemed bigger than North American single beds. The hotel is very nice and very well situated right by the train to go into Tokyo. There are also plenty of shopping malls and restaurant options within walking distance. We did enjoy the traditional Japanese restaurant that is in the hotel. We had both dinner and breakfast there. Very good and very traditional food. The staff was very polite and very helpful in answering our questions. All the staff that we dealt with had pretty good English abilities. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Located on Odaiba. Very nice, big hotel. Pros: big rooms (we were 2 adults and a 15 year old) and we all had large beds; the bathroom is huge, excellent quality and quantity of amenities; large white fluffy towels; free shuttle bus service around Odaiba and to certain places in Tokyo)... Cons: were not given any info on the free shuttle buses upon check-in, we found out for ourselves almost on the last day; I am personally not a fan of the lobby which looks very badly laid out and almost a work-in-progess. I am also not a fan of the carpeting in the room, which, together with the windows which do not open, make the room feel stuffy. The location is good and bad: good because you are on the island of Odaiba which feels very airy after a day in Tokyo, bad because you have to take the Yurikamome Monorail (or the shuttle buses) to and from Tokyo.

Location of this hotel is very convenient - next to (private) train station, several malls and Daiba area public beach. Quality of rooms and hotel public areas are ok although bit outdated. Hotel staff is friendly. However, please watch out for those hotel facilities of which many are provided by hotel tenants not by hotel itself. Hotel advertizes those facilities openly in their website however some of them might not be available at all and in those instances hotel staff does not take any responsibility for these - blaim for non availability gets outright passed down to hotel tenants or third party booking systems (which in our case we did not use at all). One example of this is hotel pool - indoor pool is strictly available for adults only (our kids were waiting to swim) and outdoor pool remained closed although it was widely publicized in hotel web site to be open throughout the summer.

The grand nikko Hotel was our first stop in Tokyo and it was absolutely amazing. Where to start? Position. It's not centrally located, it's on the artificial Odaiba island, which is conveniently server by the People Mover Yurikamome that with a little over 300 yen takes you to Shimbashi in 15 minutes. The stop is right outside the hotel. Nearby there are a lot of malls that serve dinner until 11 (last order at 10) if you don't fancy going in the city centre. The hotel itself has its restaurant but we didn't eat there as we wanted to explore the city. Staff is always ready and willing to help. Rooms are clean and tidy, Internet is fast and the breakfast was incredible and with stunning views. Should I go to Japan again, I will stay here again!

Stayed for 3 nights and had no complaints. Excellent location, we really loved this area. Room was spacious and comfortable and also quiet. All the staff that we came across were extremely polite and helpful and we had no difficulty with language. Only ate breakfast but there was plenty of choice and we never had to queue , even for the popular top floor restaurant. A range of good quality toiletries provided, plus kimonos and slippers and plenty of towels.Would definitely recommend and would not hesitate to stay there again

We stayed for one night as a couple celebrating our anniversary. The hotel is very close to the Daiba station. You enter though another facility that has a bakery and a convenience store to get to the lobby. Check is was a smooth experience. We had previously paid for our reservation on Hotels.com. The hotel has 6 elevators for its guests so no waiting for minutes at a time to get to your room. One of the English-speaking staff escorted us to our room and made sure everything was in order.The room was just amazing. We had booked a room called "Luxury Extra large King room" on Hotels.com but I'm not sure what the official hotel name is for the room.The room was huge, with a giant window overlooking the Statue of liberty and a great skyline view of Tokyo. The room had a huge bed, a sofa, 2 armchairs, a TV with Japanese channels, a desk, water kettle and lots of storage room for your clothes. Overall the room had a high-end feel to it.The bathroom had a big bathtub, a separate shower, big sink and a "Washlet" toilet. Lots of toiletries.We needed a socket adapter (European to Japanese) which we told the reception when we were leaving the hotel for lunch and the staff brought it up to our room while we were away. WiFi was great. Overall service was excellent.We had the complimentary breakfast at the hotel the next day and even though the buffet-style breakfast didn't offer tons of options, the omelette-station added a nice touch and everything else was decent. I ordered an omelette with extra cheese and he chef made sure I got the correct amount in there, which was a lot.This was among my shorter experiences at a hotel but still one of the best. Overall the hotel just felt right and I couldn't find anything to complain about. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

This hotel is good location in front of beach and next door of Hilton hotel. Very convenient with monorail train " Daiba station in Tokyo. The most popular area, Minato-ward in Tokyo. Just 2 minutes to the station and easy to go to Ginza. Just 15 minutes by train. Many nice restaurants and attraction, Legoland, Joypolis, and Toyota Mega Web. Beautiful beach with Statue of Liberty and Rainbow Bridge. All can be reached by foot. Breakfast on the 30F "Star Road" is worth the price. All staffs have good hospitality, so you feel so relaxed. I recommend you to select this hotel for business and leisure in Tokyo.

This is the great hotel to stay when you not renting a car in Tokyo. The room is clean. Very nice breakfast. Very close to subway station. However we particular requested a non smoking room. But they placed us in a smoking one. Took them 45 mins to arrange us with a non smoking one. If u a China lovers. This a good one Coz many there. But definitely not my favourite part!

nice and comfort hotel. sure will be back staying here. there are coins locker at the entrance hotel in case we need. the subway line is just about the door step. 24 hours convenient store and cafes at the site. hotel located opposite hilton obadai. got free shuttle bus to tokyo disney land
Access is very convenient, directly connecting to the Daiba Station, Yurikamome Line. The room has not renovated yet. Since the room amenity is a lot, it is possible to cope with a sudden lodging.

I truly enjoyed staying at Grand Pacific Le Daiba. The rooms were elegant, spacious and the toilets were an experience in themselves. Heated seats with warm temperature water at varying pressures. It's located on the entertainment island, replete with restaurants, malls and attractions. You must travel to the city center by train (20-30) minutes... perhaps the only downside of the location. Still, the staff was excellent, the food buffet was abundant and accommodating all palettes. I was very pleased staying here and highly recommend!

The room is spacious as Tokyo standard, and very nice view from the window. We stayed for holidays a year ago, and we are considering going back there again. A bit of outside of downtown Tokyo and no so many restaurants options outside of hotels.
