Excellent hotel, with great staff and very central to all the things that make Daiba area special. I was there for business, but will return with the kids. One and perhaps the only negative is the cost of food and beverages. Easily ducked by walking a few hundred meters away and going to the nearly hundreds (no joke!) of very nice restaurants and cafes that compete for your business in the shopping malls. Some of which at "Aqua City" have beautiful harbour views of the Rainbow Bridge etc. It was my second stay and I will be back, bringing the whole family.

The hotel location was not central, but still around 20mins by subway to Tsukiji, 30mins by train to Ginza, not far from shibuya while disney was 30mins away with free shuttle bus. Malls were a plenty in walking distance, Toyota megaweb also 10mins walk while those looking for car parts could take 15mins train to super autobacs. Room size was great even for non-Japan standard, think close to 40sqm with big bathroom that had both bathtub and shower box. View was the bay, so pretty nice too. Room was not modern, but very well maintained. As we travelled with young kids, extra towells and toiletteries and slippers for kids were prepared.Plenty of foods and shopping options, with diver city and aquacity malls in walking distance while venus outlet was just accross the street.Haneda airport was about 30mins and shuttle buses to both narita and haneda were available every hour. It was however felt abit touristy as the hotel was massive and could be filled with tours. In any case, it was not crowded at all during our stay. Overall we had great stay.

Great location for shopping or as a base for touringLots of dining options in the immediate areaDining in the hotel is varied, but breakfast buffet is on the cool sideVery capable and friendly staff offering fast efficient serviceLarge rooms which are of a high standard

We had a very wonderful stay for 3 nights. Great location and walking distance to attractions and 3 shopping malls. Hotel staff were professional and friendly and most of them were able to speak English. We were offered early check in on arrival at 12pm so were lucky to freshen up in the room before heading out. There is a 24 hour convenience store connected to the hotel.Pros: Spacious room good size for Tokyo, prime location in Odaiba, nice view if you get a water view room, good selection of breakfast buffet on level 30 with amazing view, free wifi, free shuttle to Disneyland or Disney sea (shuttle service and seats are limited).Cons: Did not receive our morning wake up call as requested for 6am.Overall nice for families and kids friendly location. It's a quieter side of Tokyo and great views all around.

This is a good convenient hotel if you are looking for something mid range. The rooms are clean and staff are friendly. Some wear is showing on rooms and furniture. Its a bit far from the main attractions of Tokyo but its conveniently located immediately at the metro station which helps you get around faster.Many shopping malls and eateries are located around this hotel and lots of convenient stores. Also, within walking distance of a few attractions like the Tokyo Eye.It could get touristy and crowded especially at breakfast time.
user_name:
Fatema81
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Nice hotel but if you misplace your key they won't give you another and then proceed to quiz you like you're a terrorist. Nice pool but you have to be 16 and over to use it. So not child friendly at all. Generally a cold and unwelcoming hotel but with all the amenities and good location. If on business do stay here, otherwise look elsewhere

Stayed here for four days and enjoyed it. Staff was very helpful and friendly, most able to speak English. It is also connected to a train station and if you plan to go to Disneyland or Disneysea, shuttle buses will come to pick you up for free. It has a great view of Odaiba and nice shopping malls are within 5 min walk. For people who want to have quiet early morning walks, Odaiba beach is also just a 10 min walk. Viewing platforms for the small statue of liberty and rainbow bridge are nearby.

I stay here every time I come to Tokyo and I love it every time. Staff is very friendly and most speak English. Beautiful lobby and has several restaurants and bars, connected to a train station and little stores. Rooms are large and beautiful with great views and the bathrooms so luxurious. Very inexpensive for what you get. The view of Tokyo from the restaurant on the top floor is amazing and unlike anywhere else in the city. Great place to stay if going to Tokyo Disney, you can buy park tickets from the concierge and it has a free bus to and from Disney several times a day.

good hotel with all facilities available in hotels,connected with mono rail,connected with mall,airport bus drop and pick up service available, free wifi. location good for people gone for giftex show at tokyo big sight.(just 2-3 station away via mono rail).

Fantastic hotel,excellent views overlooking the bay of Japan. Our breakfast wasExcellent,plenty of variety.Staff were friendly and helpful.Situated in a great location with a beach area close by. A lovely start to our tour ofJapan.

The building seems very old from the outside but interiors are still well maintained. Big lobby big space, typical 5-star hotel. My room has a decent view of the sea and the city but nothing much fascinating. The room is quite spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom is the spotlight of the stay. They provide many things for person's daily use and i love their shampoos the most. They smell so good! Basically u don't have to bring anymore personal needs to this hotel. Shavers, toothbrush, comb, facial needs etc. They have breakfast served available at 3 different floors but I only ate at the 2nd one and the top floor one. Both served so so breakfast and the ommellete was really not tasty. The service is so weird there that they always make the guests to wait in line even there are free seats. I really don't get the system there as this is totally wasting time. This hotel is surrounded by many malls and shop lots and very close to the train station.

We went to stay there for two nights as a big family group for Japan Tour. The Hotel is located near great business location, but it is a bit difficult to reach for the train station to Shinjuku area. However, as we come in a big group, I consider this is a better hotel choice. The service and accommodation are pretty good! Recommended for a tour group!

This was two night stop after overnight flight from Heathrow, booked as part of SAGA holiday. The hotel is superb and Daiba is to be location for Summer Olympics 2020, and will be a good base for this.Superb facilities and very clean. Near to all amenities (shopping malls, rail station, bars and parks)Lovely

After giving this hotel rave reviews last year, we returned and stayed for almost two weeks. Was disappointed with the room we were given. The carpet looked dirty and was stained here and there.House slippers are provided so that guests don't walk around the room wearing their street shoes. Apparently, this place now has a high volume of foreign visitors who have dirtied the carpet and made the room to look like a two or three star hotel room. The carpet needs to be changed or shampooed. Also, the hotel was filled so we were not able to get a room with a view of the Rainbow Bridge. Our room overlooked a parking lot and freeway. There was some type of car festival. People used the lot to speed around the cones. The screeching noise from that was so annoying. To add to that, motorcycles riders in large groups were making a lot of noise while traveling on the freeway late at night. The noise made me jump out of bed to see what was going on. There were many groups spaced apart so the noise continued for at least an hour. That side of the hotel needs double paned windows to shut out the noise.

Ending our trip to Japan on a high note, we decided to stay in the Grand Pacific Le Daiba. After having had small rooms in all the places we stayed coming into our room in this hotel was like a breath of spacious fresh air. The room itself was grand and had the most amazing bathroom with french double doors which made it feel like a disney castle. We made use of the hotel's bar's on one of the top floors which had one of the most breath-taking views of Tokyo at night. Since it is a little removed from the city you get to see it in all it's glory which made it well worth the trip on the bridge to get to the hotel. All in all, this hotel is enough to make you feel like royalty.

The hotel was better than expected. The room was large, had a nice view, and nicely appointed. The bathroom was very clean and spacious. I was happy that the air conditioning worked great as I like a cool room when sleeping. The hotel was large and several restaurants. We purchased a breakfast option with our room. There are two locations for breakfast. We dined on the 30th floor and there was a nice offering for breakfast. The view from that level was great. Before arriving, I thought the hotel might be located too far from sights in Tokyo, but I found that it was easy to get around and not far to get where we wanted to go. The train or monorail line is 3 minutes from the hotel door with no streets to cross. The area the hotel appears new and elevated above street level, so it is easy walking. The train is 15 minutes to one of the larger stations (Shimbashi) in Tokyo, and from that station you can just about go anywhere. Getting there from Narita on our day of arrival was easier than I expected too. Using the Japan Rail pass, we took the Narita Express train to the Tokyo station, onto the Yamanote line to Shimbashi (still using the JR pass) and then on the Yurikamome line, which is the train or monorail to Daiba. The was a fee for this train.I would stay again at this hotel and recommend it. After staying there, I think I preferred not having the noise of the city or a view of another building just outside the window.The hotel also caters to guests wanting to go to Disneyland, so it can get busy, but it was never a bother to me.

My wife and I were on a JTB organized tour of central Japan starting in Nagoya, taking us thru Takeyama & the Kurobe Alpine route. At Tateyama this year the ice wall that had built up over winter was 13m high. Cold & blustery when we were there but well worth the effort to walk the 300m from the cable station to the highest point of the ice wall. By the time we hit Kawaguchi Lake at the base of Mt Fuji, we had seen the best of Japan at Springtime. Sakura blooms by the lake and snow & ice in the mountains. To top it all we had 2 days in ODaiba, Tokyo. For those familiar with ODaiba it is the modern section across the Tokyo Bay. The Grand Pacific hotel rivals any 5star hotel anywhere and is conveniently located beside a monorail station that takes you to the heart of traditional Tokyo in 20mins. ODaiba is a shopping & family entertainment paradise and there is a free shuttle bus that takes you to all the key tourist and shopping centers. The night views of the Rainbow Bridge and the familiar Tokyo skyline are just stupendous! Overall my best leisure trip to Japan even though our family lived in Tokyo for 4 years in the 90s.

Very good hotel with luxery rooms. Staff is very helpful and fluent in English. We had a club room at the 27th floor with a great view. Club rooms give access to the club lobby at the 27th floor with a view on Rainbow bridge.Bed are very comfortable and good selection of pillows.Location is nice on an island in the bay. restaurants and leisure around the hotel and very convenient underground and JR line connection to other centers of Tokyo. So teh hotel is easily connected to Tokyo and quiet as well.

I simply love this hotel, not just for the rooms itself, but also for the breakfast (3rd and 30th flr) and spectacular view! The hotel is accessible to various malls, so the location is of a prime area in the Odaiba area.

Hotel location is very convenient to shopping, eating, and trains. Near Tokyo haneda airport and Disneyland. It is located at the Odaiba island with a lot of place to visit within the surrounding area. It's has a great view of the bay area. Rooms are clean and spacious, specially the bathrooms and amenities.

This hotel is in the artificial island of Odaiba, it was nice to also stay on this part of the city for 1 night, I loved the view from my room and the restaurant at the top. Big hotel, big rooms for Tokyo and very good service.

Great hotel view some beautiful views over Tokyo.We actually liked the location - everytime when you go to/from the hotel you need to take the metro line that goes first between the skyscrapers and afterwards over the bridge - the views are stunning and we liked every single ride (8 in total :) ). It really gives you a feeling that you are in a massive city.

This time room was much smaller than last time visit with the same price although we came one week before Christmas. There was a very nice Christmas tree on the lobby. Again we came here because the hotel provided free shuttle bus to Disneyland.

Nice hotel this one. We have stayed here before and were pleased with the location and service. They didn't disappoint this time around. We booked a room for 3 adults which was spacious and clean with good facilities.The hotel is well located for Le Daiba, Disney and down town Tokyo (via the monorail).

We booked this hotel as part of a great deal with our flight to Tokyo but never expected it to be such a great choice. The hotel is quite far from the city but the train station is right on the door step. The views from the room are spectacular... the Tokyo Bay and the rainbow bridge. The breakfast is a bit steep and expensive so we gave it a miss and there are plenty of places to eat near by. The room was very spacious with a large bathroom with a bath and shower cubicle. The toilets - not just in the hotel, but all over Tokyo are the best! The towels were changed daily and room cleaned well by very gracious staff. they even provided us with bottles of drinking water every day.The only issue we had was when one of our group fell ill on Saturday, there was no doctor and the assistant manager came to tell us we will have to go to the nearest hospital which is quite a distance away. I was surprised that a big hotel like this one, did not have an on call service for a doctor. Fortunately our friend was fine and did not need the service of a doctor.This trip was a long awaited holiday and the stay at Grand Pacific Le Daiba, made it perfect

Being an American Airlines Platinum member, I expect great service and an excellent room. I requested ahead for a room with a nice view of the bridge (denied) so did not start off well. The room was clean and nice, but very small (maybe 20 sqm) and the bathroom was a toilet, sink, and tub with a shower wand. There were some nice toiletries and they have good, free wifi. The hotel is very convenient to the trains, malls, and a nice park for a romantic walk. Across the street is a brand new Hilton that looks incredible so I would have booked this if I had known about it. Do not book this hotel if you are looking for a 5-star experience.

Maybe when you see the location think that this is not a option. Tokyo is so large that you always will have some part far away from your location. Why Odaiba? it is the quietter part of Tokyo. You are linked by monorrail to the Tokyo Fair and in few minute you can reach Ginza by the monorrail. The monorrail is just in the door of the hotel. You have at less 4 shopping mall in a walking distance. In the lobby of the hotel you could put all the lobbies of all the Ginza´s hotels. The rooms are like european rooms, more than 25 sqm, big and luxury bathrooms. With a big shower and bathtub. On the top of the hoteltower there are several great restaurants from where you could see the Tokyo bay. There are activities for kids (Disneyworld direct bus from door-to-door). Runner roads and paths on the area with a haelthy enviroment, just not traffic in this area.

My Summer 2015 trip this was the best part of my trip i booked this hotel in Feb 2015 for a price I am still surprised at! I stayed 9 nights here and we love staying in Daiba, its beautiful there, this was my 2nd trip to Japan and total days spend were 23!. This hotel is near or i should say connected to Daiba Station and so many malls near by and the view from Daiba of Rainbow bridge and tokyo tower .. its amazing..They have a channel which plays nice music and a LIVE Feed from their cam which is showing rainbow bridge view .. I miss it while typing At the time of this writing in May 2016 it has become expansive but if you can afford do stay here!
user_name:
Mansoor A
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: very nice hotel.brand new rooms high quality and well decorated.staff very nice and helpful.nice shopping mall nearby with varuty of shops and restaurants.train station on site (not working when strong windy).the convintion store very nice with good prices and fresh food.

The location is good (if you want to travel around and very convenient). Very near shopping malls with food options and attractions (Mdm Tussaud's and a small Legoland). Superb view from the spacious room.

The hotel, being situated in the Daiba area, provides a sense of more space and serenity, both in terms of the hotel room itself and the surrounding area, esp. compared with the hustle and bustle of downtown Tokyo. It takes a super easy seaside 25-min train ride to go downtown but the fantastic view of the harbour compensates this ride completely. The service was particularly satisfying. The concierge staff members are all very helpful and always give good and accurate information. I was especially touched when one of the staff members at the mail counter took so much efforts to help me with repackaging of my mail box.

Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and am happy to go back again. Great location right near three main shopping Malls with food courts. The hotel always has a lot of staff on hand to assist with any thing you may need. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed. Breakfast on the 30th floor is Buffet style with every thing you could want. Just one minor moan, all hot food is on one side except the fried eggs which are on the other and so you have to queue up twice. Please put ALL hot food together. apart from that it is all very good.Definitley happy to recommend this hotel.

Wonderful, clean, well appointed rooms, comfortable bed and room serviced daily all toiletries included. Superb Restaurant for Dinner and Breakfast, good variety of Western and Japanese food. Late night drinks and first class snacks menu in the Star Road Restaurant, beautiful night time view of the Rainbow Bridge and the lights of Tokyo. Staff and service first class and non intrusive, the Staff I approached had no trouble speaking and understanding English. Loved my stay and will stay here again...Coral.

I stayed here for 10 nights on my trip to Japan. Getting here from Haneda airport is relatively easy. The easiest way would be to use the transfer bus (about 520 yen for an adult) and is around 30 minutes away. By train, Tokyo Teleport station is around a 10 minute walk away however the Yurikamome monorail service has a station that is pretty much outside of the hotel (Daiba station). If you have a lot of luggage, I would recommend taking the transfer bus.Entering the hotel is quite an impressive experience, if not a little kitsch in terms of decor but I found this quite endearing.The staff spoke good enough English and were very polite and helpful; nothing was too much trouble.The breakfast buffet had a vast range of options and classical music played throughout the buffet service which was quite pleasant. The quality of the food was very good however did get quite repetative; Yes, there was a lot of variety but the options remained the same throughout. Two floors serve the same buffet style breakfast. The views from the top floor restaurant are incredible.I stayed in a superior room on the 24th floor. The views of Tokyo Bay from the room is what made my stay memorable .The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable the amenities included a hair dryer, laundry service, in room safe deposit box and complimentary mineral water. I slept very well here, the blackout curtains and the generally quiet nature helped. Free wifi provided was very good in terms of speed and reliability.I would stay here again if I was visiting Disney Tokyo resort but I would recommend staying closer to Tokyo itself if you want to see more of the real Tokyo.

I expected a classy hotel after the reviews, but what a dissapointment. I booked a non-smoking room, but got a smelly smoking room. After asking for a non smoking room, I didn't receive an excuse, but just an obvious irritated respond that I got another room. The room was next to a highway, so really noisy the whole night. And behind that highway a big parking lot. The room was small, not in good condition and smelled funny. While the room was over 200 euro the price/quality is far from good. A real dissapointment and I would not recommend this hotel at all.

We really liked our 2night stay here. Hotel limousine drops you off at the hotel(for a fee),Very touristic, beautiful and relaxing view around the hotel,malls around with food court,some shopping even within the hotel,just walking distance through the hotel to the daiba train station,convienience store,hairdressers and barber at the hotel(be sure to book your appointment though),our room had a very lovely view, was very clean,spacious.Nice amenities were provided including kids kits,very large and nice bathroom/toilet with seperate shower space,very good housekeeping, the english news channel was very welcome(i dont know if there were more english channels as i didnt check).view from the breakfast room on the 30th floor was simply amazing!the guy who cheked us in on arrival spoke good english but he didnt look enthusiastic or welcoming.Not all front desk staff spoke english though.on our 2nd day there,we had problems leaving a message at the front desk until they found someone who could understand us.breakfast was overpriced and not a good enough spread. seemed like we were being charged for that amazing view from the breakfast room on 30th floor hence the 4 stars

Daiba station connects directly with this hotel. Very convenient if arriving using the Yurikomome line (train). The hotel staff was very friendly. Bell service was excellent and we even had our bag cart brought right to the ramp to the train station on leaving. The room (Deluxe twin) was HUGE compared to most Tokyo hotels. Twin beds were large and comfortable. Bathroom was very spacious. We did not use the restaurant for breakfast, but instead used the well stocked Convienience Store on the hotel side of the ramp to the Daiba station. Lots of food items to choose from. The shuttle to TDR was convenient and prompt (as would be expected in Japan) and we loved that perk. Time to TDR was about 30 minutes. We loved our stay at GP Le Daiba and would definitely stay again.

Most of the hotel staff are unprofessional, unhelpful and unfriendly. Staff hardly speaks any English including front desk staff. It took me more than 20 minutes to just check in. I have been to Japan many times but never encounter such low standard of hotel service.Location is pretty inconvenient considering it is in Tokyo. We arrived early in the morning but no eatery except the overpriced hotel one is open.

I visited Tokyo with 2 girlfriends in November 2015 and we stayed at the Grand Pacific for 5 nights. As there were 3 of us, we were quite impressed there were 3 separate (albeit very small) beds in the hotel room. The beds were very comfortable and we had no problems sleeping.The bathroom was large, clean and the shower has very good pressure. We never had breakfast at the hotel so I cannot comment on this. The staff were pleasant enough but did not offer us any help with our bags etc. Hotel is in a prime location and it is a very short train to the Tokyo Metro Overall we enjoyed our stay.

It is a 5 star Hotel, part of a chain and is well worth the money spent. About the Hotel itself, the rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable, some with extra large King size beds. All the rooms have panoramic views of the Tokyo skyline, Tokyo Bay/river and the beautiful Rainbow Bridge. There is free and frequent shuttle to and from Haneda Airport. The hotel itself has 9 restaurants including Chinese and Western style. The Breakfast is a combination of eastern and western with fresh omelettes on demand. It is served in 2 restaurants and as in most of Japan everything is extremely clean and the hotel staff bends over backwards to keep the guests happy. The Hotel is surrounded by beautiful boutiques, accessible from the lounge. There is a 24 hour convenience Store as well where one can pick up snacks. It has an ATM also. The desserts at the Hotel are Phenomenal. Taxis are easily available. Money can be changed at the hotel easily though the rate is not the best. The best rate is available at the Airport.The best thing about this hotel is that it is right across the Train station.There is a Mall next to it and the Hilton Hotel is also right across the street next to the train station. Multiple eating places and walking areas along the river with beautiful lighting make it very pleasant and enjoyable. Actually it is like "Christmas" every evening. Excellent restaurants for every budget are available. We ate at an Indonesian Restaurant at the Mall, where the shopping is also very good.Two stops away by the train from the Hotel, in the same Odaiba Area as the hotel. is the Ooedo-Onsen-Monogatari which is a natural onsen (hot spring) theme park in the Tokyo Bay. Visitors can experience 13 varieties of baths including indoor baths using water from natural hot springs that gush up from the source 1,400 meters under ground. This is a huge park open 22 hours each day and a "must visit" for all. The Tsukiji Fish Market is about 30 minutes by Taxi and has world class restaurants around it as well.We truly enjoyed our stay in Tokyo

The touristic operator made an excellent choice. High quality hotel , very well located, excellent service and food.All rooms with priviliged view. Roomy and spotless.The only drawback was the overcrowded lobby. Noisy, luggage all around It seemed we were in a train station, All the lugagge business should be carried out "backstage"

The hotel is very close to 2 big malls and to some attractions in the area. It offers a great view of the Tokyo Bay as well. Breakfast is okay on day 1 but the food gets repeated every single day of our stay. Toilet amenities were okay and the toilet is extra clean. The hotel staff are very helpful and one drawback is their inability to speak English. But that is very negligible.

We've visited the hotel with a group for two days. That probably is one of the worst hotels in Tokyo. The breakfast was very bad, we had stomach hurt of their eggs. The second we had to wait in a line for breakfast, which we didn't do.There is one bell boy, so we had to carry the luggage by ourselves. The concierge was never at his desk! Terrible!!!

Our first stop during our trip to Japan and we loved it. Rooms are good, breakfast was great, nearby location is so happening and the metro next door. I did selfies with the Statue of Liberty and conned some of my friends into believing that I went to the USA!!

A lovely friendly hotel. Hotel rooms are spacious and clean. Didn't use the hotels restaurant as there was plenty of places to eat nearby. A short walk gets you to aqua city for shopping, decks for joypolis, diver city for the big gundam and venus fort for the big wheel and more shopping. Also the seaside park with the goddess of liberty and rainbow bridge is a very short walk away. Some of the rooms give a view of this. Would definitely stay there again.

I stayed a week at the hotel when I was there on a business trip.I found the Hotel to be well maintained and in my room was very clean and well maintained every day. I did not use the Restaurants, but did use the coffee shop annexed to the Hotel - it was excellent - well stocked and well presented as a casual place for simple breakfast and coffee.I used the Health spa / Gymnasium which was a highlight. Even though you pay to enter, that is a good thing as it keeps amateurs out and makes the experience much better. The gym has a wide range of machines and free weights as well as staff on hand to offer support if needed. The change room facilities are excellent. The Pool - while a bit warm for my liking, was also clean and of a high standard of presentation.The access to central Tokyo was easy and inexpensive - using the train from the station right beside the Hotel. Shopping malls adjacent to the hotel are of high quality with excellent dining choices. I would recommend this place provided that you are OK to catch the train into central Tokyo.

The hotel itself does not distinguish itself from other 5-star hotels in Tokyo that I know. The entrance and the lobby in fact are a little confusing. The rooms are large, especially by Japanese standards, however, they also come at a Price. What makes a difference, however, are the stunning views you have from your room looking over the bay to Tokyo!

This hotel is located some distance from central Tokyo but is aimed at the tourist industry. Facing the Rainbow Bridge and views of central Tokyo it is in a great location with a local railway station at the front door wide walking paths to shopping centres amusement parks and beaches one could not ask for more. The hotel is large surrounded by small shops the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and have all the items one requires. Free Wi-Fi is available through out the hotel. Dinner was an excellent buffet but breakfast was average. Overall this is a great hotel and I highly recommend it as a place to stay while staying in Tokyo.

The room was spacious suited for a family. Sleep wear and complimentary water are provided. Staffs are attentive. Daiba station is just a 5 minutes away. Theres a pathway access going statue if liberty, gundam statue, diver city, palette town. So happy we stay here

Everything was Perfect! The best Breakfast on my Life, i never thought in such complete breakfast could exists. The room have the most incredible view! I will never Forget this Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

I staied for business training and initiation ceremony of company.there are amenity,good breakfast,nice bathroom.and also you can use comfortble WIFI.this hotel is located in perfect place to go everywhere, because it's easy access from Daiba station to the hotel 1 minute on foot.I have one thing that I let you know, is having breakfast at 30 floor.I recomend that, because enjoyable nice view from high place. To have seat there, you should arrive before 6:30 if you want to have breakfast at 30 floor.many people were waited on open time!

GPLD are the among best hotels I ever stayed. Good Locations & Walking distance to attractions e.g Diver City, Gundam Robot, Aqua city, Toyota Mega Web, Statue of Liberty, Tokyo Fuji Tower.. Close proximity to Daiba Train Station, Free Shuttle Bus to DisneyLand & DisneySea...Free Fast Wifi in Room..

This hotel is huge. It is like its own city.It is on Daiba, an island just across the river from Tokyo in the Tokyo Bay area.What I liked:1. rooms are clean and spacious2. bathroom had really nice rose petal sea salts3. free wifi4. ample room to hang clothes and do work5. delicious breakfast - primairly continental with some Japanese offerings- view on the 26th? floor of the entire city...but, breakfast on the second floor has more tea and other food options. The purple sweet potato danish was phenomenal. 6. quick service (only waited 5 to 10 minutes for a towel, shower cap...)7. helpful service (the front desk were helpful in giving directions)8. location - connected to the Yurikamome metro, which is an independent system9. free shuttle (up to 8:00 pm) for shopping at Venus Forte and other shopping malls10. ingredients in the food are identified with symbols, such as a hen for chicken, a cow for beef, shrimp...great for someone with allergies11. foreign currency exchange machine12 computers with internet access in the lobby (to print boarding passes, etc.)13. about 2-3 corner stores (good places to get a quick bite and souvenirs)14. shopping - some boutiques have unique accessories, but are overpriced15. views - there are excellent views of the island throughout this hotel, especially on the 26th floor.16. complementary water bottles and newspaper provided daily (I stayed for 3 days)17. fridge in room with mini bar18. rooms seem quiet even though I was close to the elevators...I don't recall hearing any noise19. location - Daiba is a beatufiul island- you could easily spend a day or two on the island alone. It reminds me of Las Vegas.What I did not like:1. the TV: No English channels apart from a dubbed over CNN and an NHK channel which only brought Asian news and Japan tourism ideas2. the water is hot...really hot...scalding. Make sure you test the water before taking your shower. I tried to soak my feet and had to wait 20 minutes before the water got to a "just hot" level.3. dinner buffet in the second-floor restaurant...this was just like any standard buffet. The sesame balls and the pork were the only standouts. The desserts were awful. Also, the buffet ran out of food very quickly and it took some 15 to 20 minutes to replace it. Since my food options are limited due to allergies, this was a nuissance. 4. distance to Tokyo - Daiba is a beautiful island and there is much to do there, but since it is off-island, it takes about 45 minutes to get into the Shibuya district as well as another metro fare. Day passes for both systems cost about $20 to $22 USD. The trip into Tokyo wastes 1.25 to 1.5 hours of your day.5. it is about 1.5 to 2 hours away from Narita airport. I beleive that there are shuttles that leave from the hotel. Plan accordingly.6. Communal body soap and shampoos - there is a caddy in your bathtub with soaps and shampoos. There are no bars of soap offered. I find this to be unsanitary, but is seems to be common in Japan (same thing at a hotel in Kyoto, but not in Osaka).

A bit far from the city, but only take 40min to reach Shinjuku/shibuya. Really close to Ginza and Tsujiki fish market. Beautiful, spacious surrounding area ideal for joggers. Definitely buy the PASMO card when you are staying here.Great alternative location and so much more quiet if you want to be away from the stereotypic hustle and bustle of tokyo.Only 6000yen away from Haneda airport.

I was on a working travel with my husband. We have stayed for 6 nights and my husband's birthday was three days before mine. We both got complimentary chocolates and on the checkin they have put us on a nice room facing Rainbow Bridge and the Statue of Liberty. People at the lobby and housekeeping were really kind. Extremely clean and size of the room is okay comparing to the most rooms in the city. Yurikamome line Daiba station is in front of the hotel, which is very convenient to explore the city. Few steps away there are malls with restaurants and shops. If you like to run there is a track along the shore very easy accessed by the hotel, not to mention the gym. Only disadvantage is that Yurikamome line pass is exclusive for this line and can't be used on the regular metro. But it is very convenient for crossing the bridge to downtown.

After multiple transit via Tokyo (Narita) for business trip, wife managed to nag her way into a family trip to Tokyo for the Dec-2015 school vacation.Without knowing a ted about Tokyo, we started off with a trip to NATAS to gather more info, who knows, we instantly bought a free & easy package with Prime Holidays (specialist in Go-Japan trips) there & then.The Japanese tour consultant, Yuki-san, advised for a more comfortable accommodation (Pacific Grand Le Daiba) in Tokyo bay area (Odaiba) versus the cramped hotel in the central shopping district (Shinjuku/Shibuya/Ginza) of Tokyo. The hotel have got direct transport (15 minutes trip) from Haneda Airport 2~3 times every hour, transport to Narita 2~3 times a day at a nominal fee & is also a Disney friendly hotel (in other words, they provide free transport to & fro Disneyland/DisneySea). Breakfast have a choice of 3 location, Continental at the lobby or the top level, and a Japanese-type in B1. Breakfast at the top floor provides a fantastic panoramic view of the bay area & would sure to increase your appetite. If you are staying for more than a couple of days, like us, and getting sick of the daily breakfast, you can choose to use the breakfast vouchers in exchange for lunch/dinner, topping up the extra in cost.Rooms are Spacious with a capital "S", we have gotten an upgrade to a deluxe room, for 4 days or more of occupancy, our rooms were facing river & overlook one of the 3 underground tunnels coming into the bay area, toiletries are all Sheiseido brand topped up daily.A train station was located right beside the hotel, connecting major shopping center like Diver's City & Aqua-xxxx. Shopping & food galore The hotel is also within walking distance to several ferry/cruise pickup/drop-off points that have cruise/ferry that our family took from Sumeida (near the Asakusa area) back to our hotel. a view from the river cruise is one of those that visitors must not miss, it provides a different perspective from the hassle & bustle of Tokyo city life.My only complaint was the only single train line that service the Odaiba area, though it's a loop route that service most of the shopping & tourist spots (Palette City) of the bay area, access to city must be transit via Shimbashi. And if your travel itinerary covers all shopping area within the city area, it is more advisable to find a hotel located along the Yamanote line.Overall, excellent hotel with services & facilities exceeding expectation.

I only stayed one night at Grand Pacific Le Daiba, in transit from Singapore to the United States.There's very little else I can say which the other reviewers have not mentioned - convenient location in Odaiba with direct buses to and from the international airports, lovely clean rooms, attentive service. The wireless connection throughout the hotel was one of the best I've ever had, which I truly appreciated. Loved my room with a super comfortable king-sized bed and all the amenities I needed. Check-in and check-out processes were both efficient, and the concierge was very helpful with booking of bus tickets as well.I would stay here again, both alone and with my family.

Great hotel in a newer part of Tokyo called Odaiba. It's not in the middle of the city and takes public transportation to get to the major sights. However, there is a lot of shopping and eating places right there. I think it offers great value for a new spacious modern hotel in Tokyo. Several breakfast buffet restaurant options are included. My favorite is the breakfast buffet is offered at the restaurant on the 30th floor where there is a spectacular view of the city, bridge and bay. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom are luxurious. Lots of amenities are included.

Grand Pacific Le Daiba is a 30 floor hotel in Odaiba, an artificial island in Tokyo Bay. Rooms on the side facing back to Tokyo, if high enough (we were on floor 20) to look over the Hilton, have stunning views of the Rainbow Bridge, the Tokyo Tower and beyond. Odaiba is the nearest thing to a seaside resort (think Gold Coast in Aus), with Disneyland, big shopping malls, and even a little beach (no swimming). We found it quite uncrowded, which suited us. Tokyo proper is a short monorail trip away.As with all hotels in Japan there were staff aplenty, all ready to bow at passing guests. They do this managing to give the impression they genuinely appreciate one's custom. We eat breakfast a few times - buffet with the inevitable omelette chef, Western, Chinese and Japanese foods, all on the 30th floor with even more serious views. We also tried their buffet on the lobby level, which we were less keen on. Not a great selection, no sneeze guards and inflated drink prices (950 Y for a glass of 'white wine') even for many star Japanese hotels. The lobby bar is smoking - literally. Took a while after to get the smell of tobacco from our clothes.If you can get a deal, we definitely recommend.

This hotel is amazing! Centrally located right by a train station (monorail) and plenty of things to do around. Right in front on the Aquacity mall ( like 2 min walk). One station away from the Ferris wheel.Rooms are pristine clean. They have this policy that if you don't have them clean your room they give you some extra credit (a day) which you can use as money toward services (such as room service). But rooms still need to be cleaned every 3 days.We used their breakfast buffet every day. The food was amazing, plenty of options for vegetarians like us, same thing as their room service food, I really recommend their tofu nuggets for breakfast and the veggie sandwich from room service menu.The views are incredible! You could see parts of the city, the river and the rainbow bridge. The staff is incredibly polite and helpful. Most of the times there's someone who speaks English. It would be a real pleasure to go stay on this hotel again, I really hope to do it in the future!

I love this hotel..Good service with friendly staff , a strategic location very close to the shopping center AquaCity Odaiba and nice scenery around the hotel , the rooms are clean and comfortable. PERFECT..

Loved this hotel, great views, great food for room service and very attentive staff. The hotel is located very close to the train station and only a few minutes walk to shopping centers and restaurants. They also offer free transfers to Disney land which was very helpful. Quite pricey but worth it.

this hotel is great. they have 3 place for breakfast. one of that restaurant breakfast staff is not so friendly. one of lady staff in front desk is not friendly. far from town but surrounding have tons of malls. they said new worlds, future worlds. price is expensive. the view from hotel is very good. check in on time. bathrooms amenities is great. worth it. they have shuttle bus to disneyland. going to shinagawa you can use rainbow bus or monorail to shimbashi. its worth to try. breakfast is perfect. you get coupon for lunch if you want use. on my visit, we seen japanese wedding on their hall.

This is a very large hotel. There was a fantastic view from my room which made it worth it. The only negative thing I would have to say is that breakfast is a mess. I went up to the top floor and you would think the other guests had never seen food before. IT was a disaster with people piling their plates like it was their last meal. The staff were all very pleasant and I would recommend this hotel.

This hotel is located in an unique area of Odaiba artificial island. It is easy to access from Yurikamome line station - just a short walkway. We booked many months in advance and our price was less than half of our colleagues that booked later - this hotel has pricing policy similar to airlines. Nice large rooms with attractive view from windows. This hotel is always my preference when I come to Tokyo.

On my very first visit to Japan, we spent 2 nights here.Location: superb!It is located near a train station, which literally can be accessed once you went out through the back door (not the lobby door). There you will find a 24/7 convenience store and various coffee shops and restaurants. After that you will have two choices of paths.The first path will lead u to a massive beautiful park where u can run or cycling and eventually u will end up meeting with a real size Gundam. The second path, which was more popular, will lead to the harbour, with a view of Japan's statue of liberty and the Rainbow Bridge. It was a sight to behold at night. My only regret was I didn't go there in the morning to see the beach. There is also a mall with cafes overseeing the harbour.Service: we were on tour, so didn't have much chance to talk with the staff. Room: beautiful room, wonderful view, the whole nine yards!Bathroom: super duper love it. The shower and the bathtub were awesome. Cleanliness: clean. I have no problem. Size: spacious. Amenities: gotta love the Japanese with their love for packaging. For example, the packaging for this hotel was very much in themed: lavish. View: the best: I've got a paris wheel view. At night it was awesome! In the morning, we get to see the sunrise from the harbour. Repeat visit: YES!

Hotel staff attentive & proffessional. Restaurants within the hotel excellent, variety to choose from. Breakfast with a view from top floor in the morning was a real treat.For a contrast head up stairs for a drink and enjoy the night lights of Tokyo.  The Gymnasium is well fitted out with staff on hand to see to your needs. The Parks leading around the waterfront provide an excellent running course. In need of excersise to balance your stay in the city this is perfect.Proximity to shopping is incredible choice. Including restaurants and cafe's all very close by.Monorail to Shimbashi is frequent.From there you can connect well to Tokyo Subway or JR line.Heading to or from the Airport there is a bus from the hotel. As there is to various other destinations around Tokyo (Tokyo tower,Asakusa).We found this to be an excellent hotel in good position. Will definitely stay again this year.

Odaiba has lesser crowds. Getting in and out of the island can be expensive but the lesser crowds and stunning views are worth the stay. The light rail is on the door step of the hotel. There are also a few big malls around Odaiba and are all within walking distance from the hotel. There's also a shuttle bus that you can take that brings you around the attractions in Odaiba. There's plenty to eat and shop in the malls. Tsukiji fish market, Ginza, Omotesando, Harajuku, Tokyo Tower are not too far away either. Recommended to stay in Odaiba if you have experienced staying in busy areas like Shinjuku and would like to experience open spaces and views of Tokyo Bay. Hotel wise, our non-smoking room was truly smoke free! Staff were really friendly and helpful. Wifi was really fast (well done!). Views from hotel room was a million-dollar view. There's direct airport limousine bus to/fro Haneda and Narita.

Cannot fault this hotel. Staff are all extremely polite and helpful, going out of their way to provide excellent service. Hotel looked after bags before check-in and after check-out, which is great if you want to spend time in the city before/after your stay.Room was large, very clean and comfortable, with big comfortable bed, chairs and table, desk, big TV, and tea set with coffee, real English Breakfast teabags (same as can find in the UK), and Japanese tea. Bathroom also clean, great shower, and high quality set of bathroom items (toothbrush, showercap, bath salts, etc) replaced every day. Room also had complimentary bottles of water every day, and room slippers that you can keep.View from the room is either looking toward Rainbow Bridge and the city, or over Odaiba and Tokyo bay. Had the view toward the bridge/city, which was fun to look out in the day and beautiful view at night.Breakfast gives you choice between Western buffet, or alacarte Japanese style. Had Western buffet, on 30th floor of hotel. Excellent food, all very good, and they make fresh omelettes for you. Get a table by a window and you can watch the city waking up as you have breakfast.The location is very convenient for exploring Odaiba, with shopping centres nearby, and Odaiba monorail station in front of the hotel.The hotel also provides a free shuttle bus to/from Tokyo Disneyland, so perfect if you're visiting during your stay.The hotel is a bit expensive to stay at, but I would say worth the price if you want more than a usual business hotel.

I'm glad that I booked a room at Grand Pacific Le Daiba! The room is pretty big which able to accommodate me,my hub, my 2 boys(age 2) & my mom! View is pretty impressive which we able to see the rainbow bridge & Tokyo Tower.The train is just a few mintues walk and there's free shuttle bus to Disneyland. Is a good hotel if you are traveling with young kids or old people as there's limousine bus to/fro Airport and is near to the places of interest.

The location is perfect for enjoying an ocean view and within walking distance of ultra-modern Tokyo while only a short train ride to explore the older Tokyo. We were pampered by the staff and the rooms really alleviated all stresses from the long trip to Tokyo. We highly recommend this hotel!

Quick stay in this lovely and clean hotel with service oriented staff. The rooms are not very large overall but the hotel and its facilities are very well maintained. Very good location next to Aquacity and Madame Tussauds attraction.

The location is so perfect as it is at sitting at the middle of the malls, at the exit of the mrt, and with a great view of the bay and the bridge. It is very convenient for a tourist like us. The staff are friendly and so helpful. Rooms are so nice and comfortable. we really enjoy our stay. Special mention the the housekeeping attendant, i dont really remember the name as it is written in japanese (sorry). If the GM of Grand Pacific Hotel get a chance to read this, please send our thank you for her/his exceptional job. We stay at room 1214 (feb6-Feb10)i cannot say anything more as we are very pleased with the service that we get from this hotel.

Hotel is right next to the Daiba Stn and direct airport bus transfer to both airports in Tokyo.Rooms are a bit dated, most of the staff members aren't attentive at all except an lovly female intern at concierge who was very friendly.Check-in time is strictly 4pm and check-out time is at 10am, quite unfair.Good wifi signal in rooms.

Wonderful hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room was very comfortable with a great view of the bay. Many items include with the toiletries. Razor, toothbrush, hair brush, and a great little travel wash cloth. Train station steps from the hotel. Learn the train systems, there is a free app you can download. The train system that serves Daiba area is not a part of the rest. So you will need to purchase a separate ticket. Restaurants and entertainment is an easy walk from the hotel. Would stay here again if I go back to Tokyo.

With the neighboring shopping malls and associated restaurants, this hotel was a restful stop to conclude our trip to Japan. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom exquisite. I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan to return as soon as possible.

Stayed at the hotel as a break between flights from Europe to Australia. We booked an executive floor room which we were not disappointed with. Exceptional space and quality in the room, and plenty of peace and quiet.Breakfast in the restaurant of a morning was quite busy, but a wide range of food available.This hotel has certainly got the service thing absolutely organised, with all staff offering great service and assistance to guests.
user_name:
TripMember073020151
Bowral, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Last May we spent three weeks looking around Japan. We stayed in two different parts of Tokyo finishing our trip at the Grand Pacific. It was a totally different experience from our AirBnB apartment in the older part of the city. I think it's worth staying in two parts because you appreciate different aspects of what Tokyo can offer. This hotel is out on a peninsula close by a shopping and restaurant area. The view is outstandingly gorgeous and we enjoyed what services the hotel had to offer us. It was nice to wander around the boardwalk and we saw a lot of Japanese friends and family enjoying the parks nearby. Transport is a little more challenging because you need to take the light rail service from a train station but that didn't bother us as we enjoy the adventure. It did mean on the last day when we needed to travel to the airport we took our bags with us in the morning and left them in a locker at a railway station rather than returning to the hotel because it was a little out of the way but Japan is awesome and completely allows for this type of travel.

wow just wow i loved this area of tokyo! we went to the top area and they have a great view of the tokyo bay and a small version of the statue of liberty. There were malls everywhere even a bazaar type place. You're in your own little town here. Not many restaurants around though. Rooms were fantastic and the view too! so comfortable and large beds

The adjoining rooms made it a breeze for our big family with 5 kids. Breakfast was good with a back drop of Mt. Fuji. Location was very convenient with a train station so close. Very convenient walking distance to Aqua City and Diver City malls. Grand Pacific le Daiba comforted us with all the rest we needed...

Grand Pacific Le Daiba , was a great place to start our visit to Tokyo . It was away from the "action" but there was enough around for our family . There are several malls nearby , with some nice eating options . The kids enjoyed Joyopolis . Staff were great , rooms were very nice and the view was wonderful . The metro is just out the front door - so easy to get around . Stay here if you prefer the quieter side of Tokyo .

We moved to here after staying at 3 jail-like hotel rooms where we couldn't even pack or unpack due to the limited space in downtown Tokyo. Feeling so relieved the moment we moved into the spacious room in Grand Pacific le Daiba since we could eventually pack two large pieces of our luggage before departure. We received hospitality ranging from the thoughtful porters as well as every staff at the check-in counter. In addituon, the view, day or night overlooking from the room is so breathtaking that we didn't feel like blinking at all. Rainbow Bridge changing colors in the distance, Tokyo Bay twinkling in ur eyesight, the night view from Grand Pacific is as gorgeous as a diamond. In addition, the shopping mall and famous tourist attractions r wirhin walking distance. Grand Pacific also provides shuttle buses to both airports with bargain prices. Anyway, we enjoyed our stay herw and will certainly check in here next time we pay Tokyo a visit.

This hotel was quiet, clean and the room and bathroom were very big. There was no problem fitting the foldaway bed and the room still felt spacious. My 6.5 husband fitted fine in the bathroom. We had a gorgeous view of the rainbow bridge. Location wise, it's a bit out of town so you need to catch a train to Central Tokyo. Stations are super close as is a couple of shopping centres with a selection of everything you might want. The courtesy bus to Disney was very convenient as was the rainbow bus.

The location is very convenient for tourists. There is a bridge going to diver city and aqua city ( Shopping malls in Odaiba ). The breakfast is really good! The staffs are really nice and helpful. I will definitely go back again to this hotel!

Hotel located at Odaiba area is rather out of the central of Tokyo, however as hotel is next to train station, it considered convenient. There is a linkage bridge to few different shopping malls and some retail shops and pastries shop and a 24hrs convenient store within the hotel. Room and bathroom is acceptably clean and comfy. Nice view from the hotel room, can see Rainbow Bridge, the sea.There are 3 choice of location for breakfast. Went to the top level for my breakfast, selection of food is ok, but the view was great.

Just to summarize, this venue might not be a good value for money if you're from outside Japan.After paying more than 130,000 Yen for three nights of a twin bed room, I regret not choosing a much better option, a hotel right next to this one. Everything seemed near perfect before late night checking-in as the reservation was very well confirmed and managed by a manager. After checking-in around midnight, I recognized this was the worst choice in my entire life to celebrate a special moment. Totally the opposite side of all the great reviews- so tiny and very outdated room (e.g., paints-off here and there) with the construction view and loud highway car noise from windows. Even worse, no other room available after midnight.The front desk staff (when checking in after midnight) was also very rude in an extremely POOR English when I asked an additional room key, and more mineral water since my boy was sick. After waiting another 5 minutes, the staff sternly replied back to me... There was no way for me to get water for my boy to my room in this hotel after midnight. The only thing I liked about this hotel was its location and breakfast. The ladies in the lobby were kind and helpful too. I very much regret not selecting Hilton with even lower room rates. I would never ever stay at this unreasonably expensive 2-3 star hotel again.

We had a good time staying at Grand Pacific de Daiba in December 2015.The service was excellent, staff were well trained and professional and details were looked into.Transport arrangements to Disneyland, nearby attractions and the airports were well planned and executed.The rooms are well spaced though overall the building and decorations are not new.Nearby shopping malls and subway station were appreciated.

Stayed here based on recommendations by TripAdvisor and found it exactly as other fellow travellers had said. Well-located 1 minute away from Odaiba station and 5 minutes away from all the food and an easy walk from all the attractions. Hotel was lovely, polished, clean and the staff were professional and helpful.Convenience store just outside the hotel! Would definitely stay again if i were to return to Odaiba.Didn't get a view of the Rainbow Bridge from our room, but the view of the sea we got, was equally lovely.

This hotel good location cause sorrounding many attraction and mall The mrt station behind the hotel, you can go to anywhere , breakfast is good with international menu + sushi (please more variety of sushi ), the room is clean and i had a big one with 44sqm, the staff polite and good services, fast check in & out, thanks

One of the best hotel in Tokyo. Location wise it's really good. It's less than 3mins walk from Daiba station, shopping malls are just 10mins walk away.The rooms are really huge for the standard of Tokyo. Top class cleanliness as well. The staffs are really helpful at all times. They are also able to speak simple English, which is a great plus plus at times.The hotel provide bus service to Tokyo Disneyland, as well as Haneda and Narita airport terminals. Really convenient especially when you are carrying loads of luggage around with you.

Hotel LocationClose to the Daiba Station and Diver City & Aqua City Shopping Arcade.ReceptionistSpoke fluent English and performed professionally.LobbyBig with good quality.FacilitiesThis was not a new hotel but all facilities inside the hotel was clean and tidy. There was kettle, tea bags....toothpaste, shower cap, Shiseido cleaning oil, milky lotion for ladies inside the washroom. RoomSize was big compare with those hotels located in Shinjuku. The size there was even bigger than Keio Plaza Shinjuku which I was get used to stay a few years ago. I paid more and got the view facing the rainbow bridge which was excellent. I did reserve room for my parents facing the same view as well but unfortunately the building of Hiltion was blocked part of the view.Free WiFiI bought the Bmobile sim card so no comment can be provided here.ShoppingLocated to the shopping area and we did our shopping until the shops were closed.There were a lot of restaurants inside the Aqua & Diver City but personally I perferred those in Diver. Will I stay this hotel again?YES if I want to visit Daiba again.If not, I will choose to stay those in Shinjuku instead.This is a nice hotel if you would like to travel around the area of Daiba, Disneyland.

Our Family of 7 (2 kiddos incl) stayed here for 3 days during 12th - 15th October 2015.What I liked about here:- Spacious; the View out is awesome; the Room and Bath Tub area were also tastefully decorated- Accessibility; the Hotel is located within 3 minutes walk to the Monorail and 5 minutes to the nearest Shopping Centre that you will have no issues sourcing for food/commodities.- Attractions; some of the attractions like the Odaiba Statue of Liberty, Fuji TV Station and Rainbow Bridge (the view of it) are also just steps away- Hotel services are great; staffs were also very friendly with our queries/arrangementsConclusion:Given that it was my first time visiting Odaiba, I am pleased that I have chosen Grand Pacific Le Daiba as my base. The stay was pleasant and located comfortably besides many Shopping Centres, Attractions and Commodities that I did not waste much time covering them all. The cost versus service rendered/facilities was also very affordable and worthy. I have also heard that this place will be heavily promoted in view of the 2020 Japan Olympic; being used as one of the venues. So if you have not been here, you should. And while you are here, I recommend you to consider Grand Pacific Le Daiba.

The service and the room per se is excellent, location is outside the tokyo main area, your need to use another monorail line to get to the hotel (ie 320 yen per trip or 800 yen per daypass). This monorail station is just infront of hotel lobby. It is also a shuttle bus service to narita airport.....

This is a great hotel with great service. Centrally located in Le Daiba, surrounded by shopping plazas, close to the train station. Hotel rooms are very nice and comfortable. Staff are very efficient. Very impressive indeed!

We stayed in a double room on the Presidential floor. This comes with use of the facilities such as the lounge, the gym and Breakfast.Overall i have to say this was an amazing stay. I booked it through TripAdvisor and got an amazing deal. The room was large, clean, and had a real charm to it. The bed was super comfortable and we had nice views from the room. The bathroom was large, with a great bath and separate shower.The restaurant for Breakfast on the top floor was really large. It has a massive selection of anything you could really want. Fry up, waffles, pancakes, cereal, fruit, miso, salad, omelette, toast, pastry, juices, etc...The hotel has several eateries although we only tried the main buffet restaurant. The gym was relatively equipped. It can comfortably accommodate 5-10 people before you would have to get creative with a workout. There was never more than 3 or 4 when i went. There is also an indoor swimming pool.It is located on the island of Daiba, so it is a little of the way for some perhaps, but there is a tram station literally 50 meters from the hotel. So whilst it may take a while to commute in, it is still convenient. You will require a separate "rail" card for this though. It isn't covered by the Metro pass. I believe it was 800 yen per day. The main stop being Shimbashi, where you can transfer to the metro to get around Tokyo.The hotel is located in a convenient place to offer great views of the Rainbow Bridge, the Tokyo Tower and Statue of liberty. It is also in close proximity to the Gundam statue and Odeo Onsen, both being within 10 minutes walk.There are taxi's outside of the hotel and it costs about 4000-5000 yen to get a taxi to Tokyo Station, taking approximately 15-20 minutes. If the weather is bad, the hotel has complimentary umbrellas for guests.

I stayed this hotel with my husband and a three year old child recently. We booked a double room on the rainbow bridge side so the view was great however our room especially our bed was very small for three people to sleep in. Staffs were efficient but we felt a luck of TLC as there were lots of group booking people turned up at the same time.

Odd location... good for Disney perhaps and Daiba Island activities but inconvenient for most of Tokyo access. I cannot speak highly enough about the staff who - even by Japanese standards - stood out. Rooms, common areas and lobby were pristine and quite nice, as were amenities. Value was very reasonable particularly for this caliber of property in pricey Tokyo.

I enjoyed everything about this place, the room, the service, the view, the food . The location could not be better, 10-15 min by train to the center of the city. The breakfast with a view of Mount Fuji is hard to beat . Highly recommend it

We stayed a whole week at the Grand Pacific, had a 42 sqm room on the 24th floor and it was just amazing. We got a very good rate since I booked this several months in advance.The hotel is situated on the artificial island of Odaiba just across the Rainbow Bridge. Amazing big beds, a wonderful view. A lottt of comfort and luxury, a bathroom with a shower and a bathtub. The bathroom was as spacious as many hotelrooms in other places are. And we loved being in Odaiba although you have to take the Yurikamome monorail to downtown Tokyo every day. Odaiba is calm and almost quiet after a day in this vibrant, fascinating city. And coming back to the Grand Pacific was like coming to a home much more luxurious than our home. Any time again!! Stayed in many hotels in my life, but this one goes right in as #1. We did not take the expensive breakfast on the 30th floor, but bought us sandwiches and yoghurt in a nearby store and had breakfast on our room. P.S.: Did I mention that the WiFi was just amazing with the fastest upload I have EVER experienced? My 20 megapix pictures were uploaded just like that.

I have never experienced such politeness and sincerety in my life. If i could give 6 stars i would. They send one of their staff even for your minor problems ( such as in my case i needed a scanner and printer) their staff support you until you are satisfied with the solution. By support i mean they stand by your side. Hotel is very clean and in a very convenient location.

Having stayed here 2 years previously i was expecting much the same as last time.Unfortunately my room felt like it had not been looked after well enough in the ensuing years.Moving the bed, underneath was very very dusty and dirty suggesting any cleaning is only done around the furniture and never under.All other parts of the hotel and facilities have not changed for better or worse.The service was excellent as it was last time and i also found the gym to be good and also used the table tennis and indoor golf which were both good.I would stay here again as the location is good but my room needs a deep clean

I recently stayed at the Grand Pacific Le Daiba in Tokyo during my attendance at the Japan Home & Building Show 2015 - all facilities were excellent and i was impressed by their service at all times. However, you have to queue up for quite long time for breakfast, if you visit the high floor restaurant around 8:30, the restaurant is big enough, but only open partial area for breakfast and that's why.

Excellent location, Easy on transport to anywhere in tokyo and the rooms are nice n big.3 great malls nearby which is very convenient . will definately recommend this hotel to Family and friends.Will stay here again when I am back in Tokyo.

Last month we stayed here from Nov 12 to 24, 2015. This is our second visit to this hotel. We brought a group of 10 here with us on a tour (Akiyoshi tour). I was the tour guide. This is the best Hotel. There are 4 shopping centers near this hotel. It has a train station right in front of the hotel. So convenient to get anywhere in Tokyo. It has a free shuttle bus to Disneyland. There is a McDonald's about a block away for eating breakfast. There is a huge food court in Diver City Shopping mall right next to the hotel. Many restaurants in the other malls too. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They can arrange for your transportation back to the airport. They can help you get a tour to Mt. Fuji. They have a 24 hour convenience store right in front of the hotel. We will always come back and stay here.

This was our last night in the country before flying home and it provided a spectacular setting with the views over the bay and the Rainbow Bridge from our 23rd floor room. This cost only £130 on Hotels.com, a low price for a high class room. It was very well fitted and a very good size for Tokyo.The hotel staff were friendly and efficient so this hotel should be well recommended.The trip to Haneda was around twenty five minutes early the next morning.

Stayed here for 2 nights as we wanted to end our Japan trip with amazing view of Tokyo Bay and this hotel delivered just that. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a team of friendly and helpful staff. We were also allowed to check in 1 hour earlier than scheduled check- in time which is a big plus.We stayed in the Superior room with a bay view. The room was spacious with large bathrooms, nice products and big comfortable bed. The room offered spectacular views of the bay and the bridge and it looks magnificent at night. The hotel itself has many facilities such as shuttle services to Disneyland/Sea, shuttle services to the airport, a gym, pool , sauna, restaurants, 24 hour mart and the best thing is, the train stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel is located within walking distance to everything that are cool and interesting in Odaiba - such as Diver City Mall , Venus Fort Mall, Aquacity Mall, Statue of Liberty, Fuji TV building and the cool Toyota Mega Webb. There are plenty to do here.

Hotel that tries REALLY hard to be fancy but the decor comes off as a bit gaudy. The location is visually quite stunning, save for all the construction work going on. Had a view of the rainbow bridge.This area is up and coming, might be worth a visit in 10 years when this location has really established itself. Only restaurant food on offer in the area was that provided by the hotels; instead opted to have dinner in the nearby mall.Good facilities but if you are looking for somewhere to explore Tokyo from I would suggest that you find somewhere more accessible as this island is only connected by private rail lines!

We had a very nice experience in this hotel. The room is clean, staffs are very polite and helpful, the room had an awesome city view. The train station is just right beside it and hotel location is very close to shopping malls.Their restaurant is on the top floor with great view.

We decided to spend 2 nights in this hotel because the kid wanted to go to disney land and disney sea.The hotel provided free transport for going and coming back to the hotel. The ride was about 25 minutes which is very near to the kids attractions.The hotel was good and nice, and definitely the best hotel I have stayed in Tokyo. Will recommend to stay if you are going to disneyland. In fact, I would considered staying there if I'm in Tokyo and not going to disney land.ps: you need to pay $1200 yen for the gym, but it was a very equipped gym.

I'm staying in room 712 now.And I downloaded Tripadvisor app bcoz of this hotel..The room is not so big but acceptable.Old style but very clean and well managed.The bar on 30 fl is so romantic, You can enjoy very nice view.I will bring my family next time.

I was in Room 2703, a large- sized twin room overlooking the Rainbow Bridge and beyond it central Tokyo. It’s hard to beat this view -- looking across the bay to Tokyo is very scenic.I had access to the executive lounge, which was a very nice setting and with good snacks and drinks. The lounge's con’ierge was very helpful and gracious.The linens on the bed were fantastic, with superfine damask comforter and pillow cases. There was no noise at all and I slept very comfortably.Breakfast was on the 30th floor so of course the 270 degree view encompassed Haneda airport on one extreme, the inner bay and central Tokyo, and the outskirts of the bay leading to Chiba at the other extreme. If shy Mt. Fuji is showing itself, there is a beautiful view of the mountain. There was a good selection and high quality of food.The Daiba station of the Yurikamome line is a very short walk away, and at a floor above the street level, the same level as the hotel’s lobby. You can stroll at this level over to a large shopping center which also has plenty of restaurants. Across the station is the former Nikko, now a Hilton, and there are many nearby office buildings so all the infrastructure you could want is in place. But Odaiba has a wide- open feel. The Yurikamome line carries you across the Rainbow Bridge and ends at the JR line at Shimbashi station, so central Tokyo is very easy to access. The view from the Yurikamome line is so good that you almost always see people riding it for just the view.

Stayed 3 nights in July. What a enjoyable and relaxing area to stay in this part of Tokyo. Many shops nearby. Room was well appointed with awesome view, perhaps bathroom was a little old fashioned. Excellent service at the front desk.

One of the best hotels ever. Great location...easy train access...perfect. Close proximity to malls, great restairants. Hotel staff was exceptional and VERY helpful. When i return, i will definitely stay at this hotel again.

My wife & I stayed here 2 nights & I have to say this place is flawless. From the friendly & efficient staff to the perfectly cleaned rooms they do everything so well. My wife was in a wheelchair for this trip so we requested a suitable room. What we got was better than anything we expected. The bathroom was big enough to manoeuvre in, with separate bath & shower. While there were handrails fitted they were not big & in your face like some can be. Being close to good shopping, restaurants & train station (easy walking distance) was an added bonus.

I stayed four nights in this hotel last October and it was a pleasant experience. The rooms are big and comfortable. My room offered a lovely view over the bay and the skyline of Tokyo. The staff was friendly and the food excellent. The hotel is located near a stop of public transportation and can also be reached with a special airport shuttle bus. It also offers a shuttle bus to Disney Tokyo. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

This hotel can be quite expensive to stay in, but if you look around, you can often get good deals. The rooms for Japan are quite spacious and very well appointed.If you can, try for a room facing the Rainbow Bridge, although even the rooms on the other side of the hotel have interesting views of the port of Tokyo.Although out of the centre of Tokyo, the Yurikamome train line takes you to right outside the hotel in 15 minutes from Shimbashi Station. The service is very frequent.If you stay during the WTA tennis event which takes place close by, a lot of the players stay at this hotel.

Grand Pacific Le Daiba Hotel near Tokyo Disneyland is the place to stay when visiting Tokyo. Short walking distance to the mall/restaurants and a very beautiful view of the Tokyo statue of Liberty and the rainbow bridge (at night, a must see!). The Hotel room was very clean with top of the line amenities. No complain on my part, only accolades .

This is the nicest five star hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world. Facilities were amazing and the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is on the monorail line as well as the ferry stop. Very conveniently located to city hotspots.

Tips:1. Request higher floor(non smoking) and facing Rainbow Bridge.2. Free shuttle bus to/from Disneyland or Disneysea. You need to book online (link from hotel official website) as early as 3 months ago.3. Free shuttle bus around Odaiba. We didn't manage to use this service as you will walk from one place to the other.4. Can save ¥1000 if you stay more than 1 night and you don't need room service (change linen or tidy up your room)*conditions apply5. They also provide transportation to other locations, fees apply and please check with hotel staffs.6. No need to buy a day pass for Yurikamome Railway (¥800/adult). We end up walling to the shopping mall, whic is 10-15 mins away.7. If you book the hotel for more than 1 night via some hotel booking website, try book each night separately, it could be cheaper and increase the availability. It works for us.Family of four visited Japan in Oct 2015 and booked the above hotel for 2 nights via other hotel booking website.Hotel was located 1 min away from the Daiba railway station, and there is a 24hr convenient store (combini) next to the hotel, very convenient.We arrived in the morning and left our luggage with the front desk check in counter. We came back and check in quite late in the evening.We were thrilled that we have been given a higher floor with view of the Rainbow Bridge. Room was very spacious per Japanese standard, water pressure was great, heaps of toiletries that you won't found in other hotel (towel and hair band) even they have Shisheido lotion set. They have also provided character slippers and toothbrush for children.Some staffs can speak English so no meed to worry.Overall, we were extremely happy with the hotel and will definitely come back. What a shame, we only stayed for 2 nights, which we didn't have sufficient time to explore the Odaiba area. Heaps of shopping malls and outlet.
user_name:
Alvis W
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: If you will keep venturing out of Odaiba, stay in the center to save time. However, this hotel is nicely located with connecting access to the monorail and within walking distance to malls, eateries and Japan's own statue of liberty. We weren't satisfied with the hotel breakfast though.

This is our first trip to Japan and we stayed here for 4 nights before going to Osaka. The hotel is located at Odaiba City which is a tourist spot, equipped with lots of malls for shopping and meals with the harbor view.There are Aqua City, Diver's City and The Decks (where LEGOLAND and SEGA entertainment) is located. If you are a Gundam fan, don't forget to see the structure at Diver's City.At Aqua City, there was also a money changer machine which gives the best rate I got for the entire trip.Back to the hotel, there are 3-5 restaurants for breakfast. Make sure your room comes with breakfast as some eateries opens quite late around 11am.The room is clean, amenities are excellent and staffs are very helpful. There is also free shuttle bus to Disneyland but need advance booking. Laundry is expensive in the hotel and there is no coin launderette around Odaiba, we did ours in our bathroom :)It was a good experience with the excellent weather during our stay and we enjoyed being here.

I justed stayed there for two evenings for an important family meeting.The front office reception service could have been more efficient both in checking in and coordinating the meeting space. We found that the on-duty supervisor was a bit annoying that he insisted that the baby crib that was prepared for one of the room was not safe and insisted to remove it. I felt that it wasn't an English issue rather a management issue. Even getting request for late check-out was out of the question. On the other hand, my experience with the Restaurant were quite wonderful. Excellent food and service for both days during the stay.I would hope the level of training at the front reception should be followed with more care in the perception of the staying guest.
