The one at the 2nd floor is not so busy and has a complete range of Japanese and western breakfast. The 3rd floor serves authentic japanese food. However it comes as a set meal. These items you can see in the buffet at the 2nd and 30th floor. The best is the one at the 30Th floor with the widest selection and the best view, this is however the busiest too during breakfast.The hotel is next to 2 malls the aqua city and diver city. When you go out at the second floor, you can see a beautiful area with even a look a like statue of liberty and overlooking the beautiful bridge.It is also connected to the monorail which links to the subway.taxi is always available.Very ideal for big groups too.

Stayed for six nights while attending a conference at Miraikan. The room is excellent and spacious, wifi connection at superb speed (ok, I usually used it early in the morning) and very nice view. Near to shopping malls and also train station. Convenient public transportation from airport to the hotel. The negative point would be having a huge window at the shower tub (since I was there during winter) it was so chilling every time I had my shower. Other than that, I can only praise this hotel. Definitely will recommend it to family and friends.

Stayed here for 5 days for our first trip to Japan. The hotel is based out on Tokyo bay , stunning views nearby , looking out over Rainbow bridge and beyond to the City. This hotel is of excellent quality , rooms are a delight with size being unbelievably large considering the position within a City.Clean and comfortable everything you need for your stay , would thoroughly recommend this hotel.One more thing I can mention is the free Wi-Fi , it is fantastically fast !

We enjoyed our stay here very much. A little bit out of the way from central Tokyo but an easy monorail trip. Lots of shopping and places to eat close by. Interesting area right near Tokyo Beach. Our room had ample space for three people and was very comfortable. We loved it.

Very comfortable stay with excellent facilities.Variety in spread of food. Helpful staff.Convinient location near to Pacific. Ease of Metro. Rooms are excellent. Took Limo bus from Airport to arrive and leave.

Clean and spacious if a bit wornLocation is great:Convenient to BigSight convention center, Disney,Fuji,etc...On the bay, so lots of trails for walking/jogging, a couple of malls nearby.The hotel itself is a bit run down, but clean and well run.Little gym, with surprisingly largish pool- probably 15yards or so.Great breakfast buffet, and a few nice if expensive restaurants inhouse.

I came to run the Tokyo marathon. The finish area + expo was at the Big Sight which was about 3 stops on the Yurikomome. The Grand Pacific seems to be the best property in Odaiba based on reviews/photos. I would say those reviews were pretty much spot on. Our stay was fine.Arriving, we took the Limo bus from Narita. No connections and front door service. It was the 4th stop on the route, all in Odaiba. It took about 1 hr 20 min. Check in was smooth. The hotel is large and long/big hallways remind me of a big resort in vegas. The twin room on floor 8 was a decent size with views of the water/hotel nikko next door. The bed was comfortable. Only channel with English was CNN Japan... it seemed to replay the same stuff every hour. Not the same programming you see in the US. The hot water maker was nice. Instant coffee/tea bags are provided. I must say, the instant coffee wasn't bad! It did give me an excuse to try out Starbucks Via so I picked some up while I was out. Only 2 single plugs to really access. Walls a tad thin, heard someone running around upstairs... possibly a child? Heard a siren and maybe a loud motorbike...no other traffic from the street below. There is a freeway on the other side of the hotel so I can't comment on that noise.The bathroom was really small. I hated how the water leaked out of shower to the floor. There is a lower area with a built in floor drain keeping floor dry. Every time the shower or even the sink runs, you have water noise. The shower is handheld and when you have it on the cradle, it's difficult to get under. The door locked back when it opens so it stays open. It's a nice touch however in the middle of the night when you want to close the door, it makes a loud noise which could wake up someone. We gave the buffet a try one day only. It had a decent selection but mostly things you really don't want for breakfast such as salads, pasta dishes, etc... it was stuff Japanese would want to eat. The assortment of breads, meats was fine... eggs was scrambled with cheese. The fruit was fine if you could get to it. We saw a sign that said it gets busy around 830 so we went at 700 and it was already busy... the line was 30 deep. The coffee was great, luckily we were seated near there. The views were great if you wanted to constantly rub the condensation off the windows. So, when we left around 745 they were already taking numbers as there were many people waiting to get in. I say it's okay to try one day but don't pay extra for room cost with this buffet included and def don't pay for breakfast up front while checking in.The gym is really spacious and nice. It was a tad busy however still pretty good. The equipment was nice... the cost was 1150 yen a day which included the pool, spa, etc...There is wifi in the room but decided to use the rental mobile wifi I had rented for my stay in Japan. I had this delivered to the hotel and was waiting for me when I checked in.The Daiba station is behind hotel, about 5 min walk from room. There is a 24 hr convenience store along with a few cafes/restaurants you'll see on the way.Aqua city/Deck's & Diver city are all within walking distance. I would say about 10 min... each has restaurants. Venusfort is better reached by train or 20 min walk.

The most convenient hotel and a great mix of business and life in Tokyo. The hotel is 1 min walk from Daiba train station & has a lot of life and activity below. The rooms are spacious & very well located. Total money's worth. Highly recommended.

Hotel conveniently located in Odaiba area. There is a lot of nice restaurants, shopping malls and attractions nearby, great view on Tokyo's rainbow bridge and wonderful architecture. The subway train station is just a few minutes’ walk.Hotel is very nice, clean and comfortable. The staff is very polite, professional and helpful.Rooms are spacious, include different modern facilities and everything is needed for a stay to feel very comfortable and pleasant. The restaurant and catering are really good. The breakfast excellent – diverse and delicious, including local Japanese and continental food. Astonishing panoramic view of the city coast line from the restaurant on the 30th floor.Would like to return to this wonderful country with the most polite, friendly and courteous people I've ever met during my travels.Overall that was a great stay. Highly recommend this hotel.

Daiba is not the center of Tokyo but the hotel offers spacious room, with Tokyo bay view. The hotel is a Good neighbor hotel of Disney, they have free shuttle bus to Disney parks.The free shuttle requires reservations, the first shuttle in the morning was fully booked on the day we stayed. We took Yurikamome and JR via Shin-Kiba St, but it only took 30+min.Deluxe twin room has a basket full of bath amenities, including basic cosmetic for ladies, bath additive, bath robes, room slippers.2 bottles of complimentary bottled water were provided, and an electric kettle was available.

Simply great hotel...staff is very friendly & helpful...rooms are great...beds comfy,,,bottled water complimentary...heated toilet seats...and the breakfast buffet is delicious.My only tip would be try to get a room not facing the highway...the traffic sounds can echo up to your room.It is also steps from 2 very good malls...with great restaurants & food courts and shops.Very close to a main subway stop as well...and a 10 minute trip to their amazing Fish Market- wow!

I stayed in this hotel for two nights. Room was quite spacious, hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Location is excellent, especially if you are planing to visit TDL and friends in Tokyo. Odaiba area is simply fantastic! A lot of nice restaurants, great view on Tokyo's rainbow bridge, and wonderful architecture (Tange's Fuji TV building is breathtaking example of structuralism at its very best).

First time to stay in Daiba. Top quality hotel, conveniently near Daiba station. (Only complaint is I thought the pool could have been included and no kids allowed in it if you're traveling with under-16s.) Daiba is quieter than most of Tokyo but has a few things to do and great views of the city. Reasonable choice of restaurants but if you're looking for cheaper and more down-to-earth 'izakaya' you are only a short train ride to Shinbashi. Also reasonably well located for Disneyland but if you want to take the shuttle bus you have to book early or it might be full.PS "Le Daiba" slightly pretentious name for a hotel that might grate on European ears!!

Tokyo Japan was where we were going to hold our Supplier meeting with one of the biggest brands in the world and it was going to be my first time to go to Japan. I was ready with everything, from outfits to destinations I was going to photograph. We stayed at the Grand Pacific Le Daiba since it was near our conference venue. The breakfast view is always something to look forward to every single morning. I did look forward to the afternoon shopping I did everyday and site seeing. The interior of the place was very Christmassy. By the end of our stay I wanted to take with me the basket full of complimentary personal supplies and toiletries.

I was here a month back and loved the hotel. Terrific view and wonderful property. The rooms are placed so that customers get a panoramic view of the city coast line. The subway train station is just a few minutes’ walk and is well connected with literally every fringe in Tokyo. The surrounding locality is stuffed with sprawling malls and entertainment hubs, which are a great option in case you are travelling with family and need a place to chill out. The breakfast was diverse and offered food ranging from classic Japanese to core western dishes. The cafeteria cum restaurant on the 30th floor is a sheer delight. The rooms were spacious and fitted with modern facilities. Overall a great experience. Highly recommended.

My family and I recently returned from a wonderful five day stay at this hotel. From the moment we checked in until the time we checked out everything was perfect! We stayed in a very spacious and luxurious triple deluxe room with a great view. The room was well furnished and complimentary bottles of mineral water were re-supplied every day as well as an English newspaper by my door every morning. There is a lot to do in the vicinity of the hotel....shopping, restaurants and I also recommend `Mirakan` which is a very interesting National Future Science museum located near the hotel. The Disney shuttle is free but be sure to make reservations for it at the concierge desk. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Tokyo but the Grand Pacific Le Daiba will be the place I will stay from now on!

Stayed here in November 2013 for 3 nights in a deluxe room on the 18th floor with wonderful views of main Tokyo city across the water the Daiba Monorail and Daiba area.The Bed was comfortable and the Wifi was pretty good.The Bathroom had a separate shower stall and had more amenities than most Hotels that I have stayed at around the world. You can’t get better toilets like they have in Japan with a seat warmer different kinds of water sprays and pressure settings and even a dryer,absolutely brilliant! Excellent breakfast on the 30th floor with a view to die for.Conveniently located in Odaiba area, with the Monorail attached to the hotel across a short connecting walkway. The monorail gets you across the water to Shiodome and Shimbashi where you can catch the metro to the main city areas like Ginza, Shinijuku Shibuya and Roppongi.There is a 24 Hours minimart attached to the hotel and a coffee shop.Aqua City Mall is just across a walkway. We ate twice at an ‘Izakaya’ (Japanese Bar/Restaurant) called ‘Nande-ya’ or ‘Haibana’ (not sure!) on the ground floor because it was open till late and served good food, beer and sake. There is another mall next to it called ‘Decks Tokyo Beach!’ Great stay overall! Will return to this wonderful country called ‘Japan’ with the most polite, friendly and courteous people I have come across in all my travels.

This was just a one-nighter before flying out from Haneda. I was very pleasantly surprised by the spaciousness of the room given that rooms in Japan are usually tiny. Mind you, we had booked a triple to accommodate 2 adults and 2 young kids. Style of the hotel is quite 'grand' in a mock European style with the usual odd Asian take on things but overall the service was very good....just don't let the bell hop near the GPS on your rental car if you have one...the guy reprogrammed mine, which took me on a 3-hour tour around Tokyo in rush hour only to find that he'd set the destination to the car rental head office. Lesson learned.

I stayed in this hotel for around 3 weeks. It was a wonderful experience. Hotel is really nice, clean and tidy. Breakfast is really nice, such a variety of food is available both continental and local Japanese food. The local of this hotel is awesome, there are so many malls nearby in which you can find all sort of foods and all sorts of brands for shopping. Metro service is just across the Hotel, get a suica card for traveling and you can use the public transport. Staff is very nice and polite, Japanese are very cultured people so you will find the same hospitality at the hotel as well. I will highly recommend this hotel.

Although this hotel was booked as part of a tour, am more than glad that this was the hotel we stayed in. The room was just right for our family of four. The rooms are cleaned immaculately daily and if you choose not to have your room cleaned for two days, they will give you 1000 yen worth of coupons (which we used for my 6-year old's breakfast buffet as hers was not included in the package. The hotel is conveniently located between two popular malls so shopping and dining was just a few meters away. Great view of Tokyo bay and very accessible to the Daiba station (Yurikamome line). Also offers free shuttle service to Tokyo Disneyland/Disney Sea. Will definitely stay here again.

Stayed here a few nights last week and had a great experience. Very nice luxury hotel, very clean, the rooms have amazing views of Tokyo Bay and the hotel provides everything that you can think of. Also - the room was much more spacious than expected, which was a nice surprise. Great location as well - lots of shopping options within walking distance. Lots of good restaurants nearby, which is good since dinner at Le Daiba is a bit pricy and the menu is not specifically Japanese. They have a great breakfast though. And the view from their restaurant on the 30th floor is unforgettable.

You cannot believe you can get a value for money hotel such as the Grand Pacific Le Daiba in Tokyo that is just a quarter of an hour away from the Haneda airport or the central business district. Ask for a room at the uppermost floors to have a magnificent view of the city. If you can afford it, go for one of the suites. The restaurants are many but my picks are Hamayu and Star Road on the 30th floor. The Hamayu’s tables are laid out so that every diner is able to enjoy the Tokyo skyline. The Star Road is intimate.If you are a swimmer, the outdoor pool is great, but only in the summer season. All other facilities are as expected. Just the right hotel for you if you are on business and your family would love it if you take them there for a holiday.

This hotel has a great location and very professional staff . Lots of choices for breakfast rather traditional Japanese or western flare with great views of the water and city line . Shopping and trains are all just minutes away by walking elevated walkways . Rooms have wonderful views of port and rainbow bridge . The sky bar on the top floor is a perfect way to finish a long day of shopping or site seeing .

We stayed here for six nights and enjoyed it. We found the hotel using Hotwire. The hotel is next to three shopping centers in walking distance. You can even take pictures with the "Statue of Liberty" and "Rainbow Bridge" in one picture. We used a PASMO card to pay for public transportation and loved being just one minute away from the next station. We did not have an adapter for our laptops to Japanese two prong outlets and the hotel staff had one for us. Bathroom is not huge, but the toilette seat is heated. The wireless internet worked wonderful and the only downside of the room was a lack of extra, unused outlets for our laptops. If you are a Disney fan, the hotel provides free shuttle transportation three times in the morning to Tokyo Disneyland. They also have 3 trips back in the evening. Book them early as they have limited capacity. Their English speaking staff is limited, but they have a few people that will understand English. The elevators were amazing. As soon as you pressed the button, the elevators displayed which one will come so you had plenty time to get to the correct door. Wish more of other hotel elevators would have that technology.

The best thing i liked in Grand Pacific Le Daiba is the breakfast view at the 30th floor..... for daily breakfast to have an astonishing view like in an observatory is just unusual, but Grand Pacific has it. The location is also very good being surrounded with malls, walking distance, and the train station just at the ground floor. The staff though were not very nice, especially when we arrived and they did not lend us the luggage carts for no acceptable reason..... it was such a dismay that some of our tour friends had to argue with the hotel management for their rudeness...... guess they really have to work out on hospitality..... very un-Japanese.......

Nothing so special to make me feel memorable of this hotel other than location which is stone-throw away from two giant mall (one is Daibacity the new and destination local people recently). It is huge. Service is standard. Swimming pool can't be accessed by under 16 years old (whata bummer!!). I booked for triple room, but found that my room is double one. They quickly change the room to tripple, but too late my little boy has jumped on the bed of double room (feel bad to imagine the sheet need to be changed only for the jump - not environtmental friendly, but....). Breakfast buffet is standard. Nice but nothing special.

This hotel has a great location with subway stop across street to get around Tokyo and several malls close by it with a free shuttle for you. The staff is very helpful and speak good enough English. The room is large for Japan. Great bathroom with large assortment of toiletries. Only reason not getting 5th star was carpet needed shampooing and called for assistance with wifi in the room and was told not available (which others did get with a router)

This is a great hotel for couples. The hotel is beautiful with European style including lots of marble, woods, and a grand staircase. The room was large with a marble bathroom and great views of the Rainbow Bridge. The buffet was also very good. The only drawback is the location. It's in Odaiba which is not in the center of Tokyo. I prefer to walk to lots of restaurants, shopping, etc like in Shibuya, Shinjuku, or Ginza. They have a convenient monorail connected to the hotel so you can get around so it depends on your priorities.

We stayed here for six nights. Staff here is very friendly and helpful. Location is convenient, it has direct access path to Daiba train station. And a few big shopping malls are within walking distance.The highlight of the hotel is they encourage you to save environment. If you don't need them to clean your room, you will get one coupon which worth 1000 yen (maximum 2). This is really good.And different than some of the previous reviews, they actually allowed us to leave luggage in the hotel before and after check out. We went for Kyoto after 6 days in Tokyo, and they provided courtesy to keep our luggage for 5 days!

Excellent stay - well connected to the city and great position on the waterfront. The room we stayed in was a bit tired looking and needed a renovation and would opt for the rainbow bridge view next time which was slightly higher price - although we still had a great view over the water which was really relaxing. The staff all excellent - probably some of the best service I have experienced. They couldn't do enough to help and made our stay and absolute pleasure - this was especially important on such a short and quite last minute trip (the concierge was amazing and gave us really good advice to see the sights during our stay) Would definitely recommend!
user_name:
John David C
Luxembourg City, Luxembourg

review_body: We stayed here for a week. The hotel is accessed by the mono rail and car of course. We travelled around with a Rail Pass and found it quite convenient and very quiet and great views. The hotel was fully booked and lots happening while we were there. Great restaurants in the hotel and outside there is a great big shopping centre with lots of restaurants too. There is also a 24hour shop on the ground floor for any snacks or whatever you want. It is very close to Haneda airport as we arrived late at night we arranged for a pickup at the airport and it takes about 20mins to the hotel. Would recommend this to other travellers. We got a pack which was great. Oct 2013

This is a paradise, I think. Daiba monorail is just at the front of the hotel. Though it's far from Harajuku or Ginza, all you want can be found here. Tokyo bay is just a min away. My room is overlooking the Statue of Liberty!! Large shopping area around. We arrived late at night on a rainy day, but a convenient mart next door saved us. The hotel has 3 breakfast corners to choose, 1 traditional Japanese, and 2 international buffet zones. We tried all, one at a time. Very impressed. The one on 30th floor is fine if you want to enjoy the view. For us, we love the traditional Japanese zone. It is quiet and peaceful.Room is spacious and very clean. Washroom is equipped with electronic bidet. Toiletries are full-set including personal Kanebo cosmetic kit.

I stayed here for work at the nearby Ariake Forest Tennis Centre so the location for me was excellent. Even if you want to explore further there is a station 2 mins walk from the front door that takes you to Shinbashi or Shiodome for connections to anywhere in the city.The area around the hotel also has many restaurants shops and bars and even a little beach to watch the jumping fish from!The hotel itself is big, clean, modern business hotel with large rooms.The rooms themselves are nicely decorated with comfortable beds and decent sized bathrooms with excellent showers.I requested Wifi and a router was brought to my room for no charge.The real highlight for me was eating breakfast up on the 30th floor with the stunning views of Tokyo Bay and beyond.The Staff were all fantastic, especially the concierge team who gave great advice on places to go and eat and areas of tokyo to see.My only grumble would be that the gym and pool facilities could do with being open earlier and later each day.I would happily stay here again for work or pleasure

Rooms are spacious compared to the average Japanese Hotel. Staff are efficient and polite, but somewhat distant as per the norm here. Location is close to the airport but far enough away. Lots of nearby food options or shopping if you are into that sort of thing. Nearby there is enough open areas and parks to exercise. Good option hotel for crew

Stayed here for 5 nights. Travelled as couple. Don't expect big rooms (standard for Tokyo), though the service was excellent. Convenient location. I'd recommend getting a PASMO card if you plan on staying in Tokyo for more than a couple of days, which you can purchase from automated machines in the train station next to the hotel. Only a 2 min walk from hotel desk to train station, then only 10 min to down-town.Free wifi in room which worked well (need to get router from front desk).super-helpful staff, lots of bowing, though not the best English if this bothers you (didn't bother me)Also -> Hotel has a convenience store as part of the hotel complex, which I think is 24/hours. Good place to get a full range of snacks (healthy or otherwise) or an umbrella etc if you need stuff like that. You can even pay using your Pasmo card (GET A PASMO CARD!)There are restaurants in the area though they are a little on the pricey side, considering that Tokyo is full of cheap eats. We had breakfast at the hotel everyday though always had dinner in the city somewhere else. Buffet breakfast was top notch.Overall, if staying in Tokyo, i'd definitely recommend this location (Daiba) close enough to the city to be in the game, though still reasonably relaxing and quiet. Some big shopping malls within easy walk too. Its also on the right side of Tokyo for Disney.Whilst the hotel was not bad, it was a little bland, I'd probably stay at hotel Nikko next door next time as it seemed a little fancier.
user_name:
Jeffrey M
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed for one night to attend a western-japanese wedding. First of all, transportation to the hotel is very very convenient, as it sits next to the Daiba overground station (this is a relatively new line and even just the ride is worth it!) - we thought of taking a taxi but in the end it was easier and cheaper to travel by tube.Rooms are pretty average European style (later found out that we had a very large room by Tokyo standards), nicely equipped bathroom (both extremely clean). Very nice views of Tokyo bay.We arrived at 11am and were able to check-in by paying a 5,000Y supplement.It looks like this hotel has made a speciality of weddings, with chapels, waiting rooms, and reception rooms. It was all very nicely organized and timed with the usual impeccable japanese service.We did not try any of the restaurants due to the short stay, but if the wedding reception is a measure of the French restaurant here, it must be very good (and we are French!!), absolutely fantastic creative, light dishes with a Japanese twist. Desserts were absolutely excellent.The hotel is very very big with large halls and hallways, escalators, and feels a bit overwhelming and impersonal. In addition to wedding parties, it seemed quite full of families.

Situated right next to Fuji Television, in the middle of Daiba district in Tokyo.As I was on business I took their special rate, checking in after 8PM and checking out before 8 AM restrictions.This suited my schedule and was rewarded with a great double bed room with nice bathroom, large comfortable bed in a comfortable sized room.However if I was a tourist I am not sure if I would have been so satisfied.This is due to the fact the the Daiba district is a district in its own and quite far from central Tokyo.

Visited over 6 times through 2000 - 2005.Hotel had changed its name from 2008. As its a former Meridien, its supposed to be one of the classical European taste hotel but if you compare its interior with the Meridien in London, you can see that its like a fake/cheaper version. The hotel is nothing similar compared to Westin Yebisu or Ritz Roppongi (two of the other european taste hotels).I have visited few times, all of them on the higher floor and got a great view of Odaiba. I am not sure about the restaurants inside the hotel as I have only had dinner in Star Road on the 30th floor. It was supposed to be the special occasion dinner but I remember that I was quite disappointed with the food - but the view from this restaurant was amazing. The thing about this location is that you do not get a real good food in Odaiba so you do not have much choice than to eat inside the hotel.Odaiba itself if not the romantic development area. It is targeted the kids/younger couples and families with kids. It is more of a huge amusement spot. However, if you do not want to stay in the central Tokyo and want to have a bay-front view, this could be the choice.

I will start by saying I did not stay at this hotel, but rather came specifically to see the rooms decked out in "Gundam style" (for the uninitiated, don't confuse this with "Gagnam style" - Gundams are giant mech robots from Japanese anime.As I learned from the very helpful and attentive sales management staff, the hotel had quietly branded itself in Japan as a venue that specializes in designing limited-engagement “custom rooms” for clientele with a certain fan base. Designers and promoters of certain anime and other entertainment properties will contact the hotel to create these rooms, and will often lend props and other materials. The attention to detail is astonishing – from wall art to bedsheets, from coasters to the toilet-seat cover, absolutely every aspect of these rooms remain “in theme.” The two Gundam suites (each representing a different opposing faction from the anime series) include special edition models, decals on the windows that give the illusion that spacecraft are flying around outside, and even, in one case, a Gundam cockpit with flashing lights and noises. Such atmosphere is not cheap: you're talking $300US a night if not more. But if you are the consummate fan (and if you, unlike me, would not be terrified of somehow marring or wrecking these beautiful things), this place is a find. Like many things in Japan (and unlike the crass blaring advertisements of the rest of Odaiba), this is something kept very quiet...you just have "to know" it exists...and so now you do!Again, my rating represents the artistry of the rooms, and the friendliness of the sales staff...I did not stay the night so I can comment on nothing else.

This is one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed at in the past year and that includes some Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton's. The view is absolutely incredible. I am on the 20th floor. Wifi in the spacious room. Beds are nice and soft. I have noticed that most of the hotels that I have stayed at in Japan the last 2 weeks have had some fairly hard beds.There are malls galore with food courts just outside our front door. My teens could spend days there. Subway station just downstairs as well. Larger than average gift shop downstairs that is open 24 hours and the prices are shockingly reasonable. I always just assume that I am going to pay through the nose at hotel stores. I would highly recommend this hotel and would happily book it again.

Awesome location within close proximity of 3 malls which offer plenty of shopping and dining options. Rooms are spacious and has a stunning view overlooking the bay. Hotel has all the amenities of a 5 star establishment including the Japanese special loos with heated seats, spray and deodorisers.
user_name:
Warlock7
Jebel Ali, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This hotel is located conveniently near the business area at Daiba, right next to Daiba station. I come here to attend an exhibition and it appears to be a good choice except:1. Hygiene - found 3 cockroaches crawling beside my bed over the 2 nights.2. Staff could not understand my complaint about the bugs in English.As a 5 star hotel aimed to serve international visitors, I believe the management can do better than this, especially the hygiene part. I was really surprised to find them in a hotel in Japan.

Note to Hotel: please provide instructions in English on how to operate the room's Zojirushi brand hot water kettles. The buttons on mine were labeled only in Japanese.Zojirushi is a well-respected brand that I associate mostly with high-end rice cookers, and indeed my room's electric kettle resembled a miniature rice cooker. I figured out how to operate it on my 2nd morning, but would've appreciated some guidance.Hotel is large and grand (like its name). Rooms are very clean and luxe. I could have stayed there forever!Odaiba is a fun place to explore. Take the free Bay Shuttle which stops outside the hotel every 15 minutes.

Hotel is well located for tourists if they like shopping centres. When travelling to city or attraction need to change trains and or water bus which adds to journey time with delays between timetableHotel does not have a guest laundryBreakfast only available from 700am - 1000 am even on weekendsMenus are big on buffets with additional pricing on weekendNo coffee shop options for breakfast or simple light breakfast menusVery busy on weekendsBar very expensiveDuring summer rooms become quite light early even with doos and blinds closedLimited english language TV stations with very limited news movie documentary coverageNot ideal for business travel

On a recent trip to Japan lasting 17 days. We (4 adults) stayed at this Hotel for 6 nights at end of May 2013. We found that this hotel was well located though a 15 to 25min trip by train to Downtown. There are lots to see in the area from fantastic architecture to large shopping malls. There is even a beach nearby though not for swimming. Cruises can be taken around the harbour and is worth a couple of hours to get an overall view of the area. We did not have breakfast there but instead got our supplies next door. Great location especially if you want to be away from the crowds sometime. Join " I prefer" if you want to use the pool etc for free.

great location, rooms are large, clean, modern and comfy. They have free shuttle to Disneyland and Disney sea plus free shuttle to museum, Venus Port Mall and surrounding area very convenient if you travel with 3 kids.

We had celebrated our special days in this hotel for couple years now.We liked it because the rooms are large (esp compare to other hotel in Japan), soft carpet, and the location. It is right in the center of Odaiba, it has a shuttle bus to YCAT, to Disneyland and to Venus Port Mall (so does Nikko hotel but Le daiba is slightly cheaper and has bigger room).However, last year when we want to celebrate our daughter birthday, they were full-booked and when we went to directly ask the receptionist, the response was very cold (not even decent apology), considering that we are returning customer, they didn't show any recognition what so ever. Disappointing.

This Hotel offers excellent facilities.It has a main advantage of being on the direct line connecting both airports. The airport limousine bus is quick, convenient, easy to book ( at the airport) and inexpensive.

This is one of the best hotels in Tokyo and comes at a far more reasonable price than most of its competitors. Rooms are large, clean, modern and comfy. They have excellent view of the bay and Tokyo skyline. Breakfast a bit expensive but plentiful, with excellent view from the 30th floor. If you dont want to overpay, there are a lot of very nice food options around.The hotel is located on Odaiba Island, across from Tokyo downtown, with a convenient skytrain connection that takes you to the heart of Tokyo in 15 minutes. Trains run every 3-5 minutes from 6 am to 12.30 am.Good connection to Narita (90 min.) and Haneda (30 min.) airports by Limousine Bus service.Very knowledgable and helpful reception staff.

Wonderful stay convenient location and very accommodating staff. The rooms were large for Japan standards and the view was great from the room. Breakfast choices ...Japanese on the third floor if you want a more peaceful and zen like start to your day. Western buffet on the 30th floor was adequate opens at 7 am ...so the line was quite long. They could probably improve it by starting at 6:30 am as other hotels do. Language is not a problem as most understand basic English and they are very accommodating and would gladly try to go out of their way to address your problems or requests. they generously lent us a modem so we can have wi fi in the room....nothing beats that when you try to avoid roaming charges. Fast enough too that you can use viber, face time, or view cctv from you home country. The hotel is also located near two or three malls and a major train station too.

Recently spent 4 nights here. While location seems far out from central Tokyo the monorail stops right at the hotel and once you have your bearings it's an easy journey into central Tokyo. We took the Narita express train to Shinagawa and got a reasonably priced taxi from there. It saved navigating the various railway lines after a long journey. The bay area is great for shopping and other activities. Plenty of restaurants in the shopping malls all offering good quality meals. In the Aqua Centre opposite the Subway restaurant is a great little Japanese place. It has lots of red lanterns outside. They have an English menu and are very helpful. In Japan think of ordering for the table rather than each person or different courses. Everything comes to the table as it is cooked. The hotel rooms were a great size, clean, comfortable and had great views. Staff were very helpful and managed quite well in English. We were room only and didn't eat at the hotel although there are a few options. The cafe just outside the side entrance does a deal on tea/coffee and a toasted sandwich. This was fine for breakfast but didn't open til 10am. This was a good choice of hotel as we would have missed the bay area and the great daily journey over the bridge. Only negative was having to pay to use the spa

What a way to wrap a great trip around Japan.Great rooms, makes you feel like a royal. A bit far out of central Tokyo but the views are teriffic.Pleanty of eat spots and shops around the hotel and rail way not far away if you want to venture into town.

Location:It is right across the train station so very convenient to get there. The hotel is about 15-20min walk from the main tour area away from all the traffic, but it has the free city shuttle bus stopping right outside the lobby to take you to all the major malls and attractions in Daiba. Room:Room was very spacious, with all the COMPLETE room amenities. I have never seen so many items in the washroom ranging from hair ties to bath salts to comb to anything you can think of for you to use. You have to leave one of the room keys in the wall slot at all time to activate the room lights. The hair dryer is actually stronger and hotter than your typical hotel dryer. We got a room facing the water which is a beautiful view at night seeing the water and city lights. Lobby:You can ask the front desk for internet password and access wireless internet for free in the lobby area only. They also have map and guides of the area in english for tourists which is great help in locating bus stops, but do not depend on them to book anything for you as they do not speak english so how can they make reservations for you when they don't even understand what you want?!

Top quality hotel. Spacious western style rooms; very helpful staff. It is a little out of central Tokyo but it is connected to the rest of the city by a railway which stops right in front of the hotel. Because it is in Le Daiba you have good views and much more open space around you than in many other hotels around the city. We would highly recommend this hotel to others and would stay again ourselves.

Room was clean and spacious with a great view. Even though we took a smoking room, the room hardly had any smoke smell. Amenities were better than expected. There was also a 24hr convenience store and postal service. Hotel was within walking distance of several large shopping centres. My only gripe was that it could only be accessed via the Yurikamome line at 310yen per trip. Total rip-off but no fault of the hotel. The alternative was a 200yen shuttle bus to Tamachi or Shinagawa JR line. Would be better if free wifi was available in the rooms as well instead of just the lobby. Staff were friendly and polite. Highly recommended.

There is a promotion 'PROBIZ' in the hotel own website .Breadfast is included.But I was told breadfast is not included when I checked in.The staffs several times called to my room,more than that, approached to my room twice.It was severely interrupted me.I havn't bring my notebook. When I requested to let me use their computer to get a proof,they even refused.I was very very disappointed.It was really a very unhappy experience in Japan.

I stayed 4 nights in this hotel and really loved it! Located in Le Daiba, this hotel is close to shopping centre and not far from Tokyo city center. The room that I got was on the 23rd floor, massive, clean and with amazing view. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast lounge at the top floor has amazing view, and the breakfast was great.

was in tokyo for a conference and was billeted in this hotel so i really have no idea if it was value for money,but had an amazing sleep the 4 nights that i stayed here. the room that we got was on the 12th floor was quite big with views of the rainbow bridge and the small statue of liberty. service was good and efficient. they have no wifi in the rooms,though they have wired ethernet but you can request for a router they they will set it up in your room.  breakfast was your typical breakfast fare.it was just ok. we tried herbette on the lower ground floor and the restaurant on the 30th with the rainbow bridge view for breakfast. food is the same on both restaurants. try to get there early as it could get crowded and you would have to wait in line for seats. location is walking distance to most tourist spots in the area. free shuttle bus is provided if you dont want to walk. monorail is just a few steps from the hotel entrance.all in all we enjoyed and had a good stay in this hotel.

Stayed 2 nights there and loved the comforts of my room. Massive room and bed with a gorgeous tub. Definitely made full use of it. Location was excellent with a monorail adjacent and huge malls/entertainment centres close by. You can do a quick 5km circuit by the waterfront here and the harbour views are amazing at sunset. A few gripes though- eventhough i had emailed and advised my arrival time, they could not accommodate at all an earlier check-in!. After traveling 15 hours straight, i was a bit miffed especially when to use the gym, swimming pool and onsen there's a separate charge as well. However, staff were very very helpful especially in assisting me setting up the wifi router in the room. Sadly though, i left a fav T shirt in my room and no way to claim it..only real downer in an otherwise good stay.

We checked in for a single night, before going to the airport the next morning. We got an early check-in which was excellent. The hotel is huge, but it seemed almost empty. The entrance from the monorail is a bit wierd. The real entrance is when you get there by car. The room was very nice, clean and with a very large window. We had an excellent dinner (really excellent) on the top floor restaurant. The bar was boring. Boring decor and a indifferent waiter. We still managed to spend quite a handful money there on whisky and cigars. All in all a very nice stay, but missing the 5th star due to being a bit boring...

Stayed in Le Daiba from April 1 to 5. The hotel was adjacent to the monorail and malls. Food was great and the rooms were bigger than most Tokyo hotels. Only problem was the swimming pool and the gym requires a fee even if you are a hotel guest. Free Wifi is only available at the lobby. If you're going to Disneysea or Disneyland, book the shuttle early on as seats are limited. breakfast at the Japanese restaurant was superb and filling. Lines were shorter,too.

This relatively new hotel is located across the harbor from downtown Tokyo, across the Rainbow Bridge, but connected by subway (station across street from hotel entrance). Hotel is huge, with many tour groups and other groups - but many fast elevators mean almost no delays. Nice restaurant on 30th floor crowded for buffet breakfast so we were directed to an alternate on 1st floor - merely adequate buffet. Some malls and shopping nearby (walkable). Room moderate sized with very comfortable bed and relatively quiet; tv had english CNN channel (unusual in Japan); water heater with tea; small frig in room; nice bathroom, with usual heated toilet seat.

Located in Le Daiba, this hotel is close to shopping centre, above subway station and not far from Tokyo city center. Free shuttle bus is provided from most hotels in this area to shopping centre. Great rates and room size. The breakfast lounge at the top floor has amazing view.

Great place to stay for work and especially for family holidays. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious. Great location. Close to malls and Bay attractions and Haneda airport.Looking forward to coming back and staying here again.

I was travelling with 2 kids. The room is huge. The biggest room I ve ever stayed in Japan hotel I think.We got a special rate booking via jalan.net . We stayed here for 2 nights.We booked a twin room as we were travelling with 2 kids so that we can share the beds. However a rollover was available in the room so it is really great for us.When we were there, its easy to access to Odaiba and also to Tokyo Disneyland.Will definitely book here again if we got a chance to come to Japan again.

I liked the location of the hotel as it had easy access to Daiba station, which gets you faster to your destination. The service was above average, we always had hot water waiting for us after cleaning up the room. The front desk staff were helpful and accommodating, too. Room was clean and had enough space for 2 adults, 1 child and all our luggages.There are also lots of nearby tourist spots like Joypolis and the mall Divercity. I highly recommend this place if you want to experience a peaceful stay in Tokyo.

We just got back from Japan, and this was our base for 6 nights.Our main criteria for our hotel for this trip, was:1. A hotel that was served by the Narita Airport Limousine bus service, as we had to catch a morning flight out of Narita. Transiting between train lines very early in the morning is not an ideal choice when traveling with 2 teenagers and 2 kids.2. A direct bus service between Disney and the hotel. We did not want to take the train at 10pm and having to manage transfers and walking with tired kids.3. Near a train/metro station for our other travel plans.4. Free internet connectivity (this is to avoid hefty roaming charges).... and we found one in Tokyo, at 'ok' Japanese rates.The major surprise was that I booked (not by designed) ourselves into a 5* hotel in Tokyo. We did not expect that, as our previous experiences before told us not to expect a full 5* resort for the price we paid. It wasn't cheap, but at Tokyo Bay standards, it was good.We got all the 4 items above and more. The station was attached to the hotel; and there was free internet in the rooms. Wifi router was needed, otherwise just use a LAN cable to get online. the router could be obtained from the Front Desk.The location was on Tokyo's 'island' resort of Odaiba. Even without DIsney there was enough indoor theme parks to entertain the kids (Sega Joypolis, Legoland, Madam Tussaud's, Museums and speciality malls). Another added bonus was that the island was also serviced by Tokyo's water busses. Though takes longer then the trains, we could get to locations by the river banks (eg Asakusa) by boats. It's more scenic, and the 'bus' stop is about 3 min walk from the hotel.Food wise there are enough choices around the hotel for your choice of meals. Fast food chains and branches of Tsukiji sushi shops are available. (Ok... it's not hotel food, but I am not a fan of hotel restaurants).Staff were friendly and helpful; from lost wallets to packing our wooden samurai 'swords' (my daughter lost her wallet at a nearby mall, and they had called the hotel to inform that someone had found the wallet and ask her to pick it up. The hotel not only informed us, but also followed up with us the next morning, and during check-out).Room amenities were plentiful. I admit I am a sucker for complimentary toothbrushes, & razors; these guys gave more then that, and 1 each for all of us (confession time: we took some back - they were good - the orange batch salts were wonderful).Overall, we were very pleased and impressed with the hotel we stayed for the week.

My four kids and I started our ski trip at this hotel for two nights before heading to Nagano. We arrived very late at Haneda and missed the train and shuttle to hotel. We managed to convince a taxi to take all 5 of us and our luggage to hotel. Cost about 60 USD which was steep but had no choice, at least it was one taxi not two. Upon check in, front desk staff very helpful and rooms were adjacent to each other as per my request. The room sizes were perfect, bathrooms were awesome and had such a lovely supply of amenities! It was like Christmas looking thru the bath basket! We tried bfast both mornings but the lines were long and after peeking at the buffet, we decided to go elsewhere. We ate at the Italian restaurant on site, I would give it a miss: sloooowwww service, mediocre food and ambiance lacking. Location is excellent, lots of shopping nearby, train station next to hotel. Only major complaint, we booked this hotel because of the indoor pool but discovered when we arrived that its only for ages 16 and up. Ridiculous. I would stay again, esp for the rooms and location but if you have kids, don't expect to use the pool.I saw someone mention no free wifi but we had it. Need to ask housekeeping for box to be brought to room.

Not a hotel to write home and tell your friends about, but pretty comfortable and clean. 1000yen (10usd) for the gym is not much, but not sure why should have to pay for use whilst staying in hotel.Best feature:Breakfast buffet with view over Tokyo bay from 30th floor.Worst feature:No Wifi in room - for the height of Japan's technology, this is very poor!

I stayed in early March for 4 nights. The hotel is conveniently located. There is an airport limousine bus that goes to the hotel directly from Narita for about 2,700 yen. The hotel is right next to a metro station. It take about 20-30 minutes to Ginza. There are also 2-3 shopping malls within 10 minutes of walk with many restaurant choices. The hotel service is excellent, in particular, the hotel restaurants. I bought a deal on JTB web site with breakfast included. The breakfast buffet spread is great, especially with the gorgeous view from the 30th floor. Breakfast coupons can also be used for lunch with payment for the price difference. The service at both the 30th-floor Tepanyaki place and the 3rd floor Japanese restaurant are outstanding. I had 3 meals there in total.The minor downside is that the general area is a little too brand new, doesn't have the touch of real Japanese culture, for my taste anyway.

The bar on 30th floor was empty at 5:30 pm. The attendant made a wry face when I wanted to enter. Then, claimed the seat next to the power outlet was reserved all evening. There was not a living soul around anywhere. Just would not let me charge my laptop in the Sky Road. It's the pits - the bar attendant at the Star Road was outright rude. Made an exit and took the next bus to Haneda airport. The general manager: you are not listening and I am not coming back...

I stayed at this hotel with a small tour group for three nights. The rooms were quite spacious and there were many amenities for your use in the bathroom. There was also a room safe in a good sized closet. It was not noisey and very comfortable in the room I had overlooking the harbor with a queen sized bed. The location was close to two shopping malls, each with a 105 yen store and there were also two convenience stores adjacent to the lobby. The train station was just a short walk from the lobby. And there was a free shuttle to Venus Fort, a third shopping mall with attractions for kids and a couple of rides as well as the Toyota museum, which I did not have a chance to visit.Service was good and the staff was very helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffets downstairs as well as on the 30th floor were the usual mix of Japanese and American, and more than ample. I would stay here again.

We had a very comfortable room with a great view in direction to the rainbowbridge. The location of the hotel is not so closed to the citycenter, but very close are the shopping malls of odaiba. The staff was very helpful and obliging. I would go there again.

This is a very classy Hotel. Very close to lot of tourist attractions. Less than 2 mins walk to the train station. The hotel buses are free for the surrounding tourist locations. Walk to the Mall and a great view of the skyline. Very friendly and courteous staff. The hotel has staff to guide the tourist in case they are not very familiar with the city. They map out the whole route and even make print outs for you. Over all a very pleasant experience.

This is a very elegantly appointed hotel with gracious, friendly staff and, whilst not in Central Tokyo, is really quite well located. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending and booking some city tours, providing lots of useful information and the transfer of our luggage was managed most efficiently.The room we had was beautiful if small, but very comfortable with a lovely bathroom and great outlook. It was disappointing and puzzling that the hotel's French restaurant was open only a couple of random nights during our 5 night stay. Disappointing also was the 500 yen charge for a very small glass of milk for our in room coffee.Distance from central Tokyo is not really a problem as Daiba train station is literally at the side door of the Hotel. Trains come along every 10 mins so You can very quickly be in Ginza 15 mins or,as we did, Shibuya 25 mins.There is plenty of shopping opportunities nearby as well with Aqua and Diver City shopping centres within a couple of hundred metres and the hotel's own shopping arcade also worth exploring.We avoided the hotel's buffet breakfast at $35 per head and went for one of the numerous cafes nearby serving excellent pastries etc.All in all, it's pretty good and Yes I'd stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel on our recent trip to Tokyo. Since most city hotels were full we had to choose the Grand Pacific Le Daiba. It's about an hour from the city. The hotel has excellent facilities. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. This hotel has free Wifi only in the lobby area. However, you can request for a router to be installed in your room free of charge for the duration of your stay.There are shopping facilities close by. That said, one has to bear in mind that Tokyo is a very expensive city. Shop only when there is a sale or the offer is too good to resist. If you pay for a room with a good view then you get to see the Rainbow Bridge from the comfort of your room. Otherwise, the breakfast room on the 30th floor gives you an excellent view of the bridge albeit during the day. The hotel merits its five-star status!

For my more complete review of this hotel, please visit:http://ferrystraveladventures.blogspot.com/2013/01/hotel-review-hotel-grand-le-daiba-tokyo.htmlPrice: 8/10First of all, it's quite pricey and might not be your best choice if you are under a budget. It's a five star hotel in Odaiba area in Tokyo.Room: 10/10The room I stayed in was quite big and completely shattered my expectation and assumption that hotel rooms in Tokyo would all bevery tiny and small. Well, I guess the price makes for the spacey rooms.Hotel Staffs: 9/10The hotel staffs are very friendly, nice, and well mannered (I find that most Japanese are very well mannered). However, as an international 5 star hotel, not many of the staffs speak English and the one who speaks English may not have the best spoken English skills. When I tried to find something to do during the New Year's Eve, I asked one of the staffs and had quite a difficulty talking to them. But, they are still the best. In my opinion, they are very very helpful and informative. I can see how they tried very hard to answer my questions and gather as much information as they could to make my time there a great one.Location: (9/10)This hotel is located in a strategic location in Odaiba area. It's close to shopping malls (Diver City, Aqua City), public transits (Daiba Station on Yurikamome Line), amusement park (Joypolis), and a lot of goo restaurants.Views: (9/10)The hotel has some great views. If you are lucky, you can get a hotel room that has a view of the Rainbow Bridge.

Very good location! Lots of shopping malls around the hotel! Beautiful view! annnnd the hotel stuff was very nice and friendly. Check-out is at 12 am what is a big plus for me, I really love to sleep in befor I start a day full of traveling.

First off, let me just clarify that this hotel is not in the heart of Tokyo. With that said, Odaiba itself has plenty of things to do and you could spend a good day or two just exploring the area. If you want access to other parts of Tokyo, for instance, Shinjuku, it will take at least 30 minutes.The hotel lives up to its brand name. Very European feel with great in-room amenities, including an overnight make-up kit for women. They have a convenience store within its property if you want snacks or drinks. I didn't try any of their restaurants though because there are so many cheaper options outside the hotel.Lastly, we used the free Disney shuttle provided by the hotel. Took less than 30 minutes to get there which was quite convenient. You have to reserve a spot at the bell desk but being off season, there was plenty of room.I really enjoyed this hotel. If you're deciding between this and neighboring Nikko Tokyo, it's certainly a toss up but I must say Nikko has a better view of the bay.

Pricey but worth it for its location convenience in Odaiba.1. Affordable 500Yen shuttle buses to Haneda Airport and shuttle to disneyland2. Train/Subway station right in front of hotel (a must to figure out how to use to get around Tokyo, as taxis are too expensive). There's even a free shuttle bus to get around Odaiba.3. Shopping malls with many restaurants right next door.4. Plenty of attractions - Legoland, the Big Ferris Wheel, etcNo wifi only wired LAN internet, but ask them for a wifi-router kit to use in the room.Breakfast is so-so. I would seriously consider saving money and having meals at the restaurants nearby.

Really good value hotel . Booked through hotel's own site ,3nights for 5. Probably worth signing up for the 'I Prefer' that is offered. Doesn't cost anything and gives you free access to gym (1000 yen).Price of food too expensive for us in hotel ( 3000 yen for a breakfast) .If you want to save money then you can get a coffee and something to eat at McDonalds... nearby open 24hrs .. go out via station exit in lobby ,cross bridge over main road then go down steps on right. McDonalds is about two blocks along ,bottom of The Decks building.There is also a general store on corner just as you leave lobby ,also open 24 hrs ,sells just about everything and a really good cake shop.If you you want a few beers late on but dont want to pay the hotel's fancy prices go to the Nande Ya ... open til 4am ! Cheap beer and snacks ( meat skewers etc) big glass of lager (700ml) only 500 yen .They have a menu in English and barman speaks a little English as well. Sit on stools at bar. Its on 1st floor of Aqua City. You can access via Aqua City or from the street (its on block just before McDonalds opposite the TV studio building)Wi Fi in room ,lan connection ,free ,I took a a cheap router (TP Line Router TL WR702N) which is very small and worked really well.The Yurikamome line will take you to Shimbashi ,10 minute walk from there into Ginza. Hundreds of places to eat in Ginza,the lunch sets are tremendous value.Hotel definitely good value for money because of its nice rooms and spacious bathroom. We will stay there again when we next visit Tokyo.

This hotel is huge.Location is near Haneda airport and Disneyland.There is a shuttle bus service to both.Pretty convenient as there are shopping malls nearby and restaurants.If you want to go to town theres a single railway line that runs frequently to Shimbashi which takes about 25minutes and from there you can connect to most of Tokyo.Decor of the hotel is colonialish.Big lobby with restaurants and shops surrounding.Unlike other 5 star hotels that i have stayed in Tokyo there are no bellhops to assist guests with their bags after alighting from the limousine bus.Only when guests walk into the lobby do they offer assistance.Checkin was quick polite but typically japanese style..formal.My room on the 10th floor was on the small side.A queen size bed with chairs placed right next to bed there was hardly any room to move between it.The desk was at the end of the bed and had the tv and the kettle and minibar.Toilet was decent size and they had nice toiletries and alot of amenities like plastic hairbrush and scrub cloth inside a wicker basket.Pillows on the bed was to soft for me and i wokeup with a neckache.Airconditoning worked well and was quiet.The hotel is well maintained and probably a few years old.Clean...but the decor wasnt really to my liking.Caters to mainly tour groups and holiday makers.

I stayed in the hotel for a total of 5 weeks this year (2012) and was very pleased with the -service (friendly) -the room(spacious, quiet, nice bathroom, breathtaking views) -the restaurants (though they are pricey) .. and all the shops around. There is plenty of shops, cinema's, restaurants both cheap and more upper segment. Good connections to the city, expect this takes 30 though. There is a very nice ferry to downtown Tokyo as well. More info. There is wired internet, no WiFi as of 12/12/2012. The tv has an english manual which is really necessary. most programs are in Japanese either original or voiced over. CNN is in English and there are some other international shows. It was a very relaxing place during my intense working weeks in Tokyo.

The staff are wonderful, rooms unusually grand and spacious. We love each visit to the Grand Pacific (this is our 4th time). The boys and I, now 7 and 10, always stay here to catch the latest things that Odaiba has to offer, which is always lots.

Very nice hotel on the artificial island across from Tokyo. You can reach downtown by a monorail train that is frequent and convenient but f you are looking for the hustle and bustle of Tokyo this is quiet and off the beaten tract.Wifi only in lobby and spotty elsewhere, internet is by line and slow. Breakfast upstairs has incredible views but the buffet is pretty ordinary.Japanese sushi on the 3rd floor restaurant was ok but the restaurant was empty.

Stayed here for a week at the end of November, arrived at Narita airport at 0900 and was worried we wouldnt get into our room till after the 1500 checkin time, but it wasnt so.We just missed the direct express bus from Terminal 2 to the Hotel direct so had to wait till about 1045 ( 1 hour wait) bus was fine cost 2700Yen (about £22) was clean efficient and very quick, we were the second stop so got to the hotel around 1200. Got checked in straight away and was taken to the 18th Floor, room was very nice, clean and bathroom was European sized and had a shower and a bath. Had a gtreat view of the bay and the car park below where they were "Drifting" in their souped up cars. Earthquake happened second night just as I got out of the shower...it was an experience but was only a 4.9. Buy a Passmo card for the travel to and from Central Tokyo, its like an oyster card and you can charge it with cash very easily. it works for both the underground and also the private railways. Be sure to catch the last train back to the hotel as a taxi fare is about 5000 yen no matter where you seem to come from. Last train is around midnigth so if you intend to make a night of it be aware of the cost.Stayed in Room 1842, Wifi is Free, not 2000 yen as advised, however you do need to ask reception for a router which they will supply and show you how it works as well.Checkin and checkout were both very quick, bus back to the airport has to be booked beforehand and costs the same 2700 yen each.We would go back in a heartbeat!

Extremely clean and updated hotel, bathroom had a soaking tub & shower and a very fancy toilet/bidet combo. Breakfast was very good, had various American offerrings. Hotel was very quiet and comfortable. I would definately stay here again.

Le Daiba is a very nice 5 star reasonably priced hotel which is perfectly situated near to Tokyo Big Sight. It takes about 16 minutes to travel to Shimbashi station which is next to Ginza area. The area around Le Daiba is not very exciting. Unfortunately wifi is not included and will cost yen2000!/day. Room and bathroom are big !

We spent our one week holiday in Odaiba on December. This hotel is highly reccomended by our friends. Not only its look grand, but also easy if you want to access to the malls, and also have a pretty big convinence store and cafe.Our room is pretty Big too, unlike the hotel rooms in Tokyo. TV channels, bath tub, etc are satisfying.Within walking distance you can go to the train station, walk to the pretty park, rnjoy shopping at the malls.They also provide free shuttle bus to go to many interesting places in Odaiba; science museum, water museum, Toyota Mega Web, etc. even to Disneyland/ sea.Its a wonderful hotel and very memorable to stay there :)

I've stayed at this hotel for 3- nights in business. One of those new hotel in Tokyo, everything is new and clean obviously, my room was on 17th floor and really nice view in a big room, bathroom was nice too. You should try breakfast at top floor, so many choices both western and Japanese foods, buffet style all you can eat, again gorgeous views. One negative thing is transportation, I mean you can walk to shopping malls, a bunch of restaurants, but if you go to Shibuya, Shinjuku, etc. in convenience in access...

I wonder if the management of this hotel reads reviews here.My #1 grouse with this 5* establishment is their service staff on the 30th floor during breakfast. When a guest leaves the table for another helping at the buffet. Please don't take away the fork and knife if it is placed on the serviette. If a guest has finished. The fork and knife is placed on the plate. I was hardly away for 3 mins and found my table completely cleared. I was seated near the entrance, not in the main dining area. I had to go back for a new pair.Room was clean. Bathroom is good. Room has a mini fridge, a kettle and coffee/ tea.No English programmes on TV. Even CNN has Japanese voiceover.Bed is fine but pillows are awfully soft. Didn't sleep well at all during my 4 nights stay.No complimentary bottled water.Complimentary LAN Wired internet so do bring your wifi router. Electricity is 100volts - 2 flat pins.I was in Room #2000Check-in time is 3pm and the hotel staff refused to budge. I sat in the hotel lobby from 09h45 till 3pm. I was too tired to go walk around in the massive Odaiba area. Caucasian Hotel Manager walked around observing things like Darth Vader. Didn't like his body language.

This hotel is in a great location in this area. You are close to the public transportation options. In addition, just outside the hotel you can see the Statue of Liberty (theirs). Shopping and dining options are also available within walking distance.As for the room, internet is free, but you need a router (free for the asking) from reception. Coffee/tea-making facilities and a refrigerator are in the rooms. The bathroom amenities are very nice as well. I didn't find any English channel television stations.Breakfast is in the restaurant at the top of the hotel providing a spectacular view of the city from the 30th floor. They do not open even one minute early though.As indicated in the title, I did experience a 5.8 magnitude earthquake while there. It was a little unnerving. I kept thinking something was wrong with me. And the eerie part was the noise the building made as it settled back down into place.

If you're in Tokyo for day trips and shopping, this may not be the best location as it's about 20-30mins away from the main town area. However, it is peaceful and quiet and facing the waterfront. I notice that many stay here as there is a shuttle bus to Tokyo Disneyland. The prices are definitely cheaper than if you stayed in Disney itself.The rooms are small (usual Tokyo size) but surprisingly, the toilets were much larger than usual. It was pleasant not having to dodge around the door to get from end to end, or hit myself on the basin or such like. The variety available for breakfast is good, to cater to both Asian and Western tastes. If not, there is always a convenience store just downstairs to grab a canned coffee and bun.The train station is connected to the hotel, so that is a plus. There is a shopping mall nearby, but don't expect a great variety of shops. Enough to get by if filling an hour or 2.One grouse i have is that they do not provide free bottled water. You have to purchase bottled water yourself, and recycle the bottles to contain the water from the kettle they provide in the room. Amenities are good though, above average i would say. If you need wifi in the room, do approach the reception to get their wifi kit, which can connect to the LAN in the room and provide wifi for your mobile/ipad right in your room.

Where to start? May be a bit kitsch by today's "sophisticated traveller" standards but it's in a great location (away from the city center but a quick trip by train) with good views of the Tokyo Bay area, has spacious & comfortable rooms, all the necessary amenities and then some, exceedingly friendly, helpful and polite staff.

The Grand Pacific is located a bit of a ways out of the busy Tokyo center, but it is a far cry from being isolated. With a number of malls within walking distance from the hotel, and views of the water, the location is ideal. In comparison to the more urban parts of Tokyo, Odaiba boasts open spaces which is like a breath of fresh air after a long day of scouring the compacted streets in the metropolis.The staff are eager to help with whatever you need and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. If you happen to cross any of the hotel workers (even maids), they'll stop whatever they're doing just to greet you.The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Perhaps my favorite thing about the room is all the free knick-knacks in the bathroom, I've been to my share of hotels and this one had the highest quality and largest assortment of complimentary toiletries I have ever seen.Overall, my stay here was great.
user_name:
Ariane T
Nouméa, null, New Caledonia

review_body: We stayed in the Grand Pacific in December 2011. After a long flight from Ireland we arrived at the hotel at about 11am but the staff did everything they could to get us a room straight away even though we should not have been checking in so early. The rooms were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms luxurious. As one might expect in Japan the staff were on hand to take care of any issues. The train stops right outside the hotel and a 15 minute journey gets you downtown to Shimbashi. Lovely hotel.

The hotel is located in the Odaiba district which is connected to the central Metro and JR line (Shimbashi station) transportation system through the excellent Yurikamome monorail system. Interesting is the ride on the rainbow bridge with that transportation system to Odaiba, which is like a modest theme park ride with nice views of the harbour.There are 2 big shopping malls within 5 minutes walking distance that offer the usual global shopping experience and a wide choice of restaurants as the restaurants in the hotel close early and the Teppan-yaki restaurant was always booked. Tokyo, in general, goes to bed early.The rooms are spacious (again not necessarily Tokyo standard) and the service is excellent. A 24 hour supermarket close to the side (station) entrance to the hotel is a bonus too.On weekends the place is apparently a preferred venue for family celebrations and weddings.
Big and very, very clean rooms. Convenient to go to Disneyland and Disney Sea since hotel provided free shuttle bus. Very near to train station (Yurikamome line)

We have spent four nights at the hotel. Nice hotel, spacious room (our room is for 3 persons, with about 80 feet toilet, ladies skin cleansing set), fantastic day & night sea views. Pleasant & helpful staff. With a convenient store, some gift shops & a cafe within the hotel shopping centre. Suitable for those who wish to visit Disneyland as there are free shuttle bus (advance reservation is required), only about 30 minutes. Monorail station (Odaiba) connected to hotel's main lobby level (only 3 minutes walk, safe and convenient). Shuttle bus to busy metro station (Shinagawa & Tamachi, 200 yen for adult and 100 yen for children, advance reservation is not required, with schedules). Free shuttle tour bus for the area of Odaiba (advance reservation is not required, with schedules). Direct bus to Yokohama station (800 yen for adult & 400 yen for children, reservation is required). Direct airport limousine to & from hotel (to hotel - no reservation is required but advance reservation with hotel for the departure is required). Shopping (Venus Fort, outlet), eating and sight-seeing facilities (rainbow bridge) within Odiaba area. Near Oedo-Onsen Monogatari (a famous hot spring and entertainment tourist spot). Good place for family, couples & friends. My family likes this hotel a lot. Will definitely come back when visit Tokyo next time.

Has a metro station connecting to hotel so very convenient and also buses to Haneda airport for Y500 so that was great. Good rooms. Staff friendly. Rooms good. Internet incl...Breakfast was expensive but nicely done...... Got a good rate through Hotel.com so stayed here.

Grand Pacific is one of few hotels in Tokyo offering big rooms with very valuable rates. The room is 50m2 and the beds are very comfy. Even though it's a bit dated for some furnitures it still clean and in good maintenance. The breakfast is ok with very nice view of Tokyo skyline. The location is a bit far from center Tokyo but you can reach within 20minutes train with Yurikamome Line. If your flight is through Haneda, it is very convenient location since it's just 15minutes away by airport limousine bus. The surrounding areas is full of entertainment and shopping, finding food is very easy. They even have free shuttle bus to Disneyland and back. Very recommended hotel who looking for reasonable rate with big room.
Room is spacious, clean & new. Short distance from Disneyland. Close to shopping complex. Breakfast on 30th floor is very good. Also have traditional Japanese breakfast at 3rd floor.

The Grand Pacific Le Daiba is a nice hotel, especially when enjoying the views from the 30th floor when having an excellent breakfast. However, please make sure you are aware this hotel is located on Odaiba, an artificial island off the coast of Tokyo. The hotel is located right next to a monorail stop, however it still takes 15 to 20 minutes to reach most touristic sights in Tokyo.Now, this is not a problem at all once aware and the positive side is that the hotel offers fantastic views over the harbor and Tokyo, as well as offering an unusual amount of free space around the hotel. There is a large promenade along the water front and green space right next to the hotel, something quite unique in Tokyo.Rooms were a little bit small and had basic furnishing, but the amenities in the bathroom were very extensive. Most important, the bed was really comfortable and the room could be made totally dark, a big plus. Given the quality of the nights sleep, I would not look any further for a hotel in Tokyo when you want to be close to the action, but not really in the middle of it.Rooms were equipped with wired internet access, which was dead slow, but other than that absolutely nothing to fault. Recommended!

From the moment we stepped out of the taxi to leaving the hotel, it was an experience we'll never have in the USA without paying an arm and leg. Spacious, clean, luxurious rooms, excellent and friendly staff - we were very surprised with how great the service and staff made us feel. The view from our room was spectacular both day and night. There's a 24-hour convenience store, some other shops and pastries just outside the hotel. Located a short walk between Aqua City and DiverCity/Palette Town shopping areas and connected by the bridge, there's plenty of food and shopping experience. Along the Odaiba park and coast, you can take a round trip relaxing boat ride to the Tokyo side and back to Odaiba. Will definitely stay here again and again and again!
Truly beautiful hotel with very spacious rooms. Great view, including the Mount Fuji. Free shuttle to the Tokyo Disneyland. The hotel is located next to the train station and the shopping centres.

Good large hotel. You get an excellent view from the 30th floor restaurant. However like all hotels the food and drinks are expensive, £20 for breakfast buffet & not that special.Staff friendly & helpful.

Very spacious, clean and luxurious room and bathroom. Provides an array of toiletries and daily newspaper. View was great too (Rainbow Bridge side). Connected to the main city by Yurokamome Line. We were able to take advantage of their free bus service to Disneyland. It also has a convenient store located on the back entrance (Yurikamome Line side).

Why I chose this hotel this time, is because I was traveling with my daughter (8 year old) and wanted to take her to Tokyo Disney Sea and Odaiba, in two days. On the 1st day after enjoying Tokyo Disney Sea, we were able to move to the hotel by free bus (need prior reservation!), and we could arrive at the hotel so comfortably. The plan I purchased (via internet) is souvenir double room with no mails. The price was far more reasonable than the official one, so you definitely should go to internet and seek for the special discount. The hotel is functional, spacious and clean, with well trained staff. It has convenience store near the lobby. You can use LAN, but Wi-Fi is not provided (cannot use iPad with Wi-Fi only). SoftBank connection is available, so at least I could use my iPhone. Also I should mention the hotel provides fine towels and amenities. Especially nice is the location. It was perfect for us. 10am we checked out and went to Fuji Television Building. after that we went to Decks Beach Tokyo, where we can enjoy the retro Japanese lifestyle, and Takoyaki Museum. Then we went back to the hotel to pick up our language and then moved to the 'pier' from where we can enjoy Tokyo Cruise to Asakusa.

Booked 2 rooms for my colleague n myself. We both had our wife n kids (3 for him n 2 for me), hence we gotten a 3 bedders, which is pretty rare to have in Tokyo.The room size is fantastic, big enough for 3 super single w some more to spare. The toilet is huge! Big surprise for Tokyo.I booked here as it is a Disney good neighbour hotel, so there are free shuttle to the park, which is a big plus considering it is ex to move around in Tokyo. Daiba area itself comes w good shopping area like Aquacity n Venus Fort, so good for those looking to do some shopping without heading to town. Overall great place to stay! Nice scenery too!
